Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone or email with the contact details below.   I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: This is a lovely hotel with great staff  across the board. The receptionists, porters, managers, bar staff and breakfast staff are great to deal with. The restaurant has been leased out to a steakhouse and I think they've done a great job too.  Lovely pool, gym & newly decorated rooms (the rooms were re-done in the last year and they're great).   Hotel is very central and sits alongside college green, fenced in by two lovely old buildings and there are many lovely places to eat in walking distance.
Date of Review: Robert T wrote a review Mar 2019
Comment Title: I've stayed here many times & highly recommend it

Comments: This Is a busy hotel which means you wait at reception and you wait for lifts. My room had no fire safety information on the door or any I could find apart from generic paragraphs in the room info pack. This made me feel nervous on the fourth floor. No heated towel rails so damp towels over night . One teabag  in the room but housekeeping quickly sent up more on request. Minimal toiletries. The overall feel wasn't luxurious but it was functional. Eating in Miller and Carter restaurant wasn't a good experience.  Checking out wasn't a good experience either as the restaurant bill couldn't be substantiated .The restaurant is a franchise separate to the hotel and communication between the two seems poor. Next time I visit Bristol I will be trying somewhere different.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 4 Mar 2019
Response comment: Dear SueCambridge2014,  Thank you for your feedback.   I can clearly see from your comments that you were left dissapointed following your recent stay. I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations during your recent stay. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.   Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further please do not hesitate to let me know.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Stayed for one night midweek for a birthday celebration on a room only basis.  On arrival, found we had received an upgrade to a superior room, which was very nice. Another pleasant surprise on entering our room was a welcome card with a half bottle of white wine and a tin of fudge.  Bathrobes and slippers as well. Another plus was our room was on the 3rd floor with views overlooking the water and Watershed area, across to the Bristol Hotel and floating harbour. The hotel has been redecorated over the last year, so the room was clean and in excellent condition.  The bathroom contained a large shower, but no bath.  Only negative, was the light could be brighter for shaving.   Finding the car park entrance was fun, drove around three times and had to call in the end to find out

Great location and a nice property, as you would expect from a Marriott. The interrior is grand and there are some good event spaces upstairs. The main event room is beautiful. The bedrooms are spacious and well appointed. It's a big hotel and there was quite a walk to my room which I enjoyed but you need to be wary if you don't like walking. The staff that I met were all pleasant and helpful.   The problem is that you get charged for parking and charged if you want to use the wifi. I haven't had the latter issue in years, wifi comes as standard usually. With the parking charge (reduced to £17!) being your first interaction with the hotel the whole thing leaves you feeling like you're the victim of a shakedown rather than the valued guest of a premium hotel for which you've

As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the relevant hotel teams to review these policies moving forward.  Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further please do not hesitate to let me know. Comments: Lovely hotel in a great location but yet again a cold breakfast which they did nothing to remedy and refused to refund saying that the restaurant is not owned by the hotel so they cannot.  Eventually managed to get them to refund my car parking as compensation but did not feel that adequate for two breakfasts we could not eat.

Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone or email with the contact details below.   I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: We spent a pre booked night at this hotel.  It is a great location with fine bedrooms and a level of grandeur.  We were disappointed on 2 counts.  We had booked the hotel because it includes a swimming pool.  We learn that the hotel pool has not been in use for several weeks.  If we had been told this at the time of reserving we would have booked elsewhere.  We were given a discount when we complained.  But that misses the point. Secondly we had planned an anniversary dinner in the restaurant.  We were not able to do so, because the restaurant was fully booked. We compensated with an excellent afternoon tea.  Again not part of our plan.  This is an expensive hotel and it failed to give us value for money.
Date of Review: Keith B wrote a review Mar 2019
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 2 Mar 2019
Response comment: Dear Keith B,  Thank you for your feedback.   I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations during your recent stay, in particular regarding the closure of the Leisure Club and the fact the restaurant was fully booked. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard and that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.   Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further please do not hesitate to let me know and I would be happy to speak to you at a time of your convenience.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback.  Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Having stayed in Bristol a few times before, we thought we would stay in the Marriott Royal as it is a grand, characterful building with a pool, sauna and spa treatments available.  We stayed on a Saturday night and planned to  use the facilities after breakfast.  However, the pool was closed (not on their website or communicated to us during booking) and there are no spa treatments available on Sundays.  The breakfast was average, we have had better in the Premier Inn and the parking (£17 for one night) is expensive. On a positive note, the room was clean and comfortable and the location on College Green was good for us.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 26 Feb 2019
Response comment: Dear jpaulag,  Thank you for your feedback.    I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize for falling short of your expectations during your recent stay. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.   Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further please do not hesitate to let me know.   Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com 0117 9255100

Comments: I booked the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel for a recent gig at the O2 Academy which is only a two minute walk away. Check in was easy and effortless and we were quickly in our room. The room was nice and had everything that was expected and was extremely clean, even the date stickers on the bed sheets of when they were washed. A nice touch having a bottle of water with the beverage making facilities. We were disappointed that the swimming pool wasn't in use during our visit as this was one of the main reasons we had booked this hotel on this visit. We had breakfast in the restaurant which was definitely worth the price and the choice was amazing, certainly a breakfast to set you up for the day. Overall we had a good stay but personally for the money you pay, you really don't get

We stayed her over our wedding weekend (the wedding happened elsewhere).  we booked a suite and this had an attached separate living room. The room was high quality and overall we couldn't fault the hotel.
Comment Title: A very good place to stay in Bristol

Comments: We have stayed in this hotel on numerous occasions since 2006. It's good to see that there has been an investment for a refurbishment of the hotel, however disappointing for us was that the baths have been removed in many of the rooms. The staff in this hotel are excellent and the lady on reception managed to find a room with a bath.  Another change not particularly to our liking was the replacement of the hotel restaurant with a Miller and Carter steakhouse where breakfast is served. We are far from vegetarians but been surrounded with pictures, signs and aprons that glorify eating steak was a bit much at breakfast. We were not impressed with the breakfast offerings of tinned fruit with very little fresh fruit available. The only bread available was sliced loaves for toasting.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from jessoakleymarriott, AFOM at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 24 Feb 2019
Response comment: Dear LauraDaveJames  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel and providing your honest feedback.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologise for falling short of meeting your expectations.  I am glad to hear that you found the staff excellent and that they managed to get you a room with a bath.  We hope to welcome you back the next time you visit Bristol  Kind regards,  Jess

Comments: Our recent stay (Sunday 17th Feb- Tuesday 19th Feb) was the most disappointing hotel experience we have had for some years. We had decided to book somewhere a little more 'upmarket' from our usual Premier Inns having seen a deal via booking.com. We won't be back to a Marriott in a hurry though.  The room seemed decent enough on the face of it and our late check in was facilitated ok. No complimentary bottle of mineral water to be found in the room which you might expect from a hotel charging around £130+ per night.  However, things got worse. There was a weird persistent drone noise (Like a washing machine at full spin and a very intrusive noise) which continued the whole of our stay which kept my wife and I awake all night. More of that later.  In the morning my wife went for a
Response from hotel staff:
Response from jessoakleymarriott, Assistant Front Desk Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 24 Feb 2019
Response comment: Dear manxjourneys  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel and providing your honest feedback on the Guest Satisfaction Survey.   Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations.   Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: So I had such a horrific experience at this hotel it can’t be the usual otherwise I don’t see how they would be open!   I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. When I checked in I was given room 1276. On the second day I received a letter asking me to come to reception, which I did, and I was informed some maintenance was required on the room and asked if I could move rooms. I informed the lady at reception that this was inconvenient as I had a lot of work to do and that I would request they wait on the maintenance or simply work around my belongings.   I returned to the hotel on the third night to find that my room key didn’t work, on returning to reception I was informed that the hotel had ignored my request and moved my belongings to a different room, and that someone else had
Comment Title: Never been treated so horribly by a hotel.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from jessoakleymarriott, Assistant Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 20 Feb 2019
Response comment: Good morning CW1547  Thank you for your recent review of the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team in regards to the issues you mentioned above  If you wish to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to contact the hotel and ask for me.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback.  Sincerely,  Jess Oakley

Comments: The Royal is located in the centre of Bristol. Close to the Hippodrome, Aquarium and a variety of restaurants and bars.   Hotel was easy to find and the room was ideal and clean.  The bar/restaurant within the hotel is Miller and Carter (breakfast buffet if you opt for it).   Hotel receptionist very friendly- even had a free room upgrade and free parking which was a great treat and will use again.

Stayed at the hotel on the wekend. There was a mistake on the booking (my end), I was supposed to be there friday at 4pm but turned up saturday the receptionist was very friendly and helpful and managed to find me and my partner a room for the night on the mezzanine floor. We stayed for one night and breakfast in the morning, Which was thrown in for free  ( maybe the felt sorry for us), Which we appreciated very much a selction of continental and full english, ceral and fruit all good quality and fresh.  The room was very clean and a good size. Lots of towels nice smelling toiletries. Facelities to make tea or coffee. The reception of the hotel is very grand and has a good looking interior, a pleasent aroma of lemons wafts around the building where ever you go. We parked in the

Having been a regular to this hotel for the last 15 years I am saddened to think that this is likely to be my last stay based on our experiences over the last two days.   Restaurant- busy , but booked in advance. If we had not I think I would have been upset at not being able to eat in the hotel restaurant if a paying resident at the hotel. We saw a few people turned away during our meal. Food was ok , starter very poor did not help that the poor waitress chucked our garlic bread on the floor. Had our hungry 5 year old with us , so by the time our bread arrived we had finished the very small sharing board. I was not impressed as a guest to hear the staff and management having a heated discussion regarding another customers disputed drinks bill. Completely unacceptable it was
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 17 Feb 2019
Response comment: Dear TA-User22Oct2018,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.   It is clear from your comments that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone or email with the contact details below. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com 0117 9255100

Comments: Had a great stay here with friendly welcoming staff! Breakfast could have been prepared better though as arrived cold. But other than that all was well in regards to service and the room was clean and comfortable.

My wife and I recently stayed in this hotel for a couple of days to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  I had mentioned in the booking that it was a special occasion and from the moment we arrived the staff were extremely kind. They had clearly noted that it was a special occasion and went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The room was lovely, spacious and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location with lots of excellent bars and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel.  Overall, you may pay a little more to stay here than in a budget hotel, but the location is superb and the staff were friendly, professional and incredibly kind; the quality of the hotel shone through in the attitude of the people who worked there. I would definitely recommend staying
Comment Title: A lovely stay with friendly staff

Comments: Tried out the newly renovated Royal Superior Room.  Overall it was an enjoyable stay, the room was recently renovated but lacked the bath as available in the lower cost deluxe rooms.  The recent renovation had modernised the room but needs snagging.  Broken door latch, cupboard doors not closing as catching on lower doors, tv kept going unresponsive and freezing (system not the signal) only 4 random Nespresso coffee pods for 2 people, shame about the bath but overall a nice room with a mini fridge but would never book this over a deluxe room again due to lack of bath, only noticeable difference was a small bottle of red wine, Nespresso machine and a desk.  Corridors had smoke alarms still taped over and emergency keys left in the emergency door buttons.   Breakfast in the new
Comment Title: Lost it’s polish and not Royal standard
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 5 Feb 2019
Response comment: Dear FamilyFromtBristol,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  From your comments I can clearly see that the service you received during your recent stay did not meet your expectations. For this, I sincerely apologize.  The experience you described is not characteristic of the level of service our associates strive to provide. I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to prevent this issue from occurring in the future.  Please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via phone anytime at 0117 9255100. I look forward to speaking with you in order to restore your confidence in the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com 0117 9255100

Comments: I stayed in this hotel for one night on the 1st of February with my husband and parents due to our flight being cancelled. The check in at the hotel was simple / quick and stress free with friendly staff.   Both the swimming pool and hot tub were out of order much to our disappointment, although we were able to use the Sauna and Steam room.   The room itself, was located on the ground floor, and seemed as if it was a room that was not used very often. Despite the high number of extra guests in the hotel, there were dirty socks left in the wardrobe as well as a half-eaten cake. The bed, shower and room itself was fine, though could do with some modernisation (carpets in the hall).  We did use room service, and everything was as expected, professional and prompt and reasonably

For the price they charge I think staying somewhere else is better. I must say the rooms were good and clean. But thats about it. 1. One of the lift to bedrooms did not work so that means you wait for ever to get to your room. 2. The pool was out of action and it did no reflect on my price of booking. 3. The breakfast menu was limited, I have seen better menu in cheaper hotels. 4. You had to queue for breakfast even though there were empty tables because the hotel did not bother to put extra staff for sitting guests. 5. If you want espresso with breakfast it is extra not part of breakfast. 6. The front desk lacks trained staff as they had tough time checking me out.  I gave them a feedback and they said they will refund 20% of my stay which I accepted. But I feel that is not
Date of Review: Soumen Mandal wrote a review Feb 2019
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 1 Feb 2019
Response comment: Good evening Soumen M  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us, I am sorry to hear that your experience was not what you expected. Please be assured that I have passed the feedback to the relevant departments to make sure that this issues are isolated.  Kindest regards,

Comments: Stayed here for a friend's 50th birthday, initial parking was a pain as spaces are tight and there are some inconsiderate people parking (who should be charged double for blocking spaces) but eventually found spaces three levels down.   Walking to the hotel from the car park was a little confusing as was a distinct lack of signs whilst some corridors were being painted. Parking prices are extortionate @£17 a night whilst staying there... Certainly NOT appealing!!... (Captive audience syndrome - make them pay over the odds because you can).  Check-in was a bit slow and they require a £50 deposit on the room which is pretty much their way of holding your money for payment for parking, refund of the balance is returned to your card  on departure. Even though my car registration was
Comment Title: Lovely Hotel, but Pool and Jacuzzi out of action and expensive parking
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 28 Jan 2019
Response comment: Dear MarkyMark-Scunny  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel and providing your honest feedback.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams.  If you wish to discuss any of the matter's further please do not hesitate to call the hotel and ask fro myself or one of the other managers.  Once again, thank you for your valued feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.  Sincerely,  Jess Oakley

Comments: Stayed here for one night and chose this hotel purely for the location as we were going to a show at the hippodrome. We parked in the hotel car park and it’s very obvious the steps and corridors are being decorated. There were dirty dust sheets all over the floors and only ‘wet paint’ signs at the top by the hotel entrance,not as you enter from the car park . Not a great first impression..At reception we had to wait a long time to check in and were surprised we had to pay a £50 deposit. The lift is very slow and it doesn’t help when you have to wait For the next one because the house keepers are in there with their big trolleys. Our room was a long way from the lift and although it had recently been refurbished was very dark. The bathroom was very nice , clean and modern.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 27 Jan 2019
Response comment: Hello Shortyk05  Thank you for choosing the Bristol Marriott Hotel and for your positive and constructive feedback of the hotel and the Miller and Carter restaurant.  Your feedback has been shared accordingly and we appreciate this information.  If you wish to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to call me at the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley  AFOM

Comments: Very attentive staff. Really great restaurant. Comfy bed and spacious room.  However we really enjoyed our 2 days there. Staff kept our luggage as we arrived earlier and really did attend to our needs . Would definitely stay there again.
Date of Review: James Napier wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: First the positives, a very clean hotel, friendly staff and a feeling of luxury. However I do have a couple of "niggles" - we booked as two couples in two rooms based on a B & B basis and this was confirmed at check-in (which, by the way seemed to take a very long time) so imagine by surprise and embarrassment when we were informed at breakfast time that only one meal had been booked !, luckily I had the bill in my pocket which showed what we'd paid for, but how can this happen ?. Secondly the TV didn't work and we only discovered this in the morning, bit of a pain but that's life and we informed reception at departure. But all in all we'll be back next time we visit Bristol
Date of Review: Brian W wrote a review Jan 2019
Comment Title: On the who very good, but .........

Comments: ﻿"This is a lovely convenient hotel for the waterside area of Bristol
Image: I’d love to stay again but am anxious as I slept or not as is the case on the most uncomfortable bed. Full of rock hard lumps and not enough pillows or bedding. Very disappointing."
Name of Reviewer: Ruth K wrote a review Jan 2019
Date of Stay: Lovely hotel shame about the bed
Response from hotel staff: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.
Response time:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 22 Jan 2019
Response comment: Responded 22 Jan 2019
column15: This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC.

Comments: On arriving at the hotel (13th January 2019 for a 2 night business trip) from outside it looked impressive, parking was great and the hotel reception area certainly had a grand feel about it.   The fire alarm went off twice early hours so not great.   The room was freezing, the heating in the room did not work, had to request a heater. My room was on the mezzanine. Went go to the gym in the lift,  the sign said lower ground but guess what, no gym. Asked a member of staff to be told the sign was wrong, had to go up to ground floor walk across to reception and take that lift down to the gym. Please change the sign.   The staff I spoke with where very nice but the hotel seems to be a bit dysfunctional, you don’t get the feeling of efficiency.   There was a grand room being set up
Comment Title: Has potential to be great but not there yet
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 22 Jan 2019
Response comment: Dear Spiccou  Thank you for your recent review of the hotel and for your feedback in regards to the issue you experienced with the heating. I will pass your feedback onto Miller and Carter in regards to the experience there.  I'm glad you found the wedding room to be beautiful and the staff nice.  If you would like to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to contact the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess

Comments: Well, city centre hotels are always hit and miss. This one is well situated but needs some work.  It’s clearly a shadow of its former self.  The mix between modern and traditional doesn’t work. There’s some refurbishment ongoing and as a result the whole place just feels shabby.  But you get what you pay for so buyer beware.  But we didn’t bank on the fire alarm going off on the first night and then again on the second! Between 0400 and 0600 both night! We’ll not be going back.
Comment Title: Fire alarm went off both nights!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 20 Jan 2019
Response comment: Dear GingerArab,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. I will make sure that this incidents are taken care off and that they will not happen in the future.  Please let us know if you need anything else,  Regards

Comments: So I have stayed many times at this hotel. It is a very beautiful hotel but the only thing that does let it down is the noise outside. I had an exec room facing the road. But unfortunately on a Saturday night the bar over the road does not close until 3 am. So there was a lot of noise. Which made it near impossible to sleep and kept myself / wife and children up,
Comment Title: Great hotel shame about the noise outside
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Jan 2019
Response comment: Good morning marcstevens134,  Thank you for sharing with us your feedback, which I have passed to our engineering department to make sure that the isolation in the rooms is correct. Please let me know in advance the next time that you want to stay with us and we will allocate you in a room facing other side of the building.  Kindest regards,

Comments: This is one of the best night stays I’ve had in a while. Everything was spot on. Stayed for one night for husband perfect.  The staff were lovely and put a little surprise in our room for him. The location is great....Parking was easy, arrival was quick & easy. Room was lovely.  Nothing was too much trouble!   Will be staying again
Date of Review: Laura B wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: This was our first trip to Bristol and as such we decided to try what we believed would be a better standard of hotel, sadly we've had better experiences in budget hotels.  Arriving at the hotel first impressions are good, the building is grand and the on site parking is a bonus, it's reasonable in terms of the location and at the time of writing it was £17.00 for overnight parking .The lobby are is clean and well maintained, it has a high class feel to the hotel with a smart looking tea room and cocktail bar directly off the lobby area.   Staff were efficient and friendly and our room was ready early which was a bonus.  The room itself was the standard room on offer, it was clean and well maintained and the bed comfortable. It had basic amenities which was fine as we were

Arrived early so couldn't check into the room but fortunately on popping the toilet before heading into town we noticed that the pool and saunas were out of action. Having specifically booked this hotel to use these facilities we decided to ask if there was anything they could do. They immediately said they could check availability at the other Marriot and move us if we'd like. They managed to rearrange our booking for us to stay there instead which worked out really well.

stayed for one night for our anniversary bit of a blip at first as our deluxe suite was not ready on time and we had a reservation at a nearby restaurant  after going back to the desk 3 times the manager upgraded our room and we got the key straight away the room was a king suite it was lovley the  breakfast next morning was very good cannot understand some of the reviews on here we found all of the staff very helpful and nice we will definatley be back
Date of Review: teaman h wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: My daughter and her partner stayed here on 5th January for one night.  The first thing they discovered was that leisure facilities were not open ‘due to unforeseen circumstances’ maybe this should have been mentioned when booking (which was booked on 4th). Next a deposit of £50 was taken on her debit card in case of extras purchased to be refunded on check out .......she still has not received this payment back into her bank account (nothing extra spent) - in our own business when we refund a customer on their card it is almost immediately back in their bank account ......apparently this is different with this hotel?! I do not believe this is right and definitely not fair and their response was very dismissive.  Because of their treatment of our daughter my husband and I will

Firstly when we arrived at the Hotel and proceeded down the entrance to the carpark. I realised we would be charged £17 for parking, this was not made clear on the website, I saw "self parking" and assumed there would be no valet parking. Check in was a bit confusing as most hotels allow 14:00 check ins, we arrived at 13:45 to be told we couldn't check in until 16:00, not a great hardship but we had travelled a while and could have used a freshen up, shower etc. Leisure suite was closed along with the pool due to "unforeseen circumstances". We were offered a free Taxi to another hotel for a shower/swim but we were on a schedule and couldn't fit an hours excursion into our itinerary. We attended our meeting and returned back to Bristol Marriott Royal, checked in and were
Date of Review: Colin H wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: We always stay at this wonderful hotel ,a short walk from the harbour and main shopping area ,the rooms are light and airy and decorated tastefully,the staff are first class and the whole experience is just amazing ,we have tried various other hotels however this hotel is of a higher standard than most .....
Date of Review: Deborah M wrote a review Jan 2019
Comment Title: This is our favourite place to stay in Bristol ,the surrounding area is just beautiful

Comments: We did one over night stay on our way top Cornwall. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had dinner in the restaurant which was good, we arrived 1 hour late due to traffic and they kindly saved the table.
Date of Review: Emma McIntosh wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: We stayed one night on the 30th Dec, lovely looking hotel and great welcome at reception with very polite helpful staff. The room was very nice but as we were getting ready to use the spa the room started to vibrate, it sounded like a washing machine on spin. We left the room in the hopes it would stop and went to the spa. Again polite helpful staff but the facilities are extremely drab and dated. The pool was cold as they had had a leak through ceiling and had had to drain and refill, mops and buckets were left at end of pool, the jacuzzi was out of order, the room was cold and damp with paint peeling off of the walls and ceiling, not a pleasant spa experience.. On return to room, noise had not stopped, reported it to Simon the supervisor who looked into it, apparently the room

Stayed here for family gathering before christmas ... only just reopened and still under renovation ...  Rooms clean and ok... perhaps next in line for refurbs?  note that everything NOT a bedroom is not actually controlled by Marriott ... thats all the bars and restaurants... its basically a marriott by concession.  However for central Bristol its a good hotel with excellent location and generally helpful and friendly staff.
Date of Review: Robert M wrote a review Jan 2019
Comment Title: Good City Centre option with very good dining

Comments: Booked a deal for family room to meet up with friends.. turned out to be decent value for money..   Great location, nice rooms, really nice bar area and great meal in steak restaurant in evening, realy nice helpfull and attentive staff.. Easy parking on site and reasonable price.   Pool out of action which was bit of shame but these things happen and alternative Marriott pool was an option.   Only one real negative...... Went to breakfast and was told on entering the restaurant that kids have to pay and were not included in price of room.. (this was not the case as clearly part of deal when booked) the realy uptight restaurant manager was not having any of it and because of her aggressive stance we didn’t even bother arguing.. simply said fine charge the room.. she seriously

We can’t give the hotel an ‘excellent’ as the breakfast wasn’t good but as platinum elite members we had a fantastic upgrade and loved our one bedroom suite. Room was spotless, attractive, and very comfortable. Marriott Staff were very friendly and helpful. We requested a bottle opener which was brought to the room instantly.  Great location and parking on site (£16 per night). Room was very quiet even on NYE despite being so centrally located. Temp in room was spot on.  Breakfast choices particularly for fruit, pastries etc was limited. Coffee took a long time to arrive and wasn’t hot. But these were minor issues for us as we had a lovely three night stay.
Date of Review: Karen C wrote a review Jan 2019

Comments: Following our excellent stay two years ago, we returned to find this hotel failing the basics. Lack of food at breakfast  and waiting for our coffee to be served for over 20 minutes. The pool resembled a public lido with unsupervised kids breaking all rules. We booked this hotel specifically for the health centre facilities which were locked at 7pm on new year's eve, just before the adult session as an all of the sudden technical issue occurred. I could go on about the lack of staff and evident bad management. A waste of money and constant inconvenience. Glad we are departing tomorrow and as Marriott members we won't be returning.
Comment Title: Horrible stay, bad management. This hotel is going downhill!

Comments: Would have had 5 out of 5 as usual but there was some work going on that meant there were no log fires lit and it was looking a bit tired. Staff could not be faulted, very friendly and professional. Do not like the idea of handing over £50 out of my bank account "just in case you use any of the room services during your stay". I don't expect my honesty to be questioned which is what this policy appears to do. I refused to allow this to happen and the reception did not insist on it. If you want my custom, don't ask me again for this, it is not respectful. The room was lovely as usual, luxurious and comfortable. Plenty of hot water and the heating was very welcome. We were shopping so it is a welcome courtesy to be able to leave our bags for dropping off and picking up when we
Comment Title: Love this place and stay here nearly every year in November for Christmas shopping.

Comments: Positives: great old builiding with character. Nicely decorated inside. Rooms are your standard marriot hotel rooms. Negatives: room was not clean when we entered and never cleaned while there. Only bathroom and beds were made. Hair balls, tags from new clothes, dust was there from the beginning and never vacuumed or dusted. Ugly: a hotel of this price cannot have just one person at breakfast to do the sitting, take room numbers, take drink orders, and do some serving. It took us 35 minutesl! to be seated. We ate and finished before getting our coffee. That was for 2 days out of the 4 there. What was crazy was that tables were available. But one person only...as I said. For its. Price not acceptable.

This was my favourite hotel in Bristol. I used to love Swallow Hotels. Then they were taken over by Marriott. They destroyed the Swallow in Birmingham within a year and have been steadily ‘improving’ the Royal too. They have stripped out the character, painted the place brown and grey, replaced the room fittings with crap and sold out the restaurant and bar to Millers and Carter. It is truly awful, vulgar and uncomfortable whereas it used to be cosy and warm and welcoming. The staff are also now untrained children and judging by the upkeep, tidiness and cleanliness totally lacking leadership. The pool area was partly closed off, the pool I am told now opens at 8am tomorrow (yes a work day) and was poorly maintained, towels and litter everywhere, lighting poor, water cold and
Date of Review: Jeremy J wrote a review Dec 2018
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 31 Dec 2018
Response comment: Dear Toqiz,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that your experience was not as expected, must of all from a well experienced guest in our property.   I have passed your comments to the respective managers to make sure that this issues are isolated and will not happen again in the future.  Kindest regards,

Comments: Our room was cold and there was only a sheet on our bed. We asked for a duvet but received a smelly brown blanket instead. The swimming pool was closed for most of our stay and this was the reason why we had chosen the hotel in the first place.  The lift broke half way through our stay. On our last day we returned from a day out to discover the housekeeping hadn't been done and we had no toilet paper. Our room was dull, little natural light and dark brown walls. We left a day early due to being so uncomfortable. On a positive note the breakfast was very nice and when I complained on our departure we were refunded the cost of the car parking which was most appreciated. We will not be returning however. Expected so much more from a 4 star hotel.

We stayed here between Christmas and New Year as a night away from the children. Location was great and close to the part of Bristol we wanted to be (waterfront) for our food and drink visits. The room was comfortable and well decorated. My only concern was the wait for check in which was around 20 minutes. I think this may be a regular thing depending upon when you arrive as later on in the evening there was a similar challenge for those checking in then.
Date of Review: David P wrote a review Dec 2018
Comment Title: Great location unfortunately check in was a bit slow

Comments: Stayed for a Christmas break with our family. We booked two triple rooms. Each room had two double beds & were across the corridor from each other. Rooms were spacious, had fridges , robes & slippers. Well appointed bathrooms. The communal spaces were good, with a busy bar but plenty of seating. The bedrooms were a long way from the reception areas, but were quiet. The hotel was obviously very busy. This resulted in queues at breakfast & running out of food items. There was also a long queue at check out. Minor points that didn't detract from an otherwise good stay.

We have just spent a couple of nights here as a family of 4. The shared room was a very good size with excellent facilities. It looked like it had been refurbished and was lovely and clean. The location is great ... a few minutes from the quay, shops, restaurants etc....the staff are friendly, polite and accommodating  The only reason this didn’t get a 5 from us is that the pool was out of action for most of our trip. This was for unforeseen circumstances but it was one of the reasons why we chose this hotel, so this was disappointing. The queue for breakfast was also long. Breakfast itself however was very good. We can recommend this hotel and would look at staying there again when next in the area.
Date of Review: C James wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: Ok, so when we check in the receptionist asked if we would like a room on a high floor or she had a “river view” room available. We choose the river view. The fact they cAll such a room river view is a joke. My partner had to point out the river as it was the size on a A4 paper and under a restaurant over the ground!!! Barely a river in sight. The room itself was nice and modern with lots of room.  The poor area wasn’t great either. Upon arrival the receptionist was missing. We decided to take towels from the side for him to appear and be very awkward with us. The changing rooms were dirty and small and the men’s were being renovated so the men had to use the gents toilets! The pool isn’t like the images on the their site and the gym is open to members and very, very tiny!   The

At 11:15, doors are closed. After buzzing, you then need to queue in line for 25’ to check in. They don’t find your reservations at once. Elevators don’t work. Wifi does not work. Probably more surprises to come. Marriott ? Come on. This does not rate a one star service. The sooner this sorry excuse of a hotel closes, hopefully from overabundance of disgruntled customers, the better off the Marriott chain will be.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 28 Dec 2018
Response comment: Good morning jdill,  We are sorry to hear that your arrival experience was not as good as expected. We have passed the feedback to the management of the respective teams and we will make sure that it doesn't happen again.  Kindest regards,

Comments: We stayed for three nights over Christmas.  Parking is good and at £16per night reasonably priced for the city. Welcome and check-in polite and efficient.  A lift was out of action to our section of the hotel so we usually had to wait longer than one would like.  On our first trip up to the fourth floor the lift stopped at the second floor where a chamber maid pushed her large service trolley in talking loudly and continuously on her phone, she got out at the fourth ahead of us then pushed back in saying to her phone that she was on the wrong floor and should have been on the second (where she had come from!).  She never acknowledged us or apoligsed for pushing in,pushing out and then pushing in again.  This set the tone for sloppy room cleaning.  Our room had some cleaning gear

We booked for two nights in a superior king room which was newly created. The room was lovely and large and very clean. Bed more hard than we are used to but bed linen very clean. Unfortunately our stay was marred by several issues with our room. 1st being the room was too hot (25degrees) and the heating was off, no air conditioning so in the Summer this room will be unbearable. 2nd issue was the ventilation in the bathroom was shut off so the heat condensation from the bathroom made the bedroom hotter! Engineers couldn’t fix these issues. 3rd issue was more of a safety issue , the half door over the fridge repeatedly got pushed off it’s hinges when opened, it just missed my husbands foot, if it hadn’t we’d have been at A&E as the doors are extremely heavy. Again the engineers
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 23 Dec 2018
Response comment: Dear Mansy64,  Thank you for your recent review of your stay with us at, I am sorry to hear of the issues you have had and will certainly pass this over.  If you wish to discuss this any further then please do not hesitate to contact myself at the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess

Comments: Where do I begin..... We booked the family room over 2 months ago online. Having stayed at the city Marriott before that removed the jacuzzi we thought try the Royal as it has swimming and jacuzzi. All going well so far. We arrived in our vehicle only to find out that the car park is under the hotel and only has 1.95m maximum headroom to enter the car park , our first problem when having a roof rack on the car you can’t fit in. We asked it reception is there another way in for deliveries,only to be told “No” so that took another 40 minutes to find another car park and at 9 pm at night wasn’t easy. There hotel has been through a transformation and it is looking welcoming and clean. The rooms have been freshly decorated and the bathrooms were lovely. The staff on reception were
Date of Review: paul m wrote a review Dec 2018
Comment Title: Family Treat to stay over and Xmas shop
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 23 Dec 2018
Response comment: Good evening Paul M  Thank you for your recent review in regards to your stay at the marriott hotel. I am sorry to hear of the issues yo have had and we will pass this feedback onto the Miller and Carter team.  If you wish to discuss this any more please do not hesitate to call the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: From the excellent reception staff to the lovely breakfast I had a great stay. The room was beautifully decorated and in an excellent state of repair. The bed was comfortable, this is a big deal for me. The bathroom was large with a great shower. As others have said, the fire alarm went off intermittently from about 7am and through breakfast. I'd just come out of the shower the first time it went off and I started to hurriedly pull on clothes.  The bar had a buzz in the evening, and it's a very pleasant place to have a pre-dinner drink. The breakfast was good, pretty good selection, and more importantly, well cooked.   Although located in the centre of Bristol, my 1st floor room was extremely quiet, but it did face into a courtyard.  The only issue is the cramped parking. The
Comment Title: Beautiful hotel in a great location

Comments: Firstly I want to make a point of drawing your attention to the fact that if you book a family room inc breakfast don’t expect every breakfast to be included. We booked a family room for myself, my husband, my 13 year old and 3 year old. We went for the higher tariff which was to include breakfast. The first 2 mornings went like clockwork. On our final morning we were told that we had to pay for my 13 year olds breakfast. Obviously we were quite upset but we were told that the new people had taken over 2 weeks ago and their new policy is only 2 adults and under 3’s are included in the room and breakfast rate. The breakfast was £7.50 but that isn’t the point. As we booked this visit several months ago there was no mention of the pending take over and no mention of the pending
Date of Review: Emma L wrote a review Dec 2018
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 21 Dec 2018
Response comment: Dear Emma O,  Thank you for your feedback in regards to your recent stay and I am sorry for the issues you have.  We have shared this feedback with the Miller and Carter restaurant also.  If you wish to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to contact the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess

Comments: It has been quite a while since I stayed here but it was an easy choice. Check in was as expected - efficient and friendly. I noted that the hotel was going through a refurb and this was evident in the rooms which are comfortable and it is clear money has been spent on ensuring the rooms are comfortable.  The Marriott Tea Lounge looked good but the big difference is the new Miller and Carter bar and restaurant - first impressions were very good. The place only opened on 3rd December and is finding its way. There are new staff across all levels and there are clearly experienced Managers (Nina from Belarus) and staff, Cian from Oxford and Lorenzo from Italy. Other staff members are new and not quite at the level of “keeping their comments” to themselves - “my shoes were hurting
Date of Review: John M wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: Booked here as we were hosting events around Bristol. We knew that we would not get in until after 3am so wanted a comfortable room so we could have a bit of a lie in and recoup before the next day. Rooms were lovely and check in good but slow, however the service was below par when I had an issue. Woken up on both mornings with the fire alarm ringing (between 7 and 9am). No real apology when I asked about it, I was just told that another customer had burnt their toast again. Move the toaster or change the sensor then! It obviously happens regularly enough. Also, I'm glad that I hadn't paid the £15 for breakfast if it meant cooking your own toast. I tried to use the website to leave a comment but couldn't find an option to do so. I would appreciate Marriot reaching out to me in
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 18 Dec 2018
Response comment: Good evening 7267helen,  Please accept my apology for what it seems a stay below your expectations. You can reach me on heidi.mobbs@marriott.com.  Kindest regards,

Comments: Well I don’t know where to start ! This place is just awful! Stayed the night here in mid December for a works Xmas party. Hotel having refurbishment, this is not a problem it happens but the smell of paint is overwhelming to the point it makes your head ache. Room was satisfactory until the fire alarm started around 6am and continued for around 20 mins before being switched off. No apology and staff didn’t care . According to staff this is because of a toaster in the kitchen and happens several times daily!  ( move the bloody toaster!!!! Xmas party fine but staff behind bar useless couldn’t get orders right and couldn’t add drinks to room tab or get the card machine to work! The food was horrendous I don’t consider 2 sprouts and a chunk of carrot a veg option! The starter soup
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Assistant Front office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 18 Dec 2018
Response comment: Dear Midkel1,  Thank you for you feedback about your recent stay, I will pass your comments back to the respective teams in regards to the food in breakfast and your event.  If you wish to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to contact me.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: Stayed here for 1 night close to Xmas and very impressed with hotel, clean and spacious and despite a Xmas party in full swing no noise in the room. Bed was very comfortable and very clean spacious room on 3rd floor. Breakfast was plentiful and good quality. Will definitely stay again.

The hotel was a stunning period building and fitted lovely throughout. It is in a prime location and everywhere we wanted to go was in a prime location. However. We booked a deluxe king room to find there was no king bed. When questioning reception their deluxe king is actually what they call a standard double which is highly misleading. The situation was rectified and they moved us to a king room. The breakfast was OK. However the bacon and sausages looked almost undercooked both mornings and there were always items missing and by the time they restocked we were ready to leave. No way worth the £15 or so a head when you can get a fantastic breakfast less than half the price at one of the local coffee shops just a walk away. Overall. A lovely hotel with a well equipped room and
Date of Review: Ollie T wrote a review Dec 2018
Comment Title: Beautiful looking hotel in a prime location but room for improvement.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 14 Dec 2018
Response comment: Good evening Ollie T,  Thank you for sharing your feedback with us, it helps us to improve everyday. I have shared the comments with the respective teams and we will make sure that this issues are isolated and will never happen in the future.  Kindest regards,

Comments: The new revamped Marriott Hotel, restaurant/bar. The makeover is very interesting, the old time faded glamour of an old fashioned cocktail bar has sadly gone, replaced by modern grandiose. A restaurant had sprung up at the far end, very plush and dare I say quite pleasant. I ordered a steak burger and bacon with cheese burger. The bacon was far to salty, but otherwise fair. My friends steak burger lacked any steak, bar a miniscule cube, needs a bit of work here chaps. Lovely place to meet and looks to have good potential with s few notable tweaks. Please also aquire some decent size tea pots, us Brits do love our tea!
Date of Review: Andrea H wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: I stayed here for a long weekend and it was extremely busy with Christmas parties. The staff handled the stresses of drunken people in their masses brilliantly. The staff where all attentive and any request was greeted with wanting to help. The food was excellent! Toby in the executive room made us feel at home. Now the downfalls. Three lifts and only one worked. The superior room we stayed in is dated, especially the bathroom (could’ve done to be cleaned better).  The sofa bed was scruffy and needs replacing. The television wasn’t interactive which is unusual. The bose system for my iPhone charged up but wouldn’t play music.  The outer glass window was dirty and so the views where a little spoilt.  The trouser press didn’t work.
Comment Title: Well appointed hotel for the centre

Comments: Stopped here for a Xmas party that we were having in Bristol. Hotel room was ok thought was expensive for a night but the small amount of time I used the room it was ok. The reception staff were very nice just needed more of them when checking out in a morning. Generally a good hotel
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 12 Dec 2018
Response comment: Hello Alistair147,  Thank you for your honest feedback of the hotel, I hope your Christmas party went well.  I'm glad to hear you found the reception staff nice.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: We stay here every December to celebrate my birthday.   On previous visits I have enjoyed staying in a lovely room, soaking in a lovely bathtub and enjoying some "Happy Birthday" chocolates as a special gift from the hotel.  Highs for this visit:  I requested an early check-in and staff worked hard to ensure that our room was made available within an hour of our early afternoon arrival. We were given a very pleasant room overlooking a central courtyard.  The gym, spa and pool area are great - always a highlight for us.  Breakfast was varied and delicious - way better than many other hotels we have stayed in.  We requested a 2pm check out which was granted and much appreciated.  Lows for this visit:  The hotel refurb seems to have done away with bathtubs! At checkout I mentioned
Comment Title: A mixed bag - some highs and some lows
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 12 Dec 2018
Response comment: Dear BathSomerset,  Thank you for positive and constructive feedback of the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel, we appreciate you time in doing this.  If you wish to discuss these issues any further please do not hesitate to contact me at the hotel.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: Stayed for the weekend Bristol great place to visit. Hotel lovely and staff professional  and friendly but the bar leaves a lot to be desired. Staff nice and loads of them but please expect at least a 10 minute wait to get served as the priority seems to be the restaurant orders!!! If you are vegetarian don't eat here only a choice of one dish unless you eat fish - luckily I do.  Cannot fault the cleanliness of the hotel or the staff  in general but the bar needs sorting and a few more vegetarian options  wouldn't go amiss!!
Date of Review: Debra W wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: A simple stop-over - perfect.  Grand marble reception, spacious and comfortable room.  I booked in for a night after an xmas meal in town.  I could have done cheaper, maybe a bit more expensive.  For me the central location was just right.  With a room 2 floors above the road, I was impressed by the total silence thanks to what I think was triple-glazing.  I didn't eat there, so can't comment, but overall service was very good and facilities to match.  By the way it was the location for my first date with my wife (then to be) 15 years ago, so it was suited for that too..

I have stayed here before and have always been satisfied. My visit this time was due to a surgery that I needed as an outpatient. The hotel has some interesting architecture and the beds are very comfortable as one would expect at a Marriott.  What was not expected on a Thursday night was a disco function that runs on to midnight and the management have no interest in the fact that you paid for a good nights sleep after a 3 hr operation. BE WARNED before booking, phone ahead and check if they will be having a party with unreasonably loud music!.The company policy is that they do not inform you of when they are having a function, for obvious reasons!  Management response could be considered as what are you complaining about? It should finish by midnight!    REMEMBER it's
Comment Title: Quality hotel located near to the Hospital
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 7 Dec 2018
Response comment: Good evening TJS32,  Thank you for your recent feedback about your experience at the hotel and I am sorry to hear about this issues you experienced from the function and car park.  If you would like to discuss this any further please do not hesitate to call the hotel on 01179255100.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley  Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Close to Bristol's historic sites ( SS Great Britian is about 20 minute walk). The buffet breakfast about 20 pounds was excellent. Staff were all friendly and helpful. About a 5 minute taxi ride from Temple Terrace Rail Station cost about 8 pounds. Hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants. We ate several light meals in bar and the food was good.
Date of Review: Tom S wrote a review Dec 2018
Comment Title: In the Heart of Bristol England

Comments: Bristol’s infamous traffic makes getting to the hotel tedious, but once you get to the hotel, car parking on site and easily accessible the city break kicks in, the Reception staff match everything you expect from a Marriott, the hotel is stunning, quality throughout, immaculate, the room we had perfect, spotless and roomy. With a Miller & Carter in house you can’t ask for more, but just a 2 min walk away from the hotel you have the vibrant Harbour area full of bars and restaurants to suit all, and if it’s the shopping you go for then 5 mins and your in the midst of them all, the Xmas market is up and running to add some celebration and vibes to an already busy city, but for me if in Bristol then only one place to be Marriott Royal Hotel 10/10
Date of Review: Lee P wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: Great hotel but visit marred by the building work going on, which set of the fire alarms while we were there. It was all very embarrassing as we were the only people to react and I think staff seeing us in our pyjamas thought it was hilarious. We had room only so cannot comment about the food

Reception services can be improved (valet parking is missing). The reception manager is very nice and professional. Congratulations! The hotel is renovated, looks great and is in a fabulous location near Bristol cathedral.
Date of Review: Razvan W wrote a review Dec 2018

Comments: I recently stayed at this Marriott while on business in Bristol.  I drove to Bristol so it was important that I be able to park on site. Some hotels in city centers say they have on site parking and it really isn’t but that was t the case here. The hotel has a car park beneath the hotel that is easy to use and quite reasonable £16/day. Right next to the hotel is a beautiful cathedral and there are many restaurants within easy walking distance. I will stay here again next time I’m in Bristol.
Date of Review: ShadandSandra R wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: My wife and I stayed here about a year ago and stayed in a standard room on the ground floor that was ok but nothing to write home about. This time we stayed in a superior king on the 2nd floor. This room had been refurbished and was great. Nicely decorated, plenty of space, comfortable bed and a very good shower. Breakfast was in the historic room with roman columns and oil paintings and breakfast was very good. The sauna, steam room, jacuzzi and pool was very good.

Myself and adult daughter stayed overnight to visit the Christmas Market and take in a show at the Hippodrome. We had a junior suite overlooking the city. The room was spotlessly clean and included a coffee machine and mini fridge. The parking is tight but we found a space. The staff were very friendly and helpful.  We knew the hotel was being refurbished but did not impact on our enjoyment.  Breakfast was lovely.  I was aware of the negative reviews prior to booking but I loved the hotel so much I am returning in December.

This hotel disappointed from the moment it engaged at the car park intercom by having no idea if there were spaces available in its car park.  Fair enough... Reception then wouldn’t take my car registration as I was part of a group. The conference room we attended had constant drilling ongoing. The bedroom I was given was on the Lower Ground - the window didn’t open and it smelt of damp/dust... Breakfast was hazardous.  Lots of incredibly hot plates being offered but they were so high and unstable they were dangerous.  The waiter I told didn’t care.  When I left I paid my bill and was told I’d receive an email bill - I didn’t!  It’s a massive shame as the hotel building is spectacular.  The food I ate was decent.  The service is a shambles....

Comments: On first sight the Royal Hotel is a lovely hotel in a great location.  However, our first night's sleep was interrupted by the fire alarm and a march to the lobby with the other guests.  Despite asking for a quiet room, our second night was interrupted by revellers leaving the bar opposite at 2am.  Add the couple arguing at 5am and I'm leaving the hotel so much more tired than checking in.  Parking is also a major challenge at this hotel.  Many of the guests can't park in the small spaces and Marriott do not police their parking.  Making it very difficult to park.  Unfortunately the staff seem indifferent to requests or complaints, it took 3 requests to have housekeeping clean our room.  Two of these face to face at reception.  I'm at platinum elete member and have stayed at
Date of Review: Paul S wrote a review Nov 2018
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 25 Nov 2018
Response comment: Dear Paul S,  Thank you for your comments. After reviewing your feedback I have passed it to the respective Head of Departments to make sure that the issues described are isolated and will not happen in the future.  I hope that we are able to accommodate you in the future.  Kindest regards,

Comments: On first impressions, this Marriott is lovely. It’s in a great location close to college green and the city centre, and the room we had was good. The pool is also very nice.  However, it fails on two major points. Firstly, even platinum members have to pay for parking, where usually it is free. Also, if you stay over the weekend and need to take your car out for any reason, good luck in trying to find a space when you come back. It’s a small facility so there are inconsiderate drivers who park over two spaces, along walls so they block access to some spots, etc. The parking lot isn’t monitored by the hotel, but they should do if they want to offer their guests a more positive customer experience.  Secondly, the house keeping is very slow. We went out in the morning and when we
Comment Title: Hotel needs to address reoccurring issues in their poor and terrible reviews
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 25 Nov 2018
Response comment: Dear sassybowwow  Thank you for your comments. We are very sorry to hear that your experience with us has not been up to what you expected. All the feedback provided has been passed to each department to ensure that the issues raised are not going to happen again in the future.   We hope to be able to accommodate you again in the future.   Kindest regards,

Comments: A real beauty of a hotel, at a superb price and excellently located. The spa and wellness centre (swimming pool, hot tub, sauna, steam etc) were excellent and the actual hotel rooms were luxurious. We've stayed here a few times and would give it a perfect ten if it weren't for some of the Bristol Uni student staff who clearly lower the tone as they fiddle with their mobiles whilst talking to you. The hotel should have a blanket ban on staff mobiles and also offer a stern reminder to their student staff that they are there to serve -  the guests aren't occupational hazards to be navigated as the students earn their money.  The wi-fi system was also very confusing. We gave up and used our mobiles.

The first thing of note regarding this hotel is that WIFI is not free.  It is only free from the hotel lobby and is only available in your room for an extra cost.  The 2nd thing of note is that upon arrival the hotel take £50 from your credit card (to cover any hotel costs you may incurr) which has to be credited upon departure.  This process in itself add about 10 minutes to the arrival and departure.  In fact even at 6:56am the queue to check out was quite big and it took 15 minutes.  2nd thing to note is the room I was placed in (Room 709) had a very loud buzzing noise.  I phoned  reception (which i had to do from my mobile) to investigate.  After investigation he came back to report that he could find the fault and gave me some earplugs!  The next morning (upon Checkout) i
Date of Review: Catherine H wrote a review Nov 2018
