Comments: While the hotel is old it has a lot of charm and our room had been nicely refurbished. The decor was very pleasant and the room was a good size. The bathroom was fantastic. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful and we felt the hotel was very reasonably priced for the quality of the room and where it was located. We would happily stay here again.
Date of Review: Gregory B wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: The presence of the uniformed concierge immediately informs you that you entered one of the grandest hotels in Bristol.  The Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel friendly front desk team quick sorts out your reservation, then gets the concierge to address any other needs you may have.  This huge central hotel in very prominent in the historical heart of Bristol City (albeit a reasonable walk away from the main shopping area).  The Victorian hotel is a bit rough around the edges but is currently undergoing a much needed refurbishment.  Due to the refurbishment the restaurant is currently closed (becoming a Miller and Carter) – but this does mean that breakfast is served in the excellent palm court.  My room had a filter coffee machine in room; a Huge TV and USB power sockets in bedside

I have stayed here for business several times. Most of the times rooms themselves are ok ie average. One of the rooms had horrible smell and window did not open.  Cleaning standards are not very high, and to reach out to services takes 2-3 calls.  What is constant - creepy painting. They all have scary angry faces and are quite big.
Comment Title: Room quality vary, but creepy paintings are always there

Comments: This hotel is fantastic on the outside a really beautiful building, however inside it is really dreary and in need of updating. The reception area is not at all welcoming ,in definite need of some ambience and identity. The bar area could do with a modern look it looks tired and dated and appears far too small for the size of the hotel. Staff were very pleasant . There appears to be some building work going on , only one of the main lifts was working (there was another but not well signposted). Our room on the 4th floor was quiet, clean and basic the bathroom had a great shower and looked newly renovated. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but we did book the evening before. There were warnings about how busy it can get and when you see where it is served you can see

Hotel nicely located in the centre of Bristol with easy access to all activities   Rooms are very spacious and clean and comfortable   Restaurant has excellent choice and food quality is good, along with nice bar and friendly staff  Also has an extensive fitness suite  Underground car parking also very secure  Highly recommended

Lovely hotel. Close to Hippodrome theatre BUT what a total shambles. It’s now 12.20am early morning and the walls are physically vibrating with the sheer loudness of a party downstairs. I phoned up and the porter said he can supply earplugs if I wish. I love a party but if I’m paying top dollar I expect the courtesy to have been told there was a party so I could choose whether to stay or not. I am extremely disappointed. My weekend ruined. I have stayed in literally hundreds of hotels for work and never have I come across anything so bad as this.
Date of Review: Marcus W wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: Currently there is a lot of upgrades going on, However this happens in the background and we didn’t really notice it. The bedroom I had 1222 was very large with two double beds the room is well equipped and clean with a view over the city. The meeting room (York) was ideal for my group of 8 and the service was very good, the food was had good variety but was served earlier than requested and some had dried out a bit. But not a major point and I would stay and use the meeting rooms again.
Comment Title: Overnight followed by meetings in hotel

Comments: Well got to say we had a fantastic stay! We arrived on Sat to stay for two nights. Check in was easy and receptionist very pleasant. £100 was taken off visa card to cover car park £16 per night and you can also charge anything else to your room. Car park is on side of hotel and we got a space easily. Our room was on the lower floor. Room was nice and quiet didnt hear any noise. Good fridge, tv nice decor. Hairdryer bathroom toiletries, huge shower. All were nice and clean and fresh. Beds comfy with good pillows. Great location to walk to o2 for our concert. The leisure club was open from 6am to 11pm which I loved. I like a swim and this is the main reason for choosing this hotel. Hubby loved the sauna and jacuzzi! The whole area was beautiful, and clean,  even shampoo and

Generally speaking you know what you get with Marriott and this hotel did not dissapoint. Lovely building in a great location close to waterfront. Rooms are clean and decorated to hight standard and of course beds are very comfortable. We only ate breakfast at hotel which had plenty of choice. Staff were attentative and polite and check in\out was hassle free. Will make use of hotel facilities the next time I stay.  Hotel has large car park under building which is quite tricky to spot/access. Just drive towards the automated gates situated directly under the arch which is to the left of the main entrance.

I arranged to meet a friend for a drink and a bite to eat before an event on 18 October. The lounge area to the left of the reception has been refurbished in a modern style. What was previously a plush comfortable and very inviting area is now grey and plasticky. This is an old building and this is no longer in keeping.
Date of Review: Helen B wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: Just wanted to say had a fabulous time in this hotel went away with my husband to stay over night to watch jersey boy was made very special by being upgraded to a suite breakfast was the best off all the  Marriot hotels iv stayed in only down side ask for gf bread never did came but it was still fabulous x

Given choice of which floor I would like to stay on by friendly reception staff. Beautiful large and clean modern room. Lovely bar and restaurant. Delicious breakfast with freshly cooked eggs-not the usual rubber ones served most hotels! My hotel of choice now in Bristol.
Date of Review: Chris B wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: My new fav hotel in Bristol with a spot of luxury. We booked this last minute and so glad we did. The staff were super friendly, checking in was a breeze.  The room was spacious, clean and well stocked for an overnight stay.  The shower was fabulous and a welcome reprieve after a night in the city. The bed was so comfy, we considered another night just to stay and enjoy the room.  The food in the hotel was lovely and fabulous service all round.  Gutted I didn't take my swimming costume to experience the spa.  You would never know you were in the heart of the city, no road noise at all.  It's a beauty this hotel and a nice little treat.  We will definitely be back and very soon as well.
Date of Review: Sharon W wrote a review Nov 2018

Comments: To be fair this is a reflection of The bar. Last time I came a barman who knew how to make cocktails this time two guys who struggled to follow an instruction manual over priced and poor   I asked for a brandy Alexander and got blank Looks....
Date of Review: Andrew S wrote a review Nov 2018
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 10 Nov 2018
Response comment: Dear Andrew S  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel and providing your honest feedback in reagrds to the experience you had at the bar.  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team   We hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: The hotel is luxurious & smells amazing! The actual building is quite beautiful & the rooms are spacious & very comfy for a good nights' sleep. Wi-fi is fast (you have to activate the code at reception when you check-in) & all amenities are provided in the room. Shower is very luxurious too. The buffet breakfast is served in the beautiful breakfast room & the bar has a substantial list to choose from. Whilst I didn't use the fitness centre (not enough time) it is kitted out & even has a heated pool. The location is superb - literally just a 15 min walk to Broadlands (shopping district) & a 5 min walk down to the waterfront - very picturesque. Bristol Cathedral is next to the hotel - a must-see. The park (College Green) in front of the City Hall was also lovely to relax in. But,
Date of Review: Mina R wrote a review Nov 2018
Comment Title: Luxurious & friendly - superb location & excellent service

Comments: Newly refurbished room, very comfortable.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Excellent breakfast.  In a great central location for all that Bristol has to offer - handy for Clifton too.  Overall, very happy with our stay.  Maybe would have been an excellent rating, but why the need to charge for wifi access these days?

Halloween weekend would have been nice to have a few carved pumpkins around , everywhere was very cold it was 2 degrees outside last weekend . Room newly refurbished very nice could have placed mirrors in a better spot plug points so you could dry your hair, we were in a suite quite spacious bathroom very small. wardrobe doors knocked into another door so couldn;t have both open together. Breakfast opens at 7am at weekend on our first day nothing was ready for 40 mins took 45 mins for coffee arrive . However we would stay again this was our third stay in one year.
Date of Review: Chris R wrote a review Nov 2018
Comment Title: Good have been better but renovations in full flow

Comments: Great location for all of the attractions of Bristol. Comfortable clean rooms with good service. Helpful stuff. Good breakfast. Excellent pool and sauna, also gym. They have a nice bar with local beers.

Excellent room, helpful friendly staff. However, the hotel is being refurbished and certain facilities are lacking. The temporary breakfast room has no ambiance, just a pack 'em in table layout and an ad hoc servery. Food ok. There is limited lift availabilty and the loos are not available on the ground floor where the bar is located. We paid a premium rate for a four star hotel stay and did not feel we got value for money. Had I realised about refurbishment at time of booking I would have booked elsewhere.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 31 Oct 2018
Response comment: Dear Juniper2015,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your recent visit. Comments: A girls night away to the Theatre, last minute decision to stay the night.  What a great plan, our room was massive, comfortable and clean.  But most of all quiet, you could not hear a pin drop, for the first time in ages I actually slept in!

Earlier stays at this hotel after an evening at the opera or ballet at Bristol Hippodrome have been a treat as we only live a few miles away.  However, this visit was disappointing as because of the refurbishment ( of which we were not made aware) breakfast was served in the Kings Room in a school canteen atmosphere.  I understand that the Palm Court has been used on other mornings but today  it was being used for a business meeting.  This, together with the lounge which we usually use for reading the newspaper after breakfast, was also banned to residents also because of a business meeting!  It seems as if this hotel cares far more for business events than the comfort of guests.  Our room was a refurbished one and I didn't care for the colour scheme but it was quiet and
Date of Review: Hazel p wrote a review Oct 2018
Comment Title: Our fourth viist was a disappointment

Comments: Stayed here as a family for two nights with interconnecting rooms. Quick and friendly check in, lovely clean, large, comfortable rooms. City centre parking £16 for 24hours which seems fair. We enjoyed the pool, although the jacuzzi was completely rubbish - a bath, no bubbles to speak of. Great location for all of the attractions of Bristol. Breakfast was good but overpriced at £13.50 per person, no concessions for children.  Any refurbishments were unobtrusive.
Comment Title: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms

Comments: Stayed at this hotel whilst I was sitting some examinations (i.e. stressful...) in Bristol.  My room was excellent, the bed comfy and the staff most helpful.  Did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on food.  Probably the most comfortable hotel stay I have ever had.

My friends and I booked this hotel for my 40th Birthday.  The hotel is currently being renovated however this did not impact on out stay.  We stayed for 2 night bed and breakfast which cost £121 each....this also allowed us access to the spa facilities. The downside was that parking and Wi-Fi were an additional cost.... £16 per night for parking and I believe it was £4.99 for the Wi-Fi.  The room was one of the renovated ones and was lovely...there was three of us and the room was very spacious with two double beds.  The bathroom was nice and it had a walk in shower which was powerful.  Travel size toiletries are available.  The breakfast was amazing...it was a buffet cooked breakfast plus cereals and continental options...lots of choice.  The breakfast area was stunning...the
Date of Review: Julie B wrote a review Oct 2018

Comments: A well placed central hotel with a car park - although at £16 its very expensive! A very nice well refurbished room with a opening window of sorts. Nicely appointed room with a nice level of comfort. The bathroom lighting is a disaster if you need to have a shave or anything else near the mirror, what a shame that someone didn't think about lighting the mirror. I hope that the lifts will be refurbished in due course... not good. But a decent stay in the centre of Bristol
Comment Title: Decent Refurbishment, but needs some love thrown in

Comments: Just returned from a night out with friends in Bristol, hence a one night stay at the Marriott Royal Hotel. This is a good place to stay as it is right in the centre of Bristol with its own parking, however this not cheap £16 a night and that's the guests rate.  The hotel is quite an impressive building, currently undergoing some refurbishment so be warned. Whilst we had a beer and snacks, guys were installing ply partitioning between the bar and reception, which if you were having a meal would have been off putting.  (I was impressed that they still had guys working on site after 4pm on Friday!) The room we had was a decent size with all the usual bits & bobs and most importantly a comfortable bed. Other than the building works and the random knock on the door at 9am asking
Date of Review: Eddie H wrote a review Oct 2018

Comments: The hotel is clearly having a lot of work done to it so it wasn't perhaps looking its best but still had a great stay. Was really only staying there because we had to be in Bristol but the amazing staff made it feel like a little holiday. Happened to be my son's 9th birthday. The reception obviously got wind of this and on returning from breakfast he found a slice of cake, two hand written cards and a shower of balloons! Lots of smiley staff on hand through out the hotel. Well done all round.
Comment Title: Boutique hotel service way better expected for a Marriott

Comments: The "Royal" Marriott in Bristol was a disappointment.   First was checkin. We were checked-in by Jules. We walked in at roughly 1pm carrying bags and I gave my surname, since that's usually the first step in reception facilitating checkin. Her response was to ask what we needed. When I said to checkin, she replied "checkin is at 4pm". So much for a warm greeting.  We were eventually checked in, but there was no eye contact and it was completely mechanical. I asked my friend, who I was meeting if he had the same impression, and he agreed it was very odd.   The room, which was newly renovated was decent, although they've adopted the practice of sealing the windows, so you have no way to get fresh air into the room.  That said, it was clean and the bedding decent.   During the
Date of Review: Tim Fargo wrote a review Oct 2018

Comments: Beautiful venue very stylish and plush. We were attending a friends wedding food was excellent service good. Unfortunately this is where it ends the wedding cake went missing an investigation is under way as to which staff member took it. All the table centre pieces that were meant to kept had been thrown and were all broken.  What a horrible way to end a lovely day!
Date of Review: Maria M wrote a review Oct 2018

Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 3 Oct 2018
Response comment: Dear Maria M,  Thank you kindly for your recent review, regarding your attendance at the recent wedding held in the hotel.    I am currently dealing directly with the Bride and Groom regarding the issues you have noted. As you have pointed out, an investigation will be undertaken and the cause determined. It has not been proven that anything was taken at this point in time. I will note however, that I am taking this situation very seriously and will be doing all in my power to rectify and ensure this was an isolated incident.    Again I wish to thank you for your very kind feedback regarding the food and service received at event, that really is great to hear.    Thank you,   Chris Luke

Comments: What can I say, an absolute disaster.  We spent 3 nights at the hotel, two nights booked by friends we were meeting up with and a previous night booked directly by us. None of us were advised of the major refurbishment that was taking place.So,this meant that, after driving a great distance to get there,we were unable to have an afternoon nap because of the noise construction team. We are all pensioners who need to recover from the drive.  Many lifts were not working nor were the toilets on the ground floor and often the first and lower ground-floor toilets were taken out of action too.. The dining room was out of commission and so we had breakfast on the first morning in one of the reception rooms. On the second day we found out (not advised) that there was a wedding reception

Comments: The hotel was tired and dirty ! Shampoo /conditioner hair was in the shower walls  from previous guests. Every door, glass panels and mirrors in the hotel was finger prints a dirty marked ! What a shame about the entrance - the stairs looked amazing in the pictures in reality it was a public ashtray dirty old and tired. They are clearly understaffed- at 10.39 we could see overflowing ashtrays and drink bottles left from the night before in the courtyard. No WiFi in the room - limited TV stations - hairdryer cheap glad I had mine with me ! Breakfast room experience we paid for was also awful - no atmosphere -set like  exam room in line and in row - no atmosphere - hot food was good but Omelett arrived far too late - continental was awful I didn’t touch it looked like it’s been

Comments: I like this hotel, it’s clean and comfy and represents good value for a city center hotel if you get the right rate. The best thing is the location it could not be better for Bristol city center. The only thing I get peeved about is there very flexable charging structure from £80  to £189 for the same same room. I stay at the Marriott city center loads I keep going back need I say more?

Rooms are great however they would benefit from at least bottled water in the rooms, there is a bar fridge that is completely empty. Toiletries are basic for a upper lever hotel. Room service was poor, chicken wings were nothing more than deep fried with out spice/sauce, pie and mash was ok with the mash cold, Pepsi was warm and no ice delivered with service. Staff are friendly, good gym/pool, good location, good parking.  The hotel is undergoing major refurb so is noisy and non of the elevators are working.

Staying for a large sporting event, the hotel was ideally situated.  Despite major renovations taking place, there was a minimum of fuss and disruption, with the staff being polite and accommodating.  The room standard was dependable and food to a good standard.  It is the right hotel, in the right location at a good standard.
Date of Review: Gareth K wrote a review Sept 2018

Comments: Nice location, grand building. But, although I was in a refurbished room, the place just feels very ordinary; the 'Royal' moniker really ought to denote a degree of quality. Not helped presumably by them having a major event in the hotel. There was a fair amount of hammering and other noise from the refurbishment work, too.   And for those who, like me, spend a lot of money with the chain, there was attempt to make a Lifetime Platinum Premier Elite guest feel particularly valued. The staff member sitting at the Elite check-in directed me to the main desk, for example.  Going again for a couple of nights in mid-October and wishing I'd booked elsewhere.

Comments: Last week I stayed at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel for a 3 day conference and sadly had a very disappointing experience.    Where to start, there were no toilets on the ground floor, so for people with mobility problems it was extremely frustrating.  The noise from the building work was unbearable - literally in the middle of a conference with people trying to present and met with heavy drilling and banging and fire alarms.  Literally the speakers could not be heard at times - it was extremely disappointing.  Attempts by people at the conference to liaise with hotel staff to reduce the noise sadly did not appear to work.   Technical issues - nearly ever presenter had a problem in one way or another due to technical problems, from the microphones not working, to the

Comments: Arrived and was told room not ready, fair enough but were told reception staff were not allowed to make phone calls to tell us when the room would be ready. Fair enough we will go and sit in the bar and have a drink. Then told oh Sorry we cant leave the desk to come to the bar to tell you when the room is ready either.  Bar staff walked away from the bar as I walked up to it, eventually served. No toilets in public area as place is being renovated...OK walk upstairs and find them. Finally check in room actually really nice but cleaner had left bottle tops and chewing gum in the bathroom. Not the worst just chucked it in the bin...out for the night and came back but there was a wedding or something happening in ballroom - we were on 3rd floor but music literally thumping through

Comments: I was at his hotel for 2 days for our yearly conference. From moment the conference started the issues started. Day 1 we ran out of coffee instantly then we were hit with multiple IT issues with the projector in the conference suite and the wifi not being able to cope with us using it. On our second break we again ran out of coffee and had to go without. Lunch was ok but not enough hot food to cater for the amount of people at the conference. Staff did not also know if any of the food contained nuts and this was not labelled on the little chalk boards, as they could not be sure if the food had nuts or not I had to go out and buy my own. (hotel management may want to take a look at the food standards agency site to help address this issue and train staff)   Second break was also

Comments: Stayed for one night only as part of a wedding party. Car park was a bit of nightmare but to be fair i think thats more down to the fact that it was built when cars were not as wide. I only saw 2 disabled spaces (thats not to say there weren't more) so my elderly parents had to get out and stand with cases while i parked. Its an underground car park and nothing to assist with getting luggage up but fortunately a young chap (who turned out to be a member of staff, i believe a concierge, was just leaving) was getting into his car, saw us and insisted on taking our luggage and helping my parents up to Reception. There were no available toilets at all on the Reception floor - we were told there were some downstairs but i couldn't see them and there was no one to ask. The bedroom i
Date of Review: Suzanne B wrote a review Sept 2018
Comment Title: Helpful staff - especially concierge and housekeeping

Comments: After a mistake by the hotel we couldn’t stay the first night and had to be accommodated elsewhere. The initial reception was awful and lessons in customer service could be learned. I have never been dealt with in such an unprofessional way. Luckily the situation was then handled by Heidi who could not have been more apologetic and helpful. She upgraded our room for the rest of our stay and was amazing.

Comments: Spent 2 days attending a conference at this hotel,from early on the first day until the time it finished on the 2nd day,we were constantly interrupted by noise from the renovation work,with banging and drilling throughout the day,which greatly spoiled what should have been a great opportunity for learning and engaging with colleagues from all over the U.K. We were also beset by IT issues and glitches,which at the time we put down to the aforementioned works. I’m sure under normal circumstances it’s a lovely hotel,sadly we had to endure this.

Comments: Brilliant hotel, staff was polite and friendly they checked me in early after a long drive down.  There was some work being done but didn't interfere with the stay at all.  The room was very big and comfortable, best nights sleep Iv had in a while.  The restaurant was closed but there was loads of places nearby for nice food and drink at a reasonable price.   Will definitely be staying again.
Date of Review: kirsty l wrote a review Sept 2018

Comments: Booked Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel for our 31st anniversary celebration.  Hotel was recommended by friends who live in Bristol.  We had The Royal Suite Room #1456.  Absolutely Amazing!  Spacious, tasteful contemporary decor.  Comfortable king-sized poster bed. Extremely large bathroom, with bath and shower.  Beautiful round sitting room.  Large Entry hall.  The original Palm Room, now Walter's Bar & Grill, is one of the most beautiful rooms you will ever dine in--stunning.  Food for dinner and breakfast was delicious, well presented and reasonable.  The staff is engaging, well-informed, helpful and provide excellent customer service. Highly Recommend!
Date of Review: Jim B wrote a review Sept 2018
Comment Title: Highly Recommend -- A Perfect Anniversary Weekend!

Comments: I haven’t stayed at this hotel in 12 months, last time I stayed it was looking a little tired, so good to see work going on in the lobby and corridors. As It’s currently being renovated, there is a bit of disruption, alternative lifts in use, but overall the room was clean, recently refurbished to a good standard, so the usual Marriott quality. Plenty of tea and coffee.  One small problem with the front of house.  On check in I was charged an extra £100 deposit as I used a debit card, I was told the deposit was to cover extra charges, however, when I tried to access the internet it wouldn’t let me in unless I contacted the front desk. On check out I got a nonsense explanation. An apology would have done rather than try to make up technical reasons.  Breakfast was buffet style
Date of Review: Barry M wrote a review Sept 2018

Comments: The Royal Marriott is meant to be one of Bristol's top hotels and they certainly price it as one. The location is excellent and the building is fabulous but the rooms are of the same standard as a nice travel lodge or premier inn. The room we stayed in wasn't "unclean" but certainly hadn't been dusted in quite a while as there were thick layers of dust on the window sill, behind the TV and the desk. The TV in the room was broken and when brought to the attention of the front desk they offered to move us to a different room ... it was 2am. We confirmed we didn't particularly want to move at that time of night and the receptionist flatly said "well I've offered you something so." no apology, no offer of a complimentary breakfast or drink in the bar instead, just a "well I've done
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

Comments: We stayed here in July and booked a family room with two double beds as it was for our daughter’s  graduation ceremony next door at the abbey.  Booked it using our BA Avios points and a part £ payment as unfortunately they put their prices up during graduation season which otherwise made it quite pricey due to demand.  we requested an early check-in when booking which was honoured so we could freshen up and change and we were very thankful as normally it is 4 o’clock. Thank you.   Parking was underground at £16 for a 24 hour period.  Our Room had two double beds and was very comfortable and clean and met all our needs. Wouldn’t have minded a harder mattress though.  We really enjoyed the breakfast/service too and the hotel was very central to the shops and restaurants  and we
Comment Title: Centrally located - ideal location for graduations at the Abbey next door.

Comments: I stayed here this past weekend for a convention. I had a refurbished room and it was lovely. Comfortable, spotless and good facilities. The food (especially the breakfast) was excellent and the staff very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is in a good location for getting out and about to pubs and restaurants. I'd happily stay there again!
Comment Title: Lovely place for a city break.

Comments: You get what you expect. Our room was clean but a little old style whereas the bathroom was newly renovated. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for exploring Bristol. Would come back!

Stayed for 2 nights recently with a couple of colleagues for an event nearby at the Watershed. Perfectly located with the venue only a 1 minute stroll away.   Lovely facilities with a well equipped gym, and a great pool and jacuzzi, all of which open at 6:30 to set you up for the day, and close late for the option of a relaxing evening dip!   Rooms were spacious, well-equipped, comfortable, and recently refurbished to a great standard. Only slight niggles were the air con fan didn’t want to stop the first night despite being turned off so a bit noisy, and the iron was quite leaky. Other than that, a really enjoyable stay.

Great Hotel and Location.  Came to Bristol to do the Gromit Unleashed 2 Trail.  Hotel was well situated for the city centre.  Staff very  friendly and helpful.  We arrived very early for check in therefore room was not ready, we therefore offered the use of the fitness / pool facilities to enable us to change.  Would highly recommend this hotel.  Breakfast was lovely too.

We stay here 5 to 6 times a year and I have to admit when we went to place our latest booking we had to think twice. We have seen the hotel slowly become very dated and need of some TLC.  Luckily we did book and were very happy to find that the room we had booked (1361) had been newly updated along with the entire floor.  So with these fresh looking rooms the hotel is back to being perfect for us. The staff and location have always been great.  We will be back very soon!
Date of Review: Sam K wrote a review Sept 2018

Comments: Stayed here last night for the Downs Festival where Noel Gallagher and Paul Weller were playing.   Hotel is undergoing some work at present and is noticeable. However, it is to simply make improvements and you can also see these.   Hotel itself is beautiful and the only reason for the 4 stars rather than 5 is because of the work and the slightly disorganised breakfast set up!   Lastly, Paul Weller and Steve & Sally Cradock were staying here too!!! So not bad at all. Photo with Weller was taken outside!
Comment Title: Lovely hotel in a great location

Comments: It is not often that a big city-centre hotel can offer a friendly and personal service but this hotel managed it with ease.  The location is absolutely central, ideal for visiting the many attractions that Bristol has to offer and as a base for the trails of Wallaces, Gromits and Feathers that the whole family enjoyed.  The hotel rooms were generously sized and our request for interconnecting rooms was fulfilled which was perfect. The rooms had been recently refurbished and looked fresh and clean. Although the hotel refurbishment was ongoing, this was done in a well planned, considerate manner and we were not inconvenienced in any way.  I always enjoy Marriott breakfasts and this hotel was no exception. I would like to applaud the amazing breakfast chef, Gill who was not only

From the quick and efficient check-in at the front desk through to the comfortable room with king-size bed and sizeable bathroom, this hotel offers comfort and good value for money. The car park in the hotel basement levels initially looks rather pricey at £35 for 24 hours but the hotel offers a special rate of just £16 which is really good value for a whole day right in the city centre. Breakfast was a self-service full English buffet in the dining room and was superbly organised to give sufficient throughout so nobody had to wait for a table, even at peak time. Checking out was every bit as efficient as checking in. The hotel’s location could not be better as our destination for the day was the Cathedral which is about 30 seconds’ walk away - it was actually further from our
Date of Review: Andy B from Poole wrote a review Sept 2018

Comments: I stayed one day and one night at this hotel and normally a Marriott is reasonably good but this one was well below or in terms of quality and service. Despite going though a major refurb (all hotels have to at some point) which was not mentioned anywhere when I booked, the hotel seemed understaffed and under resourced.   When I arrived at 1pm, the corridors were full of dirty plates and rubbish from the night before and they were still there at 3pm.   The room had no bottled water which I thought was just an omission but actually they have stopped providing complimentary water so I had to go to Tesco to avoid paying silly money for water.  I was in a ‘refurbished’ room and I was disappointed with the finish - looked like a super rushed job and not to the expected quality of the

Comments: This hotel was amazing. The sheer architecture. The receptionist was really helpful and checked us in, despite it being 11am. We really appreciated this. The room was absolutely massive. The view was spectacular of the city of Bristol. The breakfast was also top class. We stayed here on out last night in the UK, and this hotel really gave us a good impression.

Let's get the two whinges out of the way first.  I asked for a room near the Elevator, the one I was allocated couldn't have been further.  There are no standard 240V plugs anywhere near the bed, apparently in all rooms.  Now you may say "so what?" (that's what the receptionist said, and then went on to point out that there was a socket in the bathroom, presumably thinking I slept in the bath! Well, I need a CPAP machine to sleep and that needs power! Eventually they did supply me with an extension lead, but in these days when we all want to charge our mobiles, tablets etc. I would have thought this was a basic.  End of moans,(until we get to the restaurant), the Room itself was recently refurbished spacious and very clean I was travelling alone but if we'd been a couple I'm not

Comments: Stayed for a day use. Nice clean spacious room. Bathroom was a little bit old but clean. Complementary room WiFi was a nice touch for the day use.   Central location was very convenient.   The only drawback was the ground floor room.

The location and service are great - highly recommended. I was somewhat surprised to find out wifi wasn't automatically free, but as soon as I called for the access codes they gave us complimentary (ie, free) access.  Yes, the hotel is getting old, and yes, the hallways are very long, but the people running it are great and our room was perfect. Definitely go.
Date of Review: Othman T wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: Road closures prevented us navigating to the hotel for check in. A staff member was sent, on foot, to find us & guide us through the road closures.   We were greeted with welcome drinks on arrival & an upgraded room.   A beautifully restored hotel with friendly helpful staff in a great atmosphere well situated.

Visited the Marriott with my family for a weekend getaway and it's a great hotel. Staff are very friendly and the service is great. Rooms were a good size and well presented. What's particularly great is the location. Marriott royal is a great bar for everything in Bristol. If you want to get dune food in the vicinity then I thoroughly recommend the stable or three brothers burgers (best burgers I've had). It was great that the hotel had a swimming pool for the kids as well. Well worth a visit to this hotel.

Ideally situated very close to the Centre of Bristol, close to the waterfront and an easy walk to the shops and museums this hotel has it all. The rooms were well appointed, modern and spotless, on site car parking and a leisure area complete the facilities.  There are some works going on and we had a couple of small niggles but these were promptly and satisfactorily sorted. Try to get to breakfast early to avoid queues.

We arrived here on bank holiday Sunday, parked in the hotel car park and then checked in.  Our receptionist was lovely and we were told that as platinum members we had been upgraded.  The room was absolutely lovely and spotlessly clean.  The staff there were all very friendly and and professional.  The breakfast in the morning was good although things were running out quickly and not being replenished so people had to go without.  I would like to give a shout out to the older gentleman who was cooking the eggs, he was an absolutely gem, really friendly asking if we had enjoyed our stay and to have a lovely day.  A really genuine man and the icing on the cake to a lovely stay at the hotel.

After a 3 hours journey with my wife we have checked in and head for the room which was very good. left our room for a drink and something to eat was a problem, my wife struggle to walk due to her sickness and myself have diabetes, no proper signs and after sitting down my wife i was told this is for wedding guest only and to go on the other side and some one will come to serve us. Now the room was like a class room and waiting for the teacher to start class. we had to leave the hotel and go outside to get a meal and a drink.   Sunday morning we were woken up by some one drilling the walls which i was starting to get an headache and forced to leave the room. i have been for a swim and on my way back a young man (staff) wearing a red coat was talking to his mate and using the F
Date of Review: denis d wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: This hotel is in a fantastic location although under refurbishment at the moment. Nevertheless there were no problems. (It could do with a lick of paint) Fantastic surroundings with the cathedral close by, beautiful sandstone buildings in the surrounding area. Very central to pubs and bars. Breakfast was very good too. Rooms were clean but need a spalsh of colour its very dark, but clean.
Date of Review: Emma T wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: We stayed here 3 years ago over the August bank holiday. Returning this year, the hotel is feeling bit unloved. A few small things our of order, the key card machine down when we checked in, room service left out in the corridors for too long, the pool feeling rather shabby... The nice little touches (like water in the room and mini smoothies for the kids on arrival) have all stopped. We were comfortable and it was clean, but definitely not the same high-end feel as before.
Comment Title: Hotel feeling a bit tired and unloved
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 29 Aug 2018
Response comment: Dear Travelswithmyboys,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for providing your feedback following this recent stay.  Providing excellent service is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations, in particular regarding the over all look and feel of the hotel and the issues you faced during your stay.. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future. Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com 0117 9255100

Comments: We stayed here for one night to celebrate out 1st wedding anniversary and were not disappointed. Firstly the hotel is very easy to find, and parking is under the hotel. Only £16 and this includes all day on both days, so we parked at 2pm and had until midnight the following day if required. Also only a nice walk to the city centre. Reception staff very friendly and helpful, advised us where to eat/drink as well. A lovely touch was a room upgrade to a brand newly refurbished room and a complimentary bottle of wine due to us celebrating our anniversary. Very generous of them indeed. The room was very nice and had everything you could possibly need. Good selection of breakfast, we only had the cooked English which included freshly cooked eggs. After breakfast we visited the pool,
Date of Review: Marc C wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: The hotel features brand new renovated rooms, modern and elegant. Location is perfect, in the centre of the vibrant Bristol. The staff is the best part, friendly and helpful. Kudos to Sylvie especially from the telephone operator/service. Prime hotel in town.
Comment Title: Top location, new-looking rooms, great service

Comments: My husband booked this hotel as a treat for our first anniversary. He chose it mainly due to it’s location - which certainly didn’t disappoint. From the hotel you can reach the main shopping areas (including Cabot’s circus) and the waterfront eating areas within 10 minutes by foot. The aquarium, science museum and hippodrome are also only 3/4 minutes away.  We notified the hotel that we were away for our first anniversary and were very pleased to be greeted with congratulations from the front desk staff and notified that they had upgraded our room. On arrival to our room we received some lovely gifts and card from them. A nice added touch which really made the start of our stay excellent.  The room we stayed in was on the fourth floor and overlooked the cathedral which was a

We are a family of four and decided to stay here for a couple of nights before heading down to Devon for the main bit of our holiday. We went straight past the car park entrance at first, but found it eventually (my poor navigation to blame, I’m told). It was only on checking in that we realised there was some refurbishment going on.  It would’ve been nice to have been warned about this, but it didn’t overly impact on our stay. We stayed in a newly refurbished room with two double beds.  It was lovely and extremely comfortable. We made good use of the pool, sauna and steam room. Towels provided and part of the pool reserved for serious up-and-down swimming.  Breakfast was lovely and all the staff so, so helpful and cheerful. We would stay again.
Comment Title: Bit of luxury en route to caravan

Comments: First the bad: Although we're fit and we were happy to use the stairways (which were well-lit and they had windows with outside views), the lifts were sometimes out. There were lifts that were out throughout our stay.  The breakfasts were good, but they kept changing the location of the breakfasts without letting guests know where to go. Sometimes, breakfasts were in the atrium, sometimes to the right of the front desk, sometimes above the main level.  Also, although there was no danger to anyone, they served fresh orange juice and fresh fruit had sometimes turned bad.   The Good outweighed the bad: The room was ample and everything worked in the room.  The hotel staff were pleasant, efficient, and helpful.   The breakfasts had a wide array of good choices, ample quantity, and

Comments: Would have been great to be advised when booking that the hotel is under renovation and that the restaurant is closed for a   Within 10 Mins has to have the keys redone 4 Times!  Front of house staff rather poor.  Would I recommend - I’m not sure.

Comments: Stayed here on two occasions and both times very pleased. The Hotel decor is stunning, the rooms very spacious and comfortable.  Breakfasts were Fab and room service very quick.  The staff are all very friendly and happy to assist where needed.  The pool area looks amazing, unfortunately i was unable to take the plunge as we had to leave warly. Will defo return.

I normally go for the slightly cheaper hotel chains wherever I go but as this was in such a good location for visiting the museums etc I decided it was worth paying a bit more and treating ourselves.   On the positive side, it is undoubtedly an excellent location and a grand old building. It is also very quiet considering it is next to a main road, the windows are extremely well insulated.  However, it is a little bit tired around the edges and the ongoing renovations are definitely overdue. I was particularly annoyed that they charge for wi-fi, in this day and age I expect free wi-fi as standard (even cheap budget hotels offer this) not as a luxury only afforded to members of their loyalty programme. £9.99 a day is taking the ****, especially when I couldn't get a 4G signal in
Date of Review: Jill N wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: I stay at a lot of Marriotts and am a platinum Marriott's rewards member. I thought this Marriott was above and beyond the already good service that I always find at Marriott properties. In addition, the hotel itself is a beautiful building that has great character, comfortable rooms, and plenty of amenities.

Booked on line. Reception very busy but the staff were friendly. Smaller room than I expected but with all I needed for overnight stay. Breakfast was not the worst but certainly I’ve had better in other smaller hotels. Nice areas to relax and enjoy surrounding.  Overall it’s was ok.

Comments: We stayed here for one night & found the Hotel a lovely Victorian Gem. It is being refurbished & the new rooms which are classed as Superior are lovely. The rooms still awaiting refurbishment though larger are dated & classed as De Luxe.  We found the staff friendly & helpful. The Breakfast is excellent, plenty of choice with a chef preparing eggs freshly cooked as you like.  The refurbishment though ongoing was not an issue. Though only a few lifts available led to longer wait times.  I will stay here again when in Bristol.

My husband and I always stay here when in Bristol. We love the location, the building, the decor, the rooms, the beds, the spa.. everything about this hotel we think is spot on. We always will return xx

Gosh, the hotel is having a refurb.I do admit to being a little shocked when walking through the beautiful period entrance door. Dark,is the first word that springs to mind, Victorian mourning . For a reception this is not at all welcoming. Perhaps a re think on this one!. The Drawing room was pleasent but very office'y. The new bar has not been finished yet. The Palmer's bar still has its beautiful silk wallpaper, which I hope they keep. Overall a lovely hotel and staff always polite and helpful.
Date of Review: Andrea H wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: Probably because the hotel was undergoing renovation but I was disappointed by the lobby as I was expected something more impressive given the impressing building. The lounge bar could be warmer and more cosy. Decoration and furnitures are missing. The restaurant is set in an impressive covered courtyard. Same it could be warmer (actually it was freezing inside).Pool looked great. Rooms are oldish but still ok. Breakfast was good,  nothing fancy.
Date of Review: Laurent P wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: We attended a close friends wedding last weekend. The room used for the wedding was beautiful and the bar staff were friendly and accommodating. The wedding planner was also present and organised and I’m pleased to say the day went perfectly for my friend.  On a personal level I am very disappointed. We booked a room, which was far from cheap to find out parking is not included and would cost an extra £35. On top of that we had to pay a £50 deposit on a pre-payed room which they took twice from our account. They did not refund this straight away. We had to wait 3 working days for it to be returned, and still now we have only received half of it back. We have had to chase for our money back, had no apology, correspondence or compensation from the manager. They are happy to take

Comments: Stay twice at the hotel, 12 days apart. Old building with some great features. Overall looking very tired which does not reflect in the price. No mention on the website that major work on lifts and rooms is on going. It does need it, but noise from drills and parts of the hotel off limits. The hotel has a lot going on at the moment but I don’t think that they are putting their customers first. I am tired of paying good money for a room with issues. TV controller needing new batteries (stay one) stain on the carpet, no hot water out of the sink tap, electrical double socket on the wall loose, a bath towel under the sink which looked clean, but was soaking wet. All the later were from stay 2. Also one stay 2, a bolt was found outside our door and I reported to reception that at
Date of Review: Alan H wrote a review Aug 2018
Comment Title: A big dose of TLC required to hotel and to customers

Comments: What a wonderful stay at the Marriot. We were treated very specially from arrival to departure. Great food, breakfast was just perfect. Some areas of the hotel need a refresh of the decor. But the charm is still here. *****stars
Date of Review: PeteHillary M wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: We booked this hotel as a gift for my son and daughter in law. They decided to take it on their anniversary. I informed the hotel and they provided them with a card, truffles and wine, what a lovely surprise. They also put them into a refurbished room. My son and daughter in law were made to feel very special.

Just came here for drinks prior to a Graduation Ceremony at the cathedral. Nicely served and comfortable seating on an outside terrace in the sun. Did not stay here but got the feeling that the hotel was a bit tired looking in the communal areas downstairs.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Aug 2018
Response comment: Dear 370andyk  Thank you for your feedback about the hotel bar.   I'm glad to hear you were nicely served by the restaurant staff, we hope you'll pop in for another drink in the sun soon.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley.

Comments: This is a great hotel, very nice rooms, comfortable and spacious.  The location is fantastic for exploring Bristol on foot and the bar and terrace are very welcome at the end of th day. Staff were polite and helpful, couldn’t have asked for more.
Date of Review: Claire S wrote a review Aug 2018

Comments: Stayed 1 night for the balloon fiesta and loved it. Hotel staff where really welcoming and helpful. They were obviously busy but always smiling. Kids had a fantastic time and now want to live in the hotel.

We stayed Thursday 2nd to Sunday 5th August, fourth floor room and paid for breakfast in advance. We also paid for parking but this was refunded as the noise on Friday morning in particular, from renovation work, was very intrusive. The room was a very good temperature, nice and cool on three really hot days. The bed was fantastic, cleaning standards high and no complaints about the room at all. Maybe a hot chocolate sachet would be nice? Our only complaints were the noise already mentioned, which started at 8.15, and the poor lift service. Two lifts were completely unavailable, a third was out of service for some of our stay and one evening we waited five minutes before walking down (I don’t mind walking downstairs at all but there are some people who can’t do this, and I
Comment Title: Reasonable experience but not quite four star

Comments: Our only issue with the Marriott Royal hotel was finding it! We have usually stayed at the Marriott City Centre which is modern and in City Centre so we were pleasantly surprised when booking the Royal. It's old so the rooms were smaller but well maintained. There is no concierge floor but we enjoyed our complementary drink in one of the 3 bars. The restaurant was only just acceptable but there were restaurants in the area which were much better. The gym and pool are small but met some friendly locals. We liked the Royal well enough that we've booked it for our Oct 2018 UK trip.

First time to stay at the Marriot Royal Hotel in Bristol and was very disappointed and disgusted.  I arrived Friday evening to the hotel and was exhausted after driving for 5hrs to get there.   The bathroom had BODY HAIRS including PUBIC HAIRS on the bathroom floor.  I used a tissue to clean most of it but realised this was ridiculous and there was too many small hairs as well as feeling exhausted.  As a guest I expected to pay for a room to be clean, welcoming and presentable but not like this!  The next day I requested 4 times for my bathroom floor to be cleaned and wiped down:  At 1.30pm was my first request and explained the issue of body hairs which included pubic hairs on the bathroom floor and was told housekeeping will be doing this shortly, however no one came.   Around

Comments: Good location, decent facilities pool, sauna, steam. Close to what ever you need to get to. Room was decent size. Nice bed and good shower room. Towels and robes to go down pool and sauna also so all in all can't complain.... and reduced parking if staying. All good

We had a nice stay, good quiet room that had not yet been renovated. The lift did not operate to our floor due to renovations in hotel. The renovations did not cause too much noise btw. The bed was comfy but breakfast would have to be improved, especially the bacon. Would stay again if necessary. Free wifi for Marriot members.
Date of Review: Sebastian K wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: We booked a family room here for my Son's graduation.  It proved to be the perfect location, with the graduation ceremony taking place next door in Bristol Cathedral.  Although the check-in time was a rather late 4.30, they got our room ready by just after 2pm, and the check in receptionist helpfully advised us to go for one on the second floor, which had just recently been refurbished.  The room was excellent - multiple USB charging points at convenient places, a fab TV that allowed you to stream music from your phone, really comfy beds, and a great bathroom and shower - all sparkling new and fresh.  The hotel facilities were also top notch - the bar prices were quite reasonable for a hotel of this type, there was an underground car park, which was a little pricey at £16, but
Comment Title: Delivered on all counts - well done Marriot!

Comments: We stayed for one night at this hotel in July 2018 for $143.95 US. We got this hotel on hotels.com on a last minute booking. The hotel has parking but we did not use it, we parked in one of the overnight parking garages near the Harbourside. The hotel is centrally located for sight seeing in Bristol. The service was great. The breakfast was included and was first class. Our room was modern and clean with 2 queen size beds which were very comfortable. The only small complaint was the flat pillows. We were in England when they were experiencing very hot weather and this room had A/C which was such a wonderful relief compared to the other hotels we had stayed in, the best night sleep we got the whole trip. My daughter left her beloved teddy bear behind and we only discovered it
Date of Review: Vivienne N wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: Well located for graduation ceremony at cathedral next door. In the centre of town and walking distance to the harbour. Lot of bars and restaurants within walking distance - 3 to 7 minutes You will pay double for graduation season. Friendly reception staff and room service courteous Rooms are clean Has late breakfast hours from 6.30 to 11.00am which was welcome so we could sleep longer. No complimentary water bottles or free Wifi for such a expensive hotel which is rather poor. No fridge in room Pillows were flat and we could have done with a extra one each. Charming interior and pictures etc. Hotel has its own underground car park - £ 16 / night.

All I can say, is that I could not find anything to fault this hotel.   The staff were polite, welcoming, considerate and spoke perfect English. The room was amazing, with views over the city, an amazing shower that I wanted to take home The breakfast was heaven on Earth - even down to having a chef on hand to cook eggs and omelettes to order.  Having stayed at a number of hotels in Bristol recently - this is definitely the best!

What a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location.   The parking well I'd advise a quick looks on google street Earth view just to get your bearings as it is a little tricky to see where you would enter the car park. Once parked it's easy to navigate your way to reception where a friendly smile awaited us. After a complimentary coffee in there lounge we set off to explore the city and what it had to offer.   Upon arising back at the hotel check in was a fairly simple standard process pretty stress free. Not that it was an issue for us but the lift was out of order. The room itself was clean and tidy when we entered. We had 2 very comfy double beds a large TV and a very lovely bathroom. The bathroom was well present d and finished well. We were sort a set of towels but once we rang

One night stay in Bristol, great location not far from the river, bars and restaurants. Lovely refurbished room and good size bathroom with walk in shower. Excellent leisure facilities, pool and Jacuzzi. Good choice at breakfast, usual hot and cold, definitely recommend the omelettes. Did have concerns with the fire exit on our floor which took you into another corridor where work was still being carried out. Check this out prior to booking or on arrival.
Date of Review: Helen M wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: Stayed here and so pleased to have been put in a renovated room.  Te bathrooms are so much better.  Really nice fittings and huge walk-in shower.  The hotel is still undergoing a refurbishment but I am sure if the new bathrooms are anything to go by the hotel will be much improved.  Excellent location.  Really good breakfast.
Date of Review: Renee R wrote a review Jul 2018
Comment Title: So much better now that they have updated their bathrooms

Comments: Staff on front desk were incredibly helpful.. Credit to the hotel. Great location. Room was clean and functional and aircon great in the current British heatwave. Hotel looking tired and time for refurb to propel it back to "grand status"

My wife and I enjoyed our recent stay at the Bristol Marriott.  The hotel is located centrally, is an old fashioned attractive building with pleasant public rooms and offered us a spacious and comfortable bedroom.   We did not dine at the hotel but we did partake of enjoy an ample breakfast from the extensive buffet.  We did order some room service though, which arrived very promptly.  When we checked in the staff offered us a 'quiet room' or a 'room with a view', the former being a room overlooking an inner courtyard which in fact was quite a pleasant view and indeed was quiet which pleased my wife.  There were a couple of tiny details which prompted the 4 rather than 5 star review.  Firstly there was refurbishment going on which only improve things for the next guests.

Booked this hotel as it is in walking distance of the university graduation venues and close to the harbour area and offered secure parking. We had five rooms between us and whilst all were clean and comfortable, with good beds decent linens, and new TVs,  the older rooms did look tired and seemed poor value compared with the refurbished rooms.  The staff were helpful and courteous, and when the air conditioning did not work in one room it  was repaired very promptly. The main public rooms have been refurbished but the pool area is still rather dated. Overall a good hotel, which should get better. Only real quibble is why no free WiFi?
Comment Title: Great location and staff but there is a refurbishment going on...

Comments: Excellent location in central Bristol, close to the Harbourside at the bottom of Park Street. A majestic and beautiful building with stunning public rooms and exceptionally friendly staff. Oh and the swimming pool was a welcome treat after a day’s sightseeing and shopping. What let the hotel down was our room (1415) and whilst I appreciate the hotel is undergoing refurbishment there were fundamental oddities- firstly the need to pay a pretty high amount for WiFi. In this day and age free WiFi for guests is, or should be the norm - even Wetherspoons offer this! Secondly the hospitality tray .. we fancied a cup of tea but had to search high and low - eventually located the kettle in a cupboard next to the fridge but the tray itself was in the bottom of the wardrobe (!!) very
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 19 Jul 2018
Response comment: Dear TiredTraveller14  Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations. As a teachable moment, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to look into the details you mentioned in regards to the placement of the hospitality tray. Please note that WI-FI is available complimentary throughout the hotel for all Marriott rewards members which is free to join and only takes a few moments of your time at check in.  Thank you for your positive and constructive feedback.  We hope your travels bring you back to the hotel again soon.  Kind regards,  Jess Oakley

Comments: A lovely hotel in a great location.  Easy to find.  Underground parking (not cheap, but convenient). Undergoing significant refurbishment. It's a very elegant and impressive building - both inside and out.  The bar is just off reception and has an outside terrace area. While the terrace is attractive it's surrounded by the hotel, so you don't get much in the way of views.   The dinning room whilst slightly dark is spacious and atmospheric. The food was very good. Wine list o.k. Restaurant service for dinner and breakfast very good.  I didn't get to sample the leisure club and pool but they both looked very inviting. The loos are located in the basement opposite the leisure club. Which is a fair walk from the restaurant, down some stairs, along a corridor, through some doors and
Comment Title: Great location - just off the centre of Bristol, near the Docks and Park Street

Comments: Would recommend this. The sports area and spa need refurbishment bit this may be planned as other works are underway. Have to be 16 to use jacuzzi etc. but the jacuzzi was too hot anyway. The bedrooms were clean and spacious and nice and quiet too and there was a good range at breakfast. The location was good near the cathedral.

Having contacted the main booking centre (call centre) on several occasions and not received the best service, until I made the final call and spoke to someone who listened to our booking  requirements and immediately actioned them I did not expect a great stay.  I have a disability and therefore the 'detail' was essential to ensure a fairly relaxed stay.  We were greeted with a smile on arrival and check in was very easy.  I hope that the reception area has a planned renovation as it is quite third and without atmosphere. Our room was excellent (and I am very critical) We had a King Size Bed and enough room for me to move around.  The en suite was fabulous and obviously very new.  My only, and it is a small issue, is that you cannot open a window and in the warm weather you
Date of Review: Julie L wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: We stayed here for 2 nights and had a number of issues. We raised some immediately and staff were accommodating. We also let the manager know after our stay and were reasonably compensated for the issues.  I’m so glad that they recognised some of the problems as it’s a hotel I would like to stay in again and probably will.
Comment Title: Not a great stay, but staff very helpful

Comments: I feel being in city centre staff is more trained to serve tourist than business traveller.  I am regular to Marriott and I love it but this one was least hospitable. Though I am gold member and used to Marriott  hospitality but staff in this hotel was in kind off rush.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 18 Jul 2018
Response comment: Dear chap_budy,  Thank you for providing your honest feedback following this recent visit to the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  Following this feedback I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations during this stay. In particular regarding the service you received at reception. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard and that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.   Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know, and I would be happy to speak with you at a time of your convenience.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: I stayed here for one night with my friend. The location is excellent, it is in the middle of the city and surrounded by shops and restaurants. The parking is underneath the hotel & it costs £16 per day, just something to be aware of. When we arrived, we found the receptionists a bit clueless and unprofessional. The first one didn’t realise we had made a booking & the second one almost didn’t give us the room because she thought we were under 18, even though she checked our identification. The room itself was lovely, it was very clean and spacious. However, in the evening we could hear construction work right next door which was distracting. Also, the wifi for our room wasn’t free, which wasn’t made clear on the website. We had to pay £4.99 per day, which I think is ridiculous
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

Providing the highest level of hospitality is our number one priority and we sincerely apologize for falling short of meeting your expectations , in particular regarding the service you received at reception, your experience with our Leisure Club and regarding the noise disturbance you faced. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard and that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure the necessary guidelines are in place to prevent similar issues from occurring in the future.   Additionally if you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know, and I would be happy to speak with you at a time of your convenience.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com 0117 9255100

Comments: I have stayed here years ago but have had several meetings here too.  The place is being refurbished so that’s a positive  What is a real surprise is in this day and age they want to charge £10 for WiFi . Come on Marriott get with the times  I’m  The room we had was comfortable but appreciating the fact it had air con I still like to open a window   Who ever did the design needs to rethink. The kettle was i a cupboard under the tv but all other tea making stuff was in the wardrobe.  There was a business type swivel chair but not desk !
Comment Title: Quick stop to see my son

Comments: Wonderful hotel right in the middle of the sights. Warm staff and newly remodeled rooms made our stay wonderful. The location is right next to the Bristol Cathedral and s surrounded by great local food, craft beer, and cider pubs.

We stayed for 2 nights in a family room. Unfortunately, the day we arrived there was a cycling festival on in Bristol and access to the hotel was limited by road closures- totally out of the hotel’s control. The staff were super helpful when we phoned for help and couldn’t have been better, on what must have been a really difficult and challenging day for them.  Our room on the second floor had been newly refurbished and was clean, comfortable and cool, which was just what we needed.   The pool was great and our two kids had such fun in it.  Special thanks to Maria, who organised a little treat for my daughter as it was her birthday, helped us store our car roof box safely (hotel car park has *very* low ceilings), and was just amazing!  Yes- there are ongoing renovations, but it

Helpful polite staff, bedrooms to a good standard however the bathrooms have seen better days bath flexed away from the wall to reveal mould, the lift was also out of order to the guest bedrooms over the weekend also some very inconsiderate guests running up and down the corridor shouting and knocking on doors. During the weekend of our stay there was a cycle race on in the city preventing us from leaving the hotel in our car. A number of the main guest areas have been refurbished to a high standard and the breakfast was excellent

I stay in different hotels every single week and haven’t been here for many years so popped in for afternoon tea with my family.  Inside the staff are lovely. They are helpful, efficient and do their work well. The afternoon tea was great. What surprised me Houghton, was that of the two/three staff I saw on the door outside on Sunday afternoon, while very polite, were happy to look on ignoring some large items of rubbish on the hotel steps that anyone could have picked up. I wanted to pick them up myself but felt that being on hotel property the staff should do this.
Date of Review: David M wrote a review Jul 2018
Comment Title: Nice stop on the way through town

Comments: We stayed for 1 night to attend a dinner and dance. Although a spacious and pleasant hotel it felt tired and in overall need of some attention. Food was ok at dinner and breakfast. Rooms were nice although the windows need attention as there was a lot of noise from outside throughout the night. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Stayed night before a university open day.  Having driven down from Norfolk was pleased parking had a slot (very very small bays though so beware nervous parkers!) But its an underground city car park so expected and adequate.  Check in a little long winded but room quiet and good. Evening meal in restaurant lovely.  Slept well and very good buffet breakfast.  Great location, friendly helpful staff and would stay again
Date of Review: Vicky R wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: Disappointed with my stay. I expected from a quality brand a lot better. I cannot fault the staff as great service at reception and bar staff were professional and courteous. My advice to management is if you have extensive refurbishment work then inform customers at check in. Leave a letter in the rooms as well. Don’t just let people check in to experience workmen disturb your stay with heavy work on upper floor. This shows disregard to your guests. I was offered to move , but why check people onto the below floor knowing they may be disturbed. The lift out of order as well was a nuisance that happens, but it adds to the inconvenience not expected at a four star hotel. I would also say you need to refurbish all rooms as mine had a lot of areas that required attention. I would

Comments: The best bath in a hotel in years - long enough, seperate taps for bath and shower, quick fill and good drain away. Similarly in the basin- no problems with the plug, quick fill, good drainage and plenty of hot water. Eureka!  The restaurant catered for my dietary needs of gluten and dairy free both at dinner and breakfast. Chef adapted certain recipes and staff were very helpful. Soya milk was supplied for my room. I enjoyed my meals.
Date of Review: Carol C wrote a review Jul 2018

Comments: We have had 2 very good nights at this hotel, as others have commented it is undergoing decorating works, as we were out a lot of the time we were not bothered by this, we ate in house both nights and the food although good was not quite as good as it could be ( if you order chips be aware they come smothered in salt). We ordered wine with the meal on the first night, and my partners glass had a lipstick mark on the glass, pointed it out to the staff, and it was replaced ( with a larger quantity, and a free one in the bar afterwards ) I personally thought the bar and restaurant prices high, then 12.5% service charge added.  Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices, even poached eggs cooked to order, so no complaints there.  We had booked a junior suite and were impressed by

Hard to find a better location. Right on College Green. Public areas, bars and restaurant at this hotel are beautiful. Parking and check in were easy. Went up to our room. It was very hot and stuffy. Could not open the window. Set aircon to lowest temperature and fan to highest setting. Went out for dinner. When we came back, the temperature was just the same at 25.5 degrees. Rang down to reception. We can't move you as we are full. We can send some fans, no thanks, that won't cool down the room one iota. We can send you a bottle of water. We can't open the window due 'health and safety'. We had to contemplate sleeping with the door open as it was cooler in the corridor. 20% knocked off the bill, and no you can't speak to the duty manager. Room 1536. Be warned. Visit in winter.
Comment Title: Beautiful location. Room was uncomfortably hot. No airconditioning

Comments: Stayed again this weekend at the Bristol Marriot Royal, upgraded to a suite newly reburbished so happy with it lots of space excellent style, staff as usual are welcoming and breakfast is tasty and has a very good range of different foods from english breakfast to continental with pastries and cheeses.
Date of Review: Chris R wrote a review Jun 2018

Comments: I took a bus from the Bristol airport to the hotel which took about 40 minutes.  However, it dropped you off about a block from the hotel which was convenient.  It was an affordable option other than taking a taxi.  The hotel is currently under renovation which I generally didn't mind, despite one elevator being out of service, except for the fact that after flying all night, i wanted to take a nap before exploring the city and there was a lot of construction noise and drilling that could be heard.  I don't fault the hotel though.  There is no perfect time to do this work.    The location is wonderful.  It is right on the harbor and close to restaurants and the water ferry which you could take to other points on the water (which I highly recommend taking).  I am not sure I could

One of my favourite Mariott's outside London, I'd not stayed her for a while but I had run events here over the years. I was not aware that renovation work was underway and was slightly irritated that this was not clearly stated on the Marriott booking page. However I was not incommoded although there were minor obstructions to the 4th for corridor and lift lobby and one set of lifts was out of commission.  I was upgraded to a Junior Suite on arrival and was told that this was one of the renovated rooms - despite other comments this was a full rebuild, not just a refresh. Really nice bathroom (shower and bath) twice the size of the usual Marriott bathrooms and nice entrance hall with wardrobe and suitcase stand.  The corner bedroom was large with four windows and a cupola in the
Date of Review: Stewart K wrote a review Jun 2018
Comment Title: Good quality renovations of much loved 'Grande Dame'

Comments: I had expected more... the room had been ‘renovated ‘ but it’s more of a quick lick of paint and new carpet rather than a modern refurb.  As platinum elite , and used to Starwood treatment, I was expecting a great automatic upgrade. I knew there were rooms available as I received a mail the day before inviting me to pay for an upgrade.   I had to emphatically request the upgrade and We were given a superior room which was ok. Not particularly spacious or spectacular but looked towards the water which I guess was nice.   I have stayed at nicer hotels.

Comments: Stayed for one night, lovely large room, very comfortable bed, huge bathroom, lots of space. Hotel undergoing renovation but the work was not intrusive and I think the end result will be splendid. At the moment some areas are a bit tired, but this should not dissuade you from using this hotel. Its location is excellent with the centre of Bristol on your door step, a wide range of restaurants are in the immediate vicinity, the major shopping gear of the city is a gentle 10 minute walk away and the hotels large underground car park is a godsend in a modern busy city like Bristol.  Overall we enjoyed our stay, the staff were lovely and I would certainly recommend this hotel when visiting Bristol

I realize this hotel is in an older building but it desperately needs an update. The room I was assigned to was old and tired (probably because I had a cheap corporate rate).   I also visiting a coworker's suite which was on a recently upgraded wing. Much nicer and more akin to a standard business hotel.   This is your typical business hotel whose primary revenue is on volume so expect long queues at check in and check out. Staff were friendly but not warm or personable as there are too many guests for them to keep track off.  Thankfully it was only for 1 night.  Would not recommend unless they update. Exterior of the building is gorgeous however!
Comment Title: Desperately in need of an update
