Comments: I booked the hotel through a third party website, where I paid in advance on the basis of not making any changes/cancelations to the booking. Unfortunately, one of our party broke her hip just before our visit and was in hospital. I contacted the hotel expecting to be told that they would not change the date and we would have to forfeit the booking; but I was very pleasantly surprised with how accommodating the hotel were. They allowed us to change the date due to the circumstances and were really helpful in the process. When we arrived at the hotel we found that all the staff were extremely helpful and courteous throughout.    My family and I spent a night in the hotel this weekend (June 2018). The hotel is very centrally located. A minute walk and you are in the centre. It is
Comment Title: Excellent hotel, will definitely be back

Comments: This is my second visit. I booked through an app, so I paid up front some months ago. The offer was good for such a high quality establishment... but from my previous experience I had no qualms with the costs. You get what you pay for.  One thing to remember with this hotel - the parking and breakfast are in general, separate options.... you book on arrival and this will increase costs over a weekend stay by an average of £80-£100... but, the parking is safe and the breakfast is plentiful with lots of choice. The website says this is £17 each, but that depends on your booking option. We paid £13 each.  Our room was a Queen double option. Like the last time, there is plenty of space, all the mod-cons - it is clean and in good order. We were lucky to be given a room right next to
Date of Review: Len H wrote a review Jun 2018

Comments: Arrived at the hotel for one nights stay , on arrival we were booked into our room there was i slight housekeeping issue with the room so went to the reception to inform them , we were automatically upgraded and the room was lovely , very professional staff and service and a lovely nights sleep , would recomend this hotel to family and friends

Stayed here for 1 night as a stop over and the hotel was very outdated. The rooms also need a big renovation but the location of the hotel was really good. I am aware they are now in the process of refurbishing it but will not be visit this hotel again until it has been completed.

Comments: We recently stayed at this hotel, and it was nothing short of amazing, we were there for our daughters wedding and both sets of family guests stayed there, nothing was too much trouble, everyone from start to finish were helpful and accommodating, food was superb and plentiful, waiting staff were very attentive and couldn't do enough. The hotel provided many gifts to the happy couple, and an upgrade to The Royal Suite by way of a gift, which was stunning, the rest of our rooms were amazing too, and we also had use of the pool and gym etc which were faultless... I highly recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone looking for somewhere to stay in Bristol, one more thing I must mention is James the concierge, who helped us immensely, nothing was too much trouble for him, and I
Date of Review: Joan G wrote a review Jun 2018

Comments: Was kindly taken here for a treat on my birthday. We arrived, parked up and then headed to reception. The staff were really helpful and gave us a map and showed us how to get to where we wanted to go. The room itself is very nicely decorated, the beds big and comfy and the bathroom is very smart and has a great shower. As it was for my birthday they brought a little bottle of Merlot to the room which was a lovely touch. It was a very pleasant stay and if I visit Bristol again I'm sure to try here
Comment Title: If this hotel was a lady I'd Marri-ott

Comments: We stayed at The Marriott with friends on a night out in Bristol.  When we arrived we were told we had to pay a £50 deposit which they would refund at some point after we checked out! I had already prepaid all three rooms before we arrived! Considering the mini bars in the rooms are empty and they had already got my card details I just think to insist on a deposit is just rude!  I had requested that all 3 rooms were on the same floor... we were told that they were, however they weren’t so I had to ask for my friend to be moved. Then our room was horrifically noisy as there were huge renovations going on in the hotel.. this is fair enough but we should have been informed of this when booking and possibly offered a discount.  Checking out was also a nightmare we were in a big rush

Comments: Had a great stay at the Marriot Royal on bank holiday Monday. The staff were friendly nd helpful. the pool was really lovely and the whole place was just welcoming and comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast with lots of choice and really good coffee. The children were made to feel welcome. The are is great for visiting the harbour area of the city, right next to the water taxi stop, lots of food and drink places to explore and the wonderful Cathedral is well worth a visit.
Comment Title: Lovely shirt stay. We will be returning

Comments: Great spot in town. A little shabby and understand refurbishment works are about to commence. Staff friendly but check in was incredibly slow. Also called room service and was told there was a 45 minute wait so ended up coming down to the bar myself which isn’t what you expect. Good sized room but a word of warning we were on the first floor and the noise On a Friday night from revellers and police cars was horrendous - in fact it didn’t stop until gone 4.30am.   Get a high up room if you can but on the whole good hotel in good spot and with underground parking which is handy.

Comments: We booked mainly for the big underground car park £16 o/n and convenience to city centre.  Good traditional ambiance with work in progress. Lots of interesting history and features. We were upgraded to a Superior Room on 3rd floor, just completed, except it did not have the kettle and air conditioning.  Uncomfortably hot; we were partially refunded. Good breakfast and very helpful staff. The bar, tea room on ground floor is most pleasing.  If all goes well it will be a very attractive hotel. Prices are good now but likely to increase as work completes.
Date of Review: Robert E wrote a review Jun 2018

Once again thank you for sharing your valued feedback.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Spend the bank holiday monday in Bristol, stayed at the royal Marriott which is by the river with easy access to all the main sights and restaurants.  The hotel really went all out to welcome us, thank you to slyvia and the team for all the effort to decorate the room, we were genuinely touched.  Thanks again   Denise
Comment Title: Lovely stay at the royal Marriott!

Comments: Hotel under refurbishment - and it badly needs it - if you get an ‘old’ room like ours the aircon was very noisy, but you had to have it on as room otherwise smelt dank.   We changed rooms but receptionist advised against a newly refurbished room as they were having issues with the new aircon system.     Parking garage bays designed for very very small cars.
Date of Review: Peter B wrote a review May 2018

Responded 30 May 2018

Please may I take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for not meeting your expectations during this visit, and for all the issues you faced. In particular in regards to the issues you faced with the air conditioning and the size of the car park. Please be assured that all your feedback has been shared with the relevant managers across the hotel, and it will be reviewed in a effort to improve for the future.   If you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know and I would be more than happy to discuss further with you.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Hotel is being updated at present,therefore should not put you in a room that is unacceptable,food awful, white wine warm,was told the fridge was broken!!!!!! Reported all this to the Hotel where we had a Refund. Will not return
Date of Review: Christine B wrote a review May 2018

Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

Response comment: Dear Christine B,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.   I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for all the issues you faced during you recent stay with us, in particular regarding your experience in our Restaurant. Please be assured that all your feedback has been shared with the relevant departments and managers across the hotel in a effort to improve and prevent similar issues occurring in the future.  Furthermore if you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know and I would be more than happy to discuss further with you.   Once again thank you for sharing your valued feedback.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: We checked into this lovely looking hotel. Went out for the evening and returned to the hotel room to be greeted by an almighty buzzing which can only be described as a generator on full blast or somebody vacuuming right next to your bed. We called the duty manager who was apologetic but advised there were no other rooms available and waived the car park. He offered ear plugs but they personally annoy me and at the end of the day I've paid money to stay in a hotel to sleep comfortably without ear plugs. I'm writing this review at 5.08am you guessed it can't sleep!! Room 702 avoid!!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 29 May 2018
Response comment: Dear MassDangelo,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your recent visit.   I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for all the issues you experienced during your recent stay. As we pride ourselves on service our recent stay did obviously not meet yours, or our own, expectations. I would like to assure you that this is not our usual standard, and if possible I would like to discuss this further with you, in an effort to improve and prevent similar issue from occurring in the future.   If you could please let me know the best contact number and time to reach you, or feel free to contact me via the phone or email listed below.   I look forward to speaking with you.   My sincerest apologies once again.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Too many recent experiences of Marriott hotels that seem to deprioritise the need for cyclical maintenance. Hotel undergoing a major refurb (long overdue) with no warning to guests when they book. Old light fittings, desks, random chairs left lying around in the corridors outside the bedroom. Much of the car park taken up with furniture. No guidance on the leisure facilities location or the opening hours. Changing rooms at the pool dirty and covered in hair. Pool dark and in need of updating. Carpets threadbare and needing replaced in the bedroom corridors. Four star hotel that charges £4.99 for WiFi!! Utterly bizarre.
Comment Title: Four star hotel charges extra for WiFi!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 29 May 2018
Response comment: Dear SusanEE40,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.   I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for falling short of your expectations, in particular regarding the overall condition of the hotel, Leisure Club and our public areas. Please be assured that all your feedback has been shared with the relevant departments and managers across the hotel.   Furthermore if you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know and I would be more than happy to contact you at a time of your convenience.  Once again thank you for sharing your valued feedback.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: We chose this hotel for our one night in Bristol because it had a car park (although £16 for overnight stay) and was close to the venue of our concert.  It is fabulously located for the waterfront and I'm sure for many other amenities but a bit sad inside.  Upgrading and refurbishments are taking place but even our re-furbed room on the 4th floor was lacking.  Why would you build a new shower and not put in a shelf for soap, shampoo etc?  Where was the magnifying mirror and how sad was the vast and hideous mis-placed attempt at 'cool' that was the piece of modern 'art' on the wall next to our bed.  The stuff of nightmares!  The room was a decent size but they were mean with the bed.  Lots of a space for a six footer but a queen size was what was there.  The clothes cupboard
Comment Title: Great location but could try harder
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 25 May 2018
Response comment: Dear Highgateglobetrotter,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.   Whilst I am glad to hear you enjoyed certain elements of your stay, I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for falling short of your expectations in other areas, in particular in regarding to the overall condition of the hotel and your new room. Please be assured that all your feedback has been shared with the relevant departments and managers across the hotel.  Furthermore if you would like to discuss these issues any further then please do not hesitate to let me know, as I would be more than happy to discuss further with you at a time of your convenience.  Once again thank you for sharing your valued feedback.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: The hotel is traditional and holds a great history.  People like Winston Churchill have stayed in that hotel.  When we checked in the hotel we were given a room at the very far end in  one of the lower floors which was not renovated. But the front desk staff was very kind to quickly take the right decision of providing us a room which was just perfect for our trip.  Bogi was very kind and  so thoughtful that immediately an apology note with complementary snack and a bottle of water was sent to our room.  Now that is what I call great hospitality.  On the fourth floor we were given the merchant room which had all the amenities, a fridge, electric kettle and the bathroom was renovated. The bed was very comfortable and the stay was very  good.  We were on holiday and this hotel
Date of Review: Vasiha Begum wrote a review May 2018
Comment Title: The Best place to stay in Bristol

Comments: This hotel was a much older Marriott that is undergoing a refurbishment at the moment.  I had a suite and it was amazingly spacious.  This hotel has character and charm.  I loved my stay and would definitely return when I am in the area next.

We booked this two night break for your wedding anniversary, I was slightly worried after reading some of the comments but I must say we personally wasn't disappointed! We were given a newly refurbished room which was done to a high standard, a bottle of wine and a card was waiting to greet us from the hotel, thank you!! All the staff were polite and helpful, the breakfast was of a very good standard and the hotel is located in a lovely area with the harbour front just around the corner the weather was wonderful so all in all we had a beautiful few days thank you Bristol marriott royal.
Date of Review: Julie D wrote a review May 2018

Comments: So dated,I no there updating but how could you charge the same prices for something so run down the spa was disgusting and filthy,never stay again,got 20% back but should of got 100% no carpark £16 over night
Date of Review: Denise N wrote a review May 2018

I would like to assure you that this is not our usual standard, and I would love the opportunity to hear more about your recent stay in an effort to improve and prevent similar issue from occurring in the future. Comments: Perfect location, the hotel is clean and provides great hospitality. The staff was very helpful! The hotel provides almost every facility. I'll recommend this hotel to everyone :). You wont regret, just be there:)

Stayed at this hotel as a stop point on a business trip. Clean room and friendly staff. Great facilities and menu choice was endless - breakfast was a little down fall as had to wait for service a whole but all apologies & smiles once served.

The hotel itself is nice but if you're after a relaxing Spa break please don't go to Lavish Spa (based in the hotel but under separate management); unless you're after hard beds which leave you with backaches, tiny rooms where the therapists can only reach either your right or left side, and therapists who are friendly but are not professionally trained and some come with 1.5 inch long nails. Oh, and if you want to be offered to sit on a sofa which has a purple throw that has a thick layer of dust and hair on it, then you'll find it in Lavish Spa.  Lavish Spa's online brouchure claims to be a relaxing high end Spa etc but this is far from the truth.  It resembles a run down high street salon than a Spa worthy of being in a hotel as the Marriott.  Just wanted to leave this review
Comment Title: Hotel is nice but Lavish Spa is misleading, dirty and unprofessional!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 11 May 2018
Response comment: Dear nhassani90  Thank you for your honest feedback and review.  We are very sorry to hear about your experience in Lavish Salon and be assured your comments have been passed on to them. If there is anything else we can do for you then please do not hesitate to get in touch.  Kind regards,  Heidi Mobbs

Comments: We have stayed in the hotel many times. I cannot fault the location of this hotel, it is so central which makes walking around the city centre aa breeze. Some of the floors have been refurbished which has made a vast improvement. The room we had was a good size and had everything you need including a really nice modern bathroom. Only negative is the AC which was not very effective and given you cannot open the windows the room was a bit stuffy. All of the staff were very friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking to stay in the heart of Bristol.
Date of Review: Alison W wrote a review May 2018

Comments: I was lucky enough to stay in a room on the 4th floor that has undergone refurb program.  "Deluxe" double room was fairly small (1 double bed, dressing table and 1 other chair), but nicely furnished.  Delightfully comfortable bed and bed linen.  Bathroom had double size shower with tasteful tiling and sanitary wear.  Nice view over the cathedral and buildings behind the hotel. Service excellent Breakfast buffet proper 4 star standard.  Clean calm breakfast environment with a large variety of hot and cold offerings.  Particularly liked the lady on the omlette/egg station.  Coffee could have been hotter but overall very good.
Comment Title: Fab hotel in good location (refurb ongoing)

Comments: This title may seem harsh, but I donexpext more from a global brand that boasts of its 4 star glory. The first impressions are strong, a mock renaissance look which clearly was popular in its day. Now this former 80's glam looks like tired decor which has wrinkles all over it. The hotel is going through a refurbishment and I was fortunate enough to be given room 1401 which was a newly decorated room. Take my advise and do not take this room, there are way too many problems here to contend with. The first thing that hits you is the awful odour as you open the door. I would say something is severely wrong in the bathroom. Upon closer inspection the flush doesn't work properly and the basin tap is connected incorrectly. So if you want hot water turn to the cold icon and vice versa.
Date of Review: Nad H wrote a review May 2018
Comment Title: Should be called HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS

Comments: Title says it all really. Having stayed here a good number of times before I have to say that its a massive fall from its former grace.  Check in was slow and laborious despite being pre booked and paid for. We were informed that the hotel may be a bit noisy that night as there was a function on. I did state that we were not here for a function but a nice restful night and would like a quite room. That was met with a shrug of the shoulders and no more conversation just our room key.   We were located on floor two. Immediately on exiting the lift towards the rooms you were met with a mass storage area for tables/chairs/chandeliers and the like. It appeared that these items had just been randomly placed with no thought of the guest journey. Worst arrival on a hotel floor that I

Comments: A firm favourite it’s a brilliant location great facilities.  A warm welcome. The receptionist Bogi was so friendly and helpful.  Parking is great value if staying in hotel.  Rooms are well appointed and modern.  If visiting Bristol I doubt you’ll find better than the Marriott College Green.  If back in Bristol we wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

The hotel is going through a refurbishment at the moment, we were given a room on the 4th floor but we could here the building works and the tv did not work . They gave us a different room and free drinks The staff did their best gave us a discount  On our stay  Would use again but when all works are carried out

Comments: Hotel is easy to find by car or on foot. The hotel displays signs inside explaining that they are refurbishing the premises. Despite this, we had a wonderful one night stop-over. All staff are warm, welcoming and friendly. All services were very good. Underground car park was good value at £16 per 24 hour day and you have until midnight the day you check out, knowing your car is safe.
Comment Title: Good hotel in good, central location.

Comments: Been here twice and on both occasions have had a great time. Room and Breakfast was great and the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Car park was £16 for over 24 hours which l thought was good value.Parking is under the Hotel and the spaces can be tight to park which is the only downside to the palace.

Booked this for a last minute get away as a couple - literally booked the night before.  The hotel has a great Victorian fascade and looks impressive. It is located right in the centre of Bristol and was easy to find.   Parking is directly below the hotel (charged separately at £16 but it does give you more than 24 hours). The entrance from the parking to the hotel is internally as does smack a bit of entering a nice hotel through a utilitarian multi-storey concrete carpark (plus fire door between the car park and the hotel was stuck open!).  The reception staff were excellent and very friendly throughout our stay - very accommodating, which was refreshing for a chain hotel. All smiles, courteous, polite, perfect level of interest ('how was your trip?' etc) - even the cleaning
Comment Title: Good Service, Great Location, Decor tired.

Comments: The hotel has a fantastic city centre location. The building has good potential but many fixtures looking very old and need replacing. The carpet in particular is poor condition and in many places had tape holding it together.

Comments: Great location on college green. Near to King street for the pubs and to the quays for all the bars restaurants etc you could possibly want. Room was comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was medicore, dining room very warm  Staff all very busy
Date of Review: mary w wrote a review Apr 2018

Comments: We had a brilliant weekend in Bristol and staying in such a beautiful, luxurious hotel in such a central location was just the icing on the cake! Comfortable bed, large clean room, friendly staff who can’t do enough for you. Great breakfast,the scrambled eggs were just amazing! Coffee to take out with you every day. Little things that make the difference. Read other reviews about the hotel looking a bit tired but we saw none of this. Already organising our next trip staying here!

Location perfect, busy area, but hotel protected from any noise. Hotel had a buzz about it, a wedding and another function going on too.  Car parking was decent, rooms perfect, this just worked well for us.   We will be back, no faults

Had a weekend here   Great location   BUT   Back at 11pm for a sleep and the noise is horrendous due to wedding downstairs   We were offered another room however at this time if night that is more hassle than its worth   We have been told the music will continue to 12:30am  So unless you are accustomed to sleeping above a nightclub i would give this hotel a big miss certainly on a Saturday night
Comment Title: Never stay when a wedding is on
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 16 Apr 2018
Response comment: Dear billy12380,  Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your most recent stay with us.   May I please take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for the noise disturbance you experienced during your recent stay. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that your feedback has been taken on board. Whilst we do always strive to deal with noise disturbances in an effective manner we obviously fell short of our goal during this stay, and for that I sincerely apologise.  If you are willing, could I kindly ask for a moment of your time to get in touch with myself by phone or email at a time of your convenience to discuss these matters further.   My sincerest apologies once again.   Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Manager  0117 9255100  Heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com

Comments: The location of this hotel is perfect for the best parts of Bristol City Centre.  Underground parking is available (at a cost).  The room was spacious, comfortable and well equipped.  There were minor signs of ageing, especially in the corridor but the hotel is in the process of a refurbishment so eventually things will be as new.  The whole place was immaculately clean.  Staff were very friendly and helpful and the environment was one of old-fashioned good service.  There were very comfortable and spacious lounge and bar areas that looked very grand.  The gym and swimming pool were excellent.  Despite the limited space there was plenty of equipment to meet all requirements.  The pool was placed in a very nice environment with plenty of space to lounge and relax.  The gym staff

Stayed on Sunday Night and really liked this place. The room was not luxurious but large and very clean. There is a safe, T&C (instant and Nespresso) bottled water, Iron and board, hairdryer but no fridge. Massive TV but have to pay for Wifi.  We were at the back with no view but that was not important to us. Great location on College Green, easy to find and uphill all the way to Clifton! Wide choice for breakfast - both  hot and cold items. All staff who interacted with us were very pleasant and courteous. Didn't use the leisure facilities so cannot comment. My only gripe is, like others, the car park. I drive a sportscar and there is a pointless ramp on the way into the car park which is a real obstacle, there was a horrendous thump when I drove over it (very slowly). Anyway I

Lovely hotel in a great location for shopping, dining and drinks in Bristol.  Rooms were very comfortable and in keeping with the Victorian facade of the building.  Leisure facilities were very nice with a Roman themed pool, Jacuzzi and Sauna.  We will definitely return.

Stayed here for a couple of nights on a weekend break. The hotel is easy to get to and has an underground car park which is very useful at £16.00 per day. The staff were very helpful and our room was quiet and comfortable. The Hotel is centrally located and Bristol is an easy city to walk round. Would definitely use again. Can't comment on the restaurant or bar as we we did not use them.
Comment Title: Pleasant stay in a central location

Comments: A very pleasant stay. Nice room with a view of the cathedral. ( Could do with more than one chair for two guests though.) Not over impressed with the art selection in our room either - we were not sure if it was Jimmy Hendrix or Prince but either looked as though they had sampled to many of the funny cigarettes. That's the only slight negatives. The bed is superbly comfortable. The whole hotel has a pleasant feel from a different era but mixed where appropriate with the modern. Most importantly the staff were very helpful and courteous. Freshly fried eggs in the morning would be a good idea for a hotel of this standard.

Yep... it’s a Marriott hotel. Not a modern box though and something that harks back to a slightly more grand older traditional setting. The rooms are spacious and comfortable the dining and bar are all very good. All things you would expect from a decent Marriott hotel. The reason this is one of my favourite hotels in Bristol is entirely down to the staff. Without exception courteous, friendly, warm and genuine giving a real feeling that you are a ‘guest’ in the true sense of the word! Always makes for a very enjoyable stay!

Firstly the location is superb. Parking is available under the hotel that is very convenient (at extra charge); i understand that you can come and go as you like within the set charge.  The rooms are comfortable, if a little dated.  We had reserved a king size bed through Marriott directly,  but when we arrived there were none available; this despite having paid a premium for a superior room to ensure out bed choice - very frustrating!  Kids loved the pool and the breakfast was typically impressive,  Overall a good stay we shall be returning!
Date of Review: Peter W wrote a review Apr 2018

Comments: We were upgraded to a full suite on arrival which was lovely, very spacious and comfortable except for the sofa which was rock hard and uncomfortable, bathroom bit dated but very large with separate shower. Staff very friendly and welcoming, nice meal in Restaurant although not much atmosphere as almost empty, breakfast was good. Location is the best. All in all a nice place to stay while in Bristol.

Visitors beware, there is major building work currently underway at this hotel. From early morning to 6pm, all you’ll hear is the sound of drilling and hammering resonating around the whole hotel.   There is no warning notice online about this and the sound of heavy machinery is unavoidable across all floors. The fact that they haven’t shut the hotel, or at the least given people advance warning tells me that they care more about squeezing every penny of profit out of unsuspecting guests than they do about giving you a comfortable stay.  I’m voting with my feat and will not be staying at a Marriott again.

Comments: Amazing cosy hotel with great friendly staff, great location, warm and nice place to stay in the city of Bristol. Next door to the historic Bristol Cathedral which you can’t afford to overlook. Quite accessible to most places and eating facilities and the watershed
Date of Review: Victor o wrote a review Mar 2018

Comments: Mould all in the bathroom. Hotel is desperate for a refurb. Changing rooms were thifhy for leisure facilities. Paint falling into the pool, steam room needs a clean and Jacuzzi was pointless, powerless and had too much chlorine. Room was small. Not a £170 a night room. The mercure the night before knocked spots off it. It was very poor. The bar was comfortable and bar men were friendly.
Date of Review: Tony W wrote a review Mar 2018

Additionally we do hope that our on-going refurbishment works should hopefully tackle some of these issues you have experienced as well. Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Assistant Front Office Manager  Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel  heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com  0117 9255100

Comments: Stayed here for one night, to have a kid & pet free ngt.  We stayed in room 1028, which was ok (as expected), although my wife and I both thought the bed was uncomfortable and didn’t really get a good sleep,  (we both suffer with mobility issues),  we live in Bristol so we stayed here to have a chill out evening for birthday celebration,   Walters bar & grill was very good food, and prices was as expected,   Could do with a lick of paint and carpets renewing, the hotel is being refurbished soon, but I very much hope they keep it as original as possible, as that was the reason we choose to stay at this hotel,  breakfast was good quality produce and cooked well,   Bad point: menu in our room was out of date, and as there is plenty of local ciders Breweries in and round Bristol I

Excellent location in the heart of the city.  All the usual Marriott brand standards.  Could be described a slightly tired, especially the bedrooms and leisure facilities.  Staff helpful and nice to have the leisure facilities.
Comment Title: Good Four Star Property in the Heart of the City

Comments: We stayed here on the very snowy weekend and turned up without booking but due to many cancellations they had plenty of rooms.  We were offered an upgrade and joined the Marriott club and were told parking was included int he upgrade only to find it had been added to the bill at £14 for the night.  This was sorted when we spoke to reception but the couple we were with also had a mistake on their bill.  The room was pleasant enough although a little dated.  The hotel is undergoing work to upgrade it and it will be interesting to see the difference after this is completed.  Our evening meal and breakfast were very nice.  Very handy location for the the hippodrome and bars etc.   The staff were all friendly and helpful.
Date of Review: Jenny W wrote a review Mar 2018
Comment Title: Pleasant stay-be interesting to see after updating

Comments: Another wonderful stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal. We were upgraded to a lovely Junior Suite, well looked after by the staff.  Check in and check out were easy and we had a wonderful breakfast both days.    A lovely relaxing stay that has charged my batteries for another week at work.

Stayed here for one night and attended a conference being held at hotel. Check in smooth and room clean and had everything needed for an overnight stay. Only comment I would make regarding room was taps were covered in lime scale but everything else was spotless. Breakfast was a standard buffet found in many hotels and was well stocked and freshly cooked. All staff  were polite and helpful. Thankfully my company picked up the parking costs as there is a car park associated with hotel but is not owned by them. Overall a good one night stay would have loved to try pool but unfortunately didn't have time .. maybe next time
Date of Review: Lynn A wrote a review Mar 2018

Comments: I hate leaving a bad review for this hotel.  I stay here all the time - 2-3 times a year for the last 8 years and we got married here.... it has such special memories. Unfortunately this trip was not so special.   The facilities are in desperate need of being spruced up.  The hotel is doing some work (more on that later!). The gym changing rooms were dirty. REALLY dirty. Hair in the shower and blood on the floor and they smelt. There was a lot of damp around the pool area and it didn’t feel nice being there.   The room was pleasant. Typical room for us. We like a cathedral view and we had one of the best.   The bathroom however was full of cracked tiles, the sink was cracked, the bath had chips out of it, the taps were covered in limescale.....  The nice little Marshfield Bakery

Comments: We were going to Bristol for the weekend to see Wicked and cancelled our booking because the snow was bad. In sat morning it was thawing so we decided to go as the theatre wouldn't refund our tickets. We phoned this hotel as it was so close to the theatre in case it was still snowy in Bristol. The person on the phone was very helpful about what the conditions were and then told us how to get discounts by signing up to the members card.  When we arrived we were greeted by the reception staff in a really friendly way. It is a large hotel and our room was a bit of a walk but it was really clean,comfortable,quiet,light and provided with everything we needed including toiletries,showercap,slippers,robes,iron,water,coffee machine,kettle,fridge,safe ECT. The room was a little dated but

Have stayed here for a long weekend every December for the past 4 years. The staff, breakfast and facilities are always of a very high standard. In a excellent location for restaurants and bars, getting here could not be easier too as within 10 minutes of the station. The pool was a delight on a cold afternoon after several hours of shopping and the room had everything we needed to feel at home.
Date of Review: clive H wrote a review Mar 2018

Comments: My wife and I stayed for two nights and overall our experience was ok. The hotel is currently being refurbished and it certainly needs it.We had a junior suite which has lots of space and two large TV sets, not sure why.The bathroom was spacious and had a separate shower and bath. The water flow in the shower was not great and the bath was very long but very narrow.The biggest problem was that the room was freezing. The air conditioning was useless and we had to use an oil filled electric heater that was supplied.After complaining that the room was still very cold we were given a second heater which helped but had to be left on all night.We stayed on the weekend of the 24th of February and I dread to think how it would have been a week later when all the snow arrived.,

Comments: Fine staff service in this classic hotel, in the process of being updated. Kids love the pool and free buffet breakfast. Easy bus transport to zoo, walk to other main attractions. A fine family getaway base.
Comment Title: Classic Hotel-Well situated-Great Pool/location for kids

Comments: Nice room, great staff and beautiful building. Good central location too. But I had problems with the internet (which they fixed) no water in the room (ok, before check in official time of 4pm and was planned maintenance.. but that’s a late check in anyway) and the room was very cold (weather icy, but room heating wasn’t working properly).  I’d go back tho, because of the positives.

Comments: The outside gives the impression of grandeur but the room we stayed in was tatty at best. DIrty and stained chair and carpet. Damp patches in the bathroom and filthy Windows. The children in the next door room  were so noisey  they kept me awake until 12.30 and they  started up again at 6.15 the following morning, and the bed was unbelievably hard. The staff however were perfect. .

Comments: £16 to park your car here, when already paying a fortune for your room is a rip off. The rooms are old dated with wood rot stains and scuffs everywhere. The evening meal was awful, and the breakfast even worse. Even the overpriced beer was flat and undrinkable
Comment Title: Rip off car park, old dated hotel, food awful

Comments: Me and my partner chose Royal Marriott Bristol for our one night stay whilst we were in the city for a music event. We both had a lovely stay and I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the hotel was slightly dated in places and could do with a little updating but other than that it was great. The rooms were well furnished, very spacious and clean. Credit to the staff at the hotel, I did mention that this was a present for my partner and they went the extra mile in leaving us chocolates, a bottle of prosecco and flowers which was a nice touch.

This is our third visit, but we left feeling a little disappointed. I complained on check out regarding the shower in our room having not had a decent shower during our stay. The shower went from freezing cold to boiling hot with no warning, both annoying and dangerous. Our complaint was noted but I did not feel that they actually cared. I was not offered any recompense, not even a discount off the extortionate parking charge. I feel £16 a night when there is no alternative is excessive. The staff were in the main very pleasant, and on discovering it was my son's birthday at breakfast bought him a treat. Which was very sweet. The hotel is tired and I see it is due a refurbishment but it is still an expensive place to stay and feels neglected and not worth the money. I would
Date of Review: Clare L wrote a review Feb 2018

Comments: My friends and I attended the hotel and were immediately impressed with the building and the friendliness of the staff at reception. The staff looked very smart and were always wearing a smile. The breakfast was great and again the staff there were excellent.  However, our stay was completely spoilt when we decided to visit the spa before we left for home. We entered the changing rooms and found it to be very cramped inside. The floor was covered in dirty water, more than you'd expect in a changing room. There was hair all over the floor and the lockers themselves looked dirty. There was grime on the sideboards and the wallpaper in one of the cubicles was peeling off. Within this cubicle, there was more dirt and grime ok the skirting board and on the door.  When using a public
Comment Title: Worst Spa I have ever been too

Comments: Stayed here on 15th and 16th February and yes it is a nice hotel in an excellent position, and the staff are really good, amongst the best we’ve come across.   The welcome on arrival was  very very good. We were asked if we would prefer a room overlooking the harbour or College Green. We opted for the harbour view and were given room 1312.  It was fine apart from an extremely dirty window which didn’t look like it had been cleaned for months. It really should have been cleaned.. There  was a kettle, a coffee filter machine and a coffee machine with sachets which we really didn’t get… It took us ages to try and work out how it worked and in the end a nice lady from reception came and showed us. Was it worth the wait. No..   One thing though that really wasn’t up to 4* standard
Comment Title: With a few improvements wouold have  got  a very good rating

Comments: We thought this hotel was perfectly located on College Green - all the main sites within easy walking distance. Hotel staff was lovely; bedroom large with comfy bed and very clean. Used the hotel pool and spa which was great, and breakfast outstanding!
Date of Review: Craig H wrote a review Feb 2018

Comments: My husband took me for an overnight stay at the Royal Marriott for my 40th birthday, we had a lovely time and I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone, the hotel was tired in places and could do with a little updating but other than that it was a great place to stay. The staff were so friendly and helpful, I was given cake and champagne upon arrival which was a lovely touch. We used the hotel restaurant Walters and had an amazing meal the food was just amazing and the waiter Caleb was such a lovely guy, and brilliant at his job!!! Tisor booked us in and again he was such a lovely guy so helpful, both staff a real credit to the hotel. We ate and drank at the hotel and everything was fabulous, the real asset to the hotel are the staff, so friendly and hard working, thank you all

We booked a one night stay as we were visiting family in the area and decided to extend our stay.  We paid £71 for a Queen level room and £16 to park under the hotel. The room was immaculate, we enjoyed a peaceful night's sleep and we visited the Spa for a swim and steam room. We could not fault our stay. Yes the hotel is a little tired, but this was explained upon booking and in truth it didn't matter. What made our stay was the genuine warmth and friendliness of the staff, who are a credit to the management. Yes I am sure there is a brief to smile and speak to the guests but without exception the customer service was way and beyond. We will certainly return. New decor or whatever it's the service that counts and we value that highly.
Date of Review: Paul and Rachel wrote a review Feb 2018

Comments: Went for a Cream Tea with friends.  Service poor, English Breakfast Tea - warm. Coffee ordered instead, arrived in a Starbucks mug - hot and fine. Cream Tea was good, nice selection of sandwiches and cakes. Gluten Free Cream Tea option ordered, bread wasn't fresh, which was disappointing. Hotel is magnificent from the outside, and should really be Bristol's best, given it's location, but, it isn't. It's very tired and in need of refurbishment inside, and Staff didn't meet my expectations. I left feeling very disappointed, as this should have been a wonderful afternoon experience.
Date of Review: Lynne W wrote a review Feb 2018

Comments: Lets start with the good bits: great location, parking is available and the room are, as you would expect for a Marriott, clean and comfortable. But you pay an extortionate price for this, as they do not include parking or breakfast at their rate, which is v expensive for the fare/service provided. However, obvious things like giving the WIFI code when you check in rather than making you call Reception to get it once you are in the room, providing milk for the coffee and putting two single beds into one for a couple is obvious: when I complained, I was informed that I only needed to call Reception to get it fixed. Why should I? These are obvious things which, if you run an hotel properly, you should do without being asked. We were only there for one night and I didn't want all
Comment Title: Great for a trip back to the 1960s...and an expensive one at that!

Comments: We came for two nights to celebrate husband birthday, we being my son, my husband and I, nothing was too much for them, I purchased a birthday cake which they made in-house and let me choose what type it was divine, they delivered it @ 7am on the day of his birthday with candles. They gave us a complimentary bottle of wine with a nice card, they help organise balloons and told us nothing would be too much trouble.. fab gym I am a PT so really enjoyed going in and training in morning and breakfast was amazing I’ve booked to come back in two weeks for a friends birthday and can not wait! Thank you to the amazing staff!
Comment Title: Wow what an amazing effort made for husband birthday

Comments: I have finally got round to writing a review for this hotel. My other half booked this hotel for a treat for me (and our young son). First impressions were an impressive building in a great location. The interior in parts is however a little shabby. Room was nice and big. Comfortable beds, clean etc. However, come evening it is evident that the walls are paper thin and we had what seemed to be a hen do gathering on one side of us. I didn’t get to sleep until early morning and the noise kept waking my 3 year old. Thought there would be little point causing a scene by ringing reception etc.  My other issue was the changing rooms for the swimming pool were filthy. Not inviting at all.  Breakfast was ok. Very busy though.  Staff were friendly at all times.  Generally disappointing

Comments: 170 or thereabouts was the price of this room for a midweek night in bristol.I should have spent 100 on a travel lodge and spent the 70 at the nearest bar.  this hotel exudes old world charm, beautiful building and entrance, unformed concierge etc. but the glamour has faded.  from the attractive lobby we descended to a hideous corridor - faded and dated carpet, picture hooks on the wall with long lost pictures, utility rooms and kitchens nearby with doors open - goodness me the facade slipped quickly.  we tried the swimming pool - horrible changing rooms and very dated. the pool was ok, and a nice sauna. showers seemed dirty.  headed up for dinner - the restaurant was deserted - abandon that idea and headed out (review to follow in due course).  back to the room - it was

Comments: Confortable beds and spacious bedrooms , nice spa and swimming pool, clean and long opening hours. Excellent breakfast with a nice selection (good quality bacon) and easy parking under the hôtel. Good value, we will go back!
Date of Review: Les gîtes de S wrote a review Feb 2018

Comments: This is a very good hotel - big rooms, big beds and a very good fitness centre in the basement. Staff are confident, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, though spoiled by really horrid music (who listens to loud American rock on a Sunday morning?).  Have been here before and will return. Great place.
Date of Review: Mark O wrote a review Feb 2018
Comment Title: Very good hotel in middle of Bristol

Comments: This hotel is being refurbished so it's a bit run down and not up to the normal Marriott standard. Good location though Bristol is a bit run down nowadays with vacant shops and graffiti everywhere. Friendly staff and good breakfast  Swimming pool looked good too.
Date of Review: Jonathan M wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: We stayed here on Saturday evening and, upon arrival, could see there was a party for dental graduates taking place. At check in we were given the choice of a ground floor room or another on the first floor and informed the first floor room could experience some disturbance due to the event. We chose the first floor as we were going out to meet friends and would be back after midnight. Our room was located in an area currently being refurbished and I initially had my reservations, but these vanished when we opened to door. Our accommodation was beautiful, spacious and spotless. The hotel staff were an absolute pleasure to deal with and were exceptionally helpful for our entire stay. We had intended to take our evening meal in the hotel restaurant but, due to other arrangements,
Date of Review: Dino L wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: I've stayed here a few times. The hotel is nice and the staff are quiet friendly. Unfortunately this time there was a party downstairs and my room seemed to be above the noise. Had I known I would have requested a quiet room but no one told me this when I checked in.  If a hotel is going to have loud music until midnight which can be heard in certain rooms, surely they should make the person aware when they check in. It shouldn't be my responsibility to check.  I'll probably stay elsewhere now as this has ruined my quiet night away.
Comment Title: Nice hotel when there isn't a party going on

Comments: Lovely place, Friendly staff.  But felt the beautiful building lacked tlc on many levels. 1 the sink was cracked and mouldy tiles. 2 The curtains were dirty 3 The air con only seemed blow cold air 4 The cooked breakfast was a little on the cold side  Would stay again but would not pay the price we did
Date of Review: Julia M wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: The hotel building seems quite old and seems a bit tired.   The location is great with walking distance to several attractions, museums, aquarium, pubs, bars and shopping  The rooms are large. The bathrooms are a bit old-fashioned with separate water faucets for hot and cold water. The Wifi are slow and you have to sign up for a reward program to avoid paying extra. It is also noicy, especially if you have a room close to the bar. The cleaning of the room should have been better. I found an old receipt from one of the earlier guest in one of the chairs and it took to days before they cleaned the washbasin.  The breakfast is great.  There is a nice pool area with a big hot tub. There is also a small, but well equipped fitness area. Both garded by a receptionist.  The conference

Stayed overnight for daughters sixteenth,hotel upgraded us to superior room on arrival and as we entered our room she was greeted with massive 16 balloons, champagne bucket with j20's, flowers,Marriott teddy and a plate of different cakes with happy birthday hand written in Choc sauce,amazing,the staff are wonderfully friendly,I love the original features,hope the reference doesn't go too modern,thank you the Marriott,made my girls birthday so special x
Date of Review: Louise K wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: I booked two nights for my family as a Christmas treat and again, we were not didappointed. This is clearly one of the the top quality hotels in Bristol and we booked at very competative prices. Very comfortable rooms and exellent breakfast with wide variety of choices.

The hotel is fine, civilized check in, spacious room, clean, tidy and comfortable.  We had a wander across the road to a pub and tried some decent beer before returning to the hotel for dinner.  During dinner needed to go to the toilet - beer unfortunately has that effect! the nearest toilet was all the way back through reception and down one flight of stairs along another corridor before finding the toilet and then being able to relax. So my advice is go before you sit down for dinner. the food was fine but cold by the time I returned from my expedition to the toilet.  Another very annoying thing is when the bill came for dinner they had added a service charge and also left a space marked gratuity - in my book one or the other but not both.
Comment Title: Go to the toilet before dinner...............!

Comments: Hotel quite easy to find and parked in their car park. Check-in was slow and we had problems with our triple family room booking, extra bed could not be put in the room due to "health and safety", instead we were offered two interconnecting doubles in the front overlooking a busy road despite having pre-booked a quiet room. This involved a bit of unwanted walking around the hotel as we looked at the alternative accommodation. Sound insulation however is good and the rooms were not too noisy. In fact rooms are very spacious and bed was OK although no spare bedding and as I had (eventually) turned the vent off (temperature control unit somewhat broken) and was a bit cold, I slept in a jumper. The hotel is very well located for the sights of Bristol, including the harbour etc. The

Stayed 2 nights Friday and Saturday. Great location as close to everything, well as close as you can be to a very spread out Bristol!!  The hotel itself is a bit dated, worn and not aired. We were first given a room on the forth floor and the window did not open. We asked for a room with an opening window and they moved us easily to the ground floor. Much nicer and aired room.  Staff are friendly and professional.

I stayed at this wonderful hotel with my parents for two nights, the staff are amazing, excellent service the rooms are lovely. Cannot recommend it highly enough. Will definitely stay again when we visit Bristol
Date of Review: Laura Johnson wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: Me and my family of 4, (mother, father and two teenage children) were going to Bristol to do some Boxing Day shopping and we needed a convenient, clean and relatively affordable hotel to stay in for the night. We chose a room with 2 double beds and The Marriott royal was definitely all of those things and more. As soon as you walked into the door you were greeted and made welcome, the reception staff were very easy to talk to and first impressions were very very good. Straight away we could tell that it was very upkept and neat. Again the rooms were impressive, with facilities such as a hairdryer, tea, coffee, shampoo and conditioner and bottled water free of charge. The bathroom was fully equipped with a lovely full length bath and shower, sink and even a bee-day! The beds were
Date of Review: Casey P wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: We always stay here when we go to the Colston Hall to see a band. This time it was for Paul Heaton and Jacqui Abbott. The hotel was fairly quiet and check in was a bit tedious as their loyalty website had not worked properly prior to arrival.The swimming pool was great (and quiet when we went in). Breakfast was as good as any buffet style breakfast can ever be. We will no doubt stay here again.

Stayed NYE 2017 as well had a party to go to at the top of park st. Booked through booking .com as it was cheapest at £117 for deluxe double. No breakfast. £17.5 each ot if we ordered before 12 midnight  £12.50 pp. So we didn't bother.   Finding the car park was a bit tricky the entrance wasn't very well lit but was only £16 from 5pm over night and all next day if we wanted. The walk from carpark to loby was quite a walk plus a lift but once we got there check In was quick and easy although they did want credit card to take £50 deposit which i said I couldn't do so paid for parking instead. The young lady was helpful and happy as well as knowledgeable.   The room was clean and the bed was comfortable as was the bathroom and there was the usual  amenities shower gel soap etc

Not as good as i expected for the price i paid. Which means that i would not go back. The bathrooms are really old and rusty. Needs improvements urgently. Great buffet breakfast. Good location and great potential .
Date of Review: Theo W wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: We chose this on location mostly and weren't disappointed. Drive to the hotel's underground car-park, check-in, and you are steps away from Bristol's lively centre.   We chose the 'deluxe' room, the cheapest available, and were pleasantly surprised to get a large and luxurious soundproofed room that exceeded our expectations. Yes, we were on the ground floor at the back of the hotel with a view of nothing worth looking at, but the room was otherwise hard to fault.  Breakfast was excellent and the late checkout helped us make the most of the leisure facilities. Unfortunately the sauna and steam-room were closed that day, with engineers in to fix the fault, but to be honest they looked a bit tired. The pool and changing rooms were also a little tired but adequate.  The car-park
Comment Title: Perfect location, excellent breakfast, great standard room, disappointing but adequate leisure facility

Comments: Stayed at this hotel for a one night break with my wife. This is a very large old property in a good location close to theatres and restaurants. There is a large car park in the basement with lifts up to the ground level. Hotel guests are charged £16 for overnight parking. Check-in was quick, easy & pleasant.  Overall the hotel is in need of refurbishment. It would have been a nice luxurious place in the past but has lost it's grandeur as much of it is looking worn & tired. We were in a room on one of the "superior" floors. This was comfortable with good amenities including coffee/tea making and iron/ironing board. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was also OK but there was no mixer tap and the hot water was extermely hot so difficult to use. We used the swimming pool but
Date of Review: Amarjit D wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: I have wanted to stay at the Royal hotel since I was a child living in Bristol. Finally I get to stay there and was very disappointed. I would have complained at the time but husband who has an acquired brain injury does not like to make a fuss.  On our return home I looked for an email address on your web site but couldn’t find one so I went to your Facebook page and sent a private message asking for an email address. As it was New Year’s Eve I didn’t expect a reply, but I did expect one by the end of work today. I have not had a reply which is why I am now putting this on Facebook, and will put on Twitter later. I have tried to pass on my comments quietly but as not given an email address after a reasonable time I have  that this might get a response.  No one to help with bags
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Abdallah H, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 4 Jan 2018
Response comment: Dear Tarlach2011,   Thank you for taking the time to submit your review. It was an absolute pleasure speaking yesterday. I am glad we managed to address the feedback from your last stay to your satisfaction and we sincerely look forward to your next visit. I remain at your kind disposal.   Sincerely  Abdallah Hammoud  Front Office Manager  01179255100

Comments: Right from the start, we knew we were going to have a great Christmas at the Marriot. As soon as we walked in we were impressed with grandeur of the the hotel and the staff on reception were both extremely friendly and helpful. It’s a very relaxing hotel and the joining rooms that we had were excellent. Location is also superb, being very close to the river and modern shopping are areas. Can’t recommend enough!!
Date of Review: Matt W wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: Check-in process: Fast & Efficient.  Staff. Room: Family room with 2 double beds You could tell it is an old courtly building which was probably updated perhaps a decade or so ago. Which means it needs updating. The most pressing need is for USB ports to charge todays smartphones. I bought and adaptor for my phone but which ever electrical outlet I plugged it into, it would not work. Which leads me to believe that the problem was not the socket or the phone, as both adaptor and socket worked in the next hotel we stayed in. Staff was very friendly: we needed a few items after we checked in and our needs were promptly seen to. Breakfast was superb: traditional, English Location is superb. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed in a family room with 2 double beds. Spacious room, clean and tidy with all that we needed. Staff were Lovely, especially the reception and restaurant staff. They could not have been more helpful. The kids loved the swimming pool. The bathrooms down stairs could do with a refurb. Hotel is located centrally and easy to get about in Bristol. We had a really pleasant stay and would stay again.
Date of Review: Stephanie L wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: Just stayed for two nights including New Year's Eve and was slightly disappointed.  The staff were really friendly and the hotel in general was as good as I expected but the overall experience was spoils by some small things.  How can a hotel of this size and stature not offer free wifi?  Charging is just being greedy.  The sauna was out of action for the days we were there which was a shame as we used the spa both days.  The large bar and palm court dining room were also not bring used which certainly detracted from the experience and was one of the reasons we didn't have breakfast in the hotel.   I would return in the future but would check carefully what was available in advance.
Date of Review: Alan B wrote a review Jan 2018

Comments: The hotel was in a good location, not far from Temple Meads train station. The meeting room was quiet and comfortable but did look very tired. Air con was very noisy and frustratingly the WiFi kept dropping out which was a real problem. Refreshments were fine. Probably wouldn’t return due to the WiFi issues.

Comments: When you first arrive by car, you have to navigate the carpark under the hotel (through the archway) If you have a tall vehicle (4x4) there is only 1 floor available, if full you will have to park elsewhere. Parking here is £16 per night. The hotel is OK but there are certain areas that need some updating, the carpet in our very long corridor was looking worn and there was a trip hazard where the join was sticking up. Room was OK, no choose of pillows just feather ones , duvet not top quality. Breakfast is included in the room price but is like a Premier Inn, buffet style, was it worth twice the cost- no. I have to say with the exception of one , the reception staff are abrupt and unsmiling. Would we stay there again, probably not.
Date of Review: Catrina B wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: We stayed here to be close to certain areas we planned to visit.  We couldn't have chosen a better location.  Close to restaurants, entertainment, waterfront, and city centre.  The staff was very friendly and helpful - our keys didn't work the first time around and they remedied it and gave us drink vouchers for the trouble - thank you.  We did have issues with the wifi cutting out and then coming back on.    The bar and drawing room were great for a pre-dinner drink and relaxing in the lobby.  The restaurant was great for the breakfast buffet.  One of the better ones we have  experienced recently.  We didn't eat there other than breakfast.    The car park is right next to the hotel entrance and sufficient.  Be careful when driving there as our GPS and our phone (google maps)

Lovely room but hated the air con. Its a beautiful grand old hotel but modern restaurant did`nt work for me with the rest of the building. Staff friendly and efficient. Great position next to the cathedral and river, lovely walks.
Date of Review: Dee D wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: A two night stay at this super hotel, situated right I. The heart of the city, next to the Cathedral Great on its parking...many thanks to Jack for his guidance to get the van in Really warm friendly greeting at check in from Karen. And a great chat about photography...keep taking this pictures Karen Really lovely room with a view over the river. Loads of space and a really nice bathroom The hotel has a really elegant feel Very very comfortable beds Good leisure facilities with a lovely warm pool, and leisure facilities Fantastic service in the restaurant from a really happy Christmas spirited staff, particularly the very lovely Vicky, who chatted to us over dinner and breakfast, thanks Vicky for making us so welcome Really great buffet breakfast with everything to get your day

My family and I stayed here the week before Xmas for 2 nights. Nice food in the bar, the room was excellent and very clean, and breakfast very good with a good selection. Easy walk from here to the city centre and good under hotel parking. Good visit all round, we will stay here again.

We had outstanding service here. We were given a complimentary upgrade due to an anniversary, a particular shout out to Andreea on reception who was both helpful and wonderfully welcoming. The location of the hotel is brilliant, right next to the harbour side, full of bars and restaurants and the winter wonderland. Room was lovely and breakfast was incredible. Would stay here again without hesitation. Thank you
Date of Review: Anna S wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: We had a great time staying here as a family. It was a bit cosy with four of us in one room but not too bad. The room had a view of the hotel so that was a bit disappointing. Overall the hotel has a great atmosphere and the children loved the huge range of choice at breakfast. They also loved the pool which wasn't too crowded most of the time. The decor in the room and bathroom was a little tired. We opted to park in the Trenchard Street car park which was a bit of a walk but the saving was considerable
Comment Title: Nice atmosphere, no view and room slightly tired. Great breakfast and pool

Comments: I read a few reviews before actually travelling, and what they say about staff is quite true. The staff were warm and friendly. I specifically single out the restaurant staff who were really nice and prompt with orders. The food in general was excellent. The room was spacious, warm (the heater/ac worked very well); the bathroom was clean and spacious. Perhaps the hotel can consider changing some rooms from bathtubs to showers cubicles. I enjoyed my stay and would go back if an opportunity arises.
Date of Review: Noni M wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: A short break weekend to do some festive shopping in Bristol. A lovely hotel in the heart of Bristol, so much is within walking distance. Rooms are a good size with comfy beds and good decor, only down side is the duvets are thin and in mid December we noticed it. Breakfast is a reasonable price at £12, great full selection and I managed a 5 course breakfast which set me up for the whole day.  Parking is currently £16 for 24 hours and there is an underground multi storey car park.  Would love to stay here again next year, the Christmas market in Broadmeed has a great atmosphere and there are loads of restaurants in the area to choose from in Corn street and by the docks.

Stayed here with a few colleagues for a couple of nights on business. Great location for Bristol and all the night spots. Convenient parking underneath the hotel, if a little tight at times. Good large room, but couldnt open the window for some fresh air, so had to realy on aircon - cold therefore came back!! Good breakfast if you prebook at the lower price, Was a reasonable price, and maybe back.
Date of Review: Alistair W wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: Yesterday went to an annual Charity Luncheon which was being held for the first time at the Marriott Royal.  Frankly I have never been so disappointed with the quality of the meal and the inept service.  Not what one would expect from such a prestigious hotel.  The food was of a very poor standard.  Turkey main course produced on one plate which had obviously been heated before being served.  Soggy yorkshire, tasteless thin slices of white turkey and vegetables which were either over or under cooked.  Sprouts impossible to cut they were so hard and under cooked.  Starter was mediocre warmish soup and the desert which was probably the best part of the meal was cheese cake.  The service if you can call it that was extremely slow and inept.  The waitresses looked as if they could
Date of Review: Nikki K wrote a review Dec 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

Response comment: Dear Nikkik46,  Thank you for your feedback in relation to the lunch held here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   We pride ourselves on delivering a memorable experience, we have unfortunately fallen short of your expectations. On behalf of the hotel, please accept our sincere apologies.  I have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Whilst I appreciate this has made you question as to whether to come back to us in future, I still hope to have an opportunity to improve your event experience with us if you ever have the chance to revisit the hotel.   Following the event on Monday, we have had positive feedback overall from other guests attending the event.  This does not mean however that I will not be taking your points on-board and looking into positive solutions to counteract the shortfalls you have experienced.   Kind regards,  Chris Luke  Senior Event Manager

Comments: Don’t often give 5 stars.. but this is an excellent hotel.  Beautiful building,  elegant decor.  The minute you walk in you feel that it has a touch of class.  Food is excellent, good range, well prepared, service I could not fault and spotlessly clean.  If you have those three I don’t think you can ask for a lot more.  Very central, easy to get around from here, but does not feel like it’s in the middle of a city centre.  Spacious rooms, good storage space, elegant decor ( not quite the standard hotel chain decor, which makes a pleasant change). All the facilities you could want.  All in all, superb.  Will most definitely be back.

I agree with most people that the location is really good. I only use the hotel for business travel, and it's very close to the offices, and very close to most shops like Tesco, Sainsbury's, etc. The WiFi is well below average, I've always used the free WiFi (which I measure often) and it's very slow indeed. I've attached a screen image of the last test I did. When I've reported this, I always get told that this is out of my control and that I should call the ISP. I have also been told that the paid WiFi s better, but I think t's criminal for Hotels to make money out of this technology. As reported by other members of the public, the pillows, are certainly not the best, but I usually stack a couple of them to get the height I want. The cleanliness is also not as one would expect
Comment Title: Good location, but impersonal and requires updating

Responded 12 Dec 2017

Comments: Stayed for two nights at the beginning of December.  The location is brilliant for exploring central Bristol.   The room on third floor facing the cathedral was very comfortable, we had no issues with noise.  A few niggles with the housekeeping - not leaving enough tea/milk - but otherwise the room was clean.  Nearly every single staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. We had issues at breakfast - which I have raised directly with the hotel who have responded promptly and personally.  Mainly they seemed unable to deal with gluten intolerance without it being a complete performance at breakfast, hopefully with my feedback they now get this. Everything is extra - parking, wifi, breakfast, but it is that type of hotel and that is what you get when you stay somewhere

Stay the one night as we were attending a dinner/dance. Had a junior suite which was perfect. Great nights sleep and a first class leisurely breakfast. Car parking in house very handy. Had pot of tea in lounge after we checked all very sevalised and then a coplmentry red wine.

We stayed here in November 17 and I have to agree with the other reviews, this hotel does need a refurb. The pillows were very flat and dirty and they didn't have protectors on so were full of stains. Our cups and spoons were not changed during our 3 night stay, the cleaner just rinsed them and put them back. On a positive note, the staff were very friendly and upgraded our room on arrival. The breakfast had plenty of options and it's location is perfect. I would stay here again.

This is my preferred hotel when I am visiting Bristol for business. The cathedral view rooms are great and the parking is very convenient. Also, the gym, sauna and pool are the best you could ask for in Bristol. Can get a bit noisy on a weekend night.
Date of Review: Matthew M wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: This hotel is situated close to the quays and most of the local attractions including the cathedral, aquarium and science museum.  It is also close to much of Bristol's nightlife.   The hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff are friendly.  Breakfast is excellent apart from the fact that they don't have proper marmalade unless you ask for it as all that is on the buffet table is French orange jam which is horrible.  Honestly, why would any English hotel want to provide a French substitute for marmalade when the French don't eat it?  Hey ho.  Minor point really but remember, if you do want marmalade you can ask for it.
Date of Review: Sally T wrote a review Dec 2017

Comments: Positives Flexible and kind staff. Good quality pillows, mattress etc. The pool.   Negatives Smell on the 4th floor. Dirt in the toilette.  Only toast and "foam" bread. Awfull tea and coffee. Low quality breakfest. Very small window in the room.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 6 Dec 2017

Please be assured that all your feedback has been taken on board and will be investigated. Comments: Location is great for exploring the city and going out at night. It’s a beautiful building but some areas of the interior are tired and in need of re-decoration. Despite this, it is still lovely and our room was really elegant. We stayed in a King Suite on the 3rd floor which was huge. The bed was the most comfortable that I’ve ever experienced in a hotel. It’s a very large hotel and therefore busy during breakfast and check out. There had been a wedding on so this might not be usual. Staff were all courteous and the breakfast was tasty. Parking was easy enough but you do have to pay extra. We’ll stay here again.

A fantastic stay at the Marriott in Bristol as part of a show and shopping weekend. Wonderful hotel, fantastic staff, excellent room (chose to upgrade to a suite) with champagne, chocolate and flowers! Ambience of the hotel is wonderful and old, makes a change from the eurobox hotels. We made use of the restaurant for dinner, the bar for after the show and breakfast in the morning, 10/10 for service, effort and attention to detail, I can live with a bit of old school creaky building. See you soon Bristol. x
Comment Title: Weekend in Bristol, show and shopping

Comments: We have just spent a couple of days at the Marriott Royal and had a fantastic stay. Excellent service, helpful, friendly staff. Ideally located in the city centre within a few minutes walk of the Hippodrome and Cabot Circus. Some reviews have stated that the Hotel is outdated and I beg to differ. Iconic, classy Hotel, beautiful marble bathrooms and bars, ornate cornices beautiful glass ceiling ( Take a look at the York Suite ).Beautiful. Good size rooms and comfy bed. Good air conditioning.Good size swimming pool, sauna and spa and attractive Roman style decor. Makes a lovely change from the'Modern look' . Loved it and will be going back.'

The rooms are tired and not very clean. The arm chair has stains on it. There is a wedding on downstairs which will not finish until 0030. I can hear the music in the room. Reception offered to give me earplugs. Not good enough for a Marriott.
Response from hotel staff:

Comments: We stayed over for 1 night to attend a family wedding. The staff at the front desk are charming and helpful. Probably the best hotel welcome for a long time. So the staff training is good.  After that, things went rapidly downhill. Our room was freezing despite turning the heating up to maximum. At 9pm we asked for a spare blanket or heater, as there was no extra bedding in the cupboard. The man at the desk said he would send both up but nothing arrived. By 10.45pm we slept in our clothing to keep warm. The in-built ventilation/ heating duct circulated a strong frying smell as it seemed to be connected to the kitchen extractors. Do not sleep in room 4174!!  To cap it all we were charged £4.99 for the internet the next morning. We will not be staying here again and I suggest you
Comment Title: Shabby, dated and charges for internet.

Comments: My wife and I stayed here last night 23rd November . Stay at Marriotts regularly and this was our fourth visit to this particular hotel. The building is lovely, but we couldn't believe how dilapidated the hotel has become. Worn carpets, scuffed paintwork and very dated rooms. The bathrooms need to be seriously updated , mouldy tiles, loo seat loose etc.   Not up to Marriotts normally high standard I'm afraid.
