Comments: Hotel is lovely, as always. Staff are so helpful, room was lovely, facilities such as pool and spa, restaurant, all excellent as usual. The quality of the breakfasts was superb, with great choice of foods to suit all tastebuds. Super stay .
Date of Review: Julie D wrote a review Nov 2017

Comments: I've stayed here a few times in different rooms, the rooms are fine although some are a little tired. Well equipped and nice toiletries. The dining room looks nice and breakfast is quite good. I have found lunch to be rather limited in choice.
Comment Title: Good location and good for business stay

Comments: I cannot fault a single moment of our stay here. As soon as we arrived we were greated with a nice glass of shiraz which is always a winner on a cold winter evening!  Check in was quick and painless, the reception staff are outstanding, so friendly and helpful.  We had a family room which was basically 2 king beds. The room & ensuite was spacious, clean with great quality toiletries. The hospitality tray was well stocked with tea and coffee and I loved that there was the option of takeaway cups too obviously for people who have to dash to meetings early morning, but I love small, well thought details like that.  Some people have said in other reviews that the decore was dated, I have to disagree, the style of the rooms was more eclectic but i personally prefer this to modern

Stayed here whilst with an Association Conference ,we  have stayed at many a  Marriott hotel , i would say this one has  a particular attraction  audience of which i would say is of an  older generation . The hotel is " Grand " that's for sure and has a aged but lived in feeling . The staff are very friendly as you would expect and check was quick and pleasant , i would add that the check in was from 4pm which is very late in the afternoon  , when stopping for just 1 night and checking out the next day this limits your use of amenities in the hotel . The rooms are very dated and are of need of quite some upgrading , comfortable and clean but  very dated  The  room rates are on the higher side ( yes over priced )   in comparison to same quality hotels in the region . We didn't
Date of Review: Darren R wrote a review Nov 2017
Comment Title: Nice but a with very dated rooms

Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely  Abdallah Hammoud  Front Office Manager  01179255100 abdallah.hammoud@marriott.com

Comments: I stayed couple of days during my visit to the University of Bristol. The hotel is a historical building right in the mid of the city, only minutes walk from the University.   Hotel is dated but well maintained. Room is comfortable, wifi is working well. Breakfast is also good. There is also a bar serves real coffee as well.  Service is good and staff are friendly and helpful. it is a good stay I will come back when I am in town.

I regularly have to stay in Bristol overnight  on Business, and I've stayed in most of them. This beat the lot as far as location, comfort, and ambience are concerned.  Situated opposite the Cathedral Green, it is an oasis of peace , but only a green away from the city centre with the student fuelled eateries and bars very close, and the more refined dining by the river just a gentle stroll away.  Staff are helpful, and rooms are very comfortable.
Comment Title: Best in Bristol IMHO for business

Comments: ... because this hotel is rather in need of a make-over. It was decorated a while ago and, as well as having some dangerously swirly carpets in the larger rooms, it was all a bit tired.  The room I ended up in (1258 - after asking to move from one overlooking a busy road) was quiet and very well situated, with a view of the cathedral. The food was mixed - some of the conference lunch items were dried out and served in ridiculous spoon-things, which were almost impossible to negotiate standing up (as most people did.) Breakfast was fine, though -   good to have a chef to cook things freshly (on request.) The staff were all particularly pleasant and helpful, which made a big difference to how it felt to stay here. Congrats all round.
Date of Review: Mark Cheshire wrote a review Nov 2017
Comment Title: Would be 3 stars, but for the very helpful staff ...

Comments: Very expensive, you have to pay extra for everything such as breakfast, internet, parking. The staff attitudie is poor, unfriendly and unhelpful.The resturant menu is terrible, we went out to eat. At breakfast the porridge was undercooked.  Overall a bad experience.
Comment Title: Poor service, difficult access if you dont know Bristol, over priced

Responded 16 Nov 2017

I am very sorry to hear about all the issues you faced during this visit. If you are willing,  could I kindly ask for a moment of your time to get in touch with myself by phone or email at a time of your convenience to discuss these matters further. I look forward to the opportunity of addressing these issues to your satisfaction so that we have the pleasure of having you stay with us once again.  Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager 0117 9255100 Heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com

Comments: This hotel is within walking distance of a number of great bars and restaurants.   The car park is a little pricy for residents.   Rooms are very comfortable but in need of renovation as looking quite tired.   If you get for a good price then it’s worth it. If you’re paying a top rate then there’s probably better options.

Another great visit to this hotel. We booked 2 rooms for the 6 of us (2 adults and 4 children) and the hotel put us in rooms beside each other. We all had a good nights sleep and enjoyed a good breakfast the next morning. Thank you!

We had a great stay st this city centre hotel. In walking distance of all the lovely attractions bristol has to offer. We went for a special birthday and discovered when we got home that we’d unfortunately thrown an special birthday envelope into our hotel room bin! Very silly, but we rang the hotel, they found our envelope and then it straight back to us. Housekeeping were so very helpful, I can’t rate them highly enough. Visit this hotel for this kind and friendly service alone and if you need another reason, bristol is a great City and this hotel is central and reasonably priced. Thank you again.
Date of Review: Emma W wrote a review Nov 2017

Comments: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel for a conference and to be honest I will avoid it at all costs in the future. The rooms really need to be upgraded, the shower in the bathroom had cracked grouting and the general maintenance was poor. The first day they cleaned our room but left dirty cups. In the conference area the hand towels had run out by lunch time. There seems to be a general air of people not knowing what they are doing and poor organisation. Although I love Bristol I will not be returning to this hotel.
Date of Review: karen W wrote a review Nov 2017

Response from Abdallah H, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

I look forward to the opportunity of addressing these issues to your satisfaction so that we have the pleasure of hosting once again. Comments: Excellent stay with amazing staff, there is no fault. Reasonable price too. Breakfast was good as it was hot. It was booked for a night out with my partner! Will return again even though I live 6 miles out!

Stayed here recently and yes, when I next visit Bristol, I would return to the Marriott Royal Hotel.  The hotel is not difficult to locate, but the car park is a bit of a nightmare and you’ll require a can-opener to access you car in some of the bays, particularly when a large 4 x 4 parks adjacent to you.     Fair play to the hotel, they are trying to make the most of the hotels available spaces for guests, but when the hotel charges £16.00 a night for the pleasure of trying to squeeze between cars to access the drivers side, it’s a wee bit much.    We were not the only ones experiencing issues.  The hotel does have a lovely fasade and looks impressive in its perfect location at the College Green, immediately adjacent to Bristol Cathederal and the City Council offices.      The

Booked a couple of night here as we were attending a family wedding nearby.  Got a pretty good deal for 2 nights b&b and when we arrived, first impressions were very good, building looks impressive from outside.  First minor grumble was that although there’s on site parking beneath the hotel, it’s £16 for hotel guests per day to park the car there.  That just seemed a bit expensive on top of the room cost.  Quick efficient check in and down to our room on the lower ground floor which was spotless and had plenty of space and all required facilities.    Although hotel was busy due to a conference, it was nice and quiet and we had 2 good nights sleep and 2 lovely breakfasts with plenty of choices.  Our only other small complaint was the corridors were a bit tired and could be doing

Just a couple of things that I thought a bit mean in hotel of this type. Two tea bags in each room, had to phone down to get more. That was done very quickly but bearing in mind there is shampoo body lotion etc etc, just seems silly to only have 2 tea bags in a double room. Staff helpful. Very clear about instructions for breakfast and getting to rooms and leisure club. A little confusion over bill and WiFi. Soon sorted but just unnecessary. Hot drinks in restaurant not that hot!

Stayed here for a conference for two nights. Excellent location in Bristol’s centre next to lovely cathedral. Friendly staff. Nice rooms with very comfy bed (superior queen room). Bathroom a bit old fashioned but otherwise was fine. Breakfast in am was buffet but varied and good quality. The conference food was also pleasant. Parking  was free for me but wouldn’t want to be paying the £16 a night parking charge.

Stunning hotel with excellent, attentive staff. Our cream tea was spot on - tasty, plentiful and nicely presented. We had loose leaf teas, a selection of sandwiches, freshly cooked scones with jam and cream and a lovely selection of small cakes. There was so much we couldn’t eat all of it. It was a totally relaxing afternoon with no rush from the staff. We didn’t want to leave and will certainly return for a special occasion. Probably the best Marriott we have visited so far. Thank you for a lovely afternoon.

Arriving at this beautiful hotel and seeing the gorgeous exterior made you feel like you were part of something very special.  We had a very nice stay, a very comfortable room with luxurious beds.  The food was delicious and the staff was friendly.  It was located perfectly in the middle of many sites we wanted to see!  Lovely stay, thank you!

The exterior says it all 😊. Lovely frontage which immediately gives you confidence of making a good choice. We were a good few hours early arriving in Bristol due to various travel problems so we walked to the hotel to see if we could drop our bags off to save us lugging them around till check in time at 4pm. We were greeted by Heidi ?(couldn’t quite see the name badge from where I was standing, but think that’s right) she could not have been more pleasant and helpful. A room was found straight away for us and we were allowed to check in😊.  Room spacious, clean with all amenities.  The bed was comfy and we had AC. We used the fitness suite and the pool, both were spotless and well looked after.  Breakfast was good with a really good choice to suit all tastes ,  hot food could

A beautiful hotel, on the ground floor. All staff encountered were very professional and helpful,  Check in, reservation booking at nearby restaurant for us and the breakfast staff could not have been better. The breakfast was of a very good standard with lots of options. The down side, 2nd floor corridor is long overdue a refurbishment. The carpet is very faded and looked dirty with big gaps in the joints. Wall paper showing its age in places and badly chipped paint work on the wooden door frames, skirtings etc. Bedroom was generally clean, warm and comfortable but again long overdue a refurbishment programme. Great location for exploring the wonderful city of Bristol.
Comment Title: Some good points and some not so good points

We are currently anticipating a full hotel refurbishment next year where we are sure to provide a highly functional space and stylish décor that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Sincerely  Abdallah Hammoud  Front Office Manager 01179255100

Comments: Ten of us, two families plus grandparents spent  three nights here and were delighted with our experience from start to finish. All the formalities, boking process, check-in, payments were well-handled, the location was excellent for all the special activities that Bristol offers. The staff were attentive and pleasant, the rooms comfortable and the breakfast one of the best we have had in a hotel. One tiny gripe; it would be nice to access fresh air in the bedrooms rather than air-conditioning. We fully understand the safety considerations but, when the hotel is next updated, we would recommend installing windows which can be opened on a safe tilt. That said - we would highly recommend the hotel.
Date of Review: Shirley B wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: Stately style hotel in good condition & pretty good decorative order. Absolutely spot on central location with ample basement parking at good value (for typical city centre rates). Cracking welcome & knowledgeable/helpful reception staff. The hotel was deceptively huge but smoothly run & doesn't feel 'busy'. Our room faced the main road traffic junction however was almost completely silent...........incredible. Simon at reception told me "we've recently had the window frames re-sealed"........great timing! Good bed, good bedlinen, nice pillows, towels, toiletries & great room (family style with 2 queen sized beds). Good lighting. Good wifi. Slightly dated but in keeping style bathroom, clean & a good size. Reasonably comfy bar area, some bar stools would be nice. Table service
Date of Review: Richard T wrote a review Oct 2017
Comment Title: Overall great experience & great location........but pay extra for coffee!

Comments: Stayed here for a gig at Colston Hall which is a 4 minute walk away. The car park is costly and very cramped. Nice reception areas and very comfortable room. Breakfast was very busy and took a while to get seated. Room rate was excellent but watch out for the parking fee which is a rip-off.
Date of Review: Duncan M wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: I cannot begin to describe just how run down, shoddy and dirty this hotel is. A quick one night stay while visiting family and we found old food remains on a number of corridor carpets outside bedrooms, scratched doors, the most disgusting swimming pool/spa area with a floor covered in human debris.   The reception staff took 15 mins to find our reservation and no apology but blaming the third party site that we had booked through.  The only good thing was the breakfast - and even then staff couldn't be bothered to keep the serving areas clean and tidy. Are they all on zero contracts? Where is the staff loyalty. Must be a management issue.  We will not be back. Appalling service from what used to be a pretty decent hotel chain.
Date of Review: Liz E wrote a review Oct 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Abdallah H, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 26 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear Fawltyholidays,   Thank you for taking the time to submit your review. Please accept our most sincere apologies for any shortfall in service encountered during your last visit. May I kindly ask that you contact me at a time of your convenience so that we can address the feedback to your satisfaction? Thank you once again for having chosen to stay with us.   Sincerely   Abdallah Hammoud  Front Office Manager  Tel: 01179255100

Comments: I read reviews for the hotel prior to staying there and worried that it would not be as nice as the official photographs portrayed. The hotel was lovely albeit a little quaint and old fashioned in its decor. I liked it and found the room we had quite nice. The breakfast was nice and the dining room was spacious and well designed.   I wasn’t impressed with the bathroom which was clearly not new and had black grout and stains. However the rest of the room was fine. The location is the most attractive part of the hotel. Situated at the top of college green and near park street was perfect for us. Next to us was the cathedral and aquarium. I would recommend the hotel for its location and classic English decor but it may need a little update in the bathroom and the rooms should be
Date of Review: Amaka N wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: This was the second say at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel – on both occasions I have had problems with the room allocated.  This visit I had a room on the mezzanine level.  At night the room was too noisy from air-con fans (etc) outside – had very poor night’s sleep.  Breakfast buffet standard 4*.  Leisure pool complex good, but paint / plaster falling down above Jacuzzi.  Slabs in steam room where slimy on the sides- very unpleasant.  No complimentary newspapers available.  Excellent location and great event catering.  Room was clean and staff friendly and helpful.
Comment Title: Lost something since my last visit

Comments: I know this hotel wont resonate with everyone as it's a grand old style hotel,some might say old fashioned, definitely not for those that require very modern accommodation. The staff are extremely helpful and nothing is too much bother. The hotel is in a good location for anyone wishing to use as a base to explore Bristol. Maybe I am just getting old but I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. My only word of caution is to check with hotel in advance to enquire as to whether there are any weddings / parties on the night you plan to stay as it can be quite noisy on the lower floors.
Date of Review: Paul R wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: Despite the hotel looking quite dated inside, we had a nice stay. The standard room was spacious enough and comfortable, however our shower/bath was leaking. After reporting it the reception staff said they’d get someone to look at it, however noone did. After complaining again the next morning, the reception team were very apologetic and upgraded us to a superior room. The room was very comfortable and no leaky shower!   The swimming pool and changing facilities were nice. I liked the swimming costume drying machine - very useful so we didn’t have dripping wet costumes to take home.   Lots of choice at the breakfast buffet. They close the doors right on 11am so you have to make sure you get what you want in time.
Response from hotel staff:

Responded 25 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear Florence W,   Thank you for taking the time to complete a review in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol. Comments: Sorry to say that the hotel is rather tired looking and "Fawlteyesque". Checking in was very slow as I got a trainee. Yes, people have to learn, nowt wrong with that, but at least give them reasonable support; when another staff member checks in 3 people in the same time and I'm the only person left at the desk when it's done.... No standard electrical socket in the room near bed so had to ask for an extension lead. Bedside light did not work so had to ask for it to be repaired. Tried to sign on to Wi-Fi only to be told it was not included and would cost £4.99 (which I refused) or could sign up for their "club" and get free (which I also refused) - really quite unbelievable and annoying. Rang for breakfast in room in the morning. Got another trainee. Took 3 more calls from hotel
Date of Review: Richard H wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: Fine hotel, but since the price drop, the interieur is involved in slight decay. Could have an renewal. Breakfast is very nice. Not used to the Marriott standard as suppored. Definetely a hotel to recome, since I love Bristol.

Comments: Everything in this hotel fell short of expectation except the bed. Very dated and tired decor with some areas grubby/dirty. No opening window, air conditioning noisy, clumsy weak shower, no mixer taps, no plug sockets by the bed. Surly staff at breakfast, which was an average offering. Reception staff too busy, concierge on the phone and despite waiting for him, walked off without acknowledging me. A lot of issues could be mitigated if the staff attitude was right but it wasn’t...they are run down and it shows.This place needs a full refurb urgently both physically and in terms of staff attitude. Pay for internet? It’s 2017...come on guys...pathetic.

Comments: Location Excellent for what we wanted. Walking distance to harbourside which had a large market on Sunday when we were there. A stop to catch the boats/ferry. Close to Wapping Wharf, Brandon Park, WestEnd, Aquarium. Bus stop outside the hotel to get bus to zoo/clifton.  Loved the location as bars, supermarkets and plenty of restaurants close by.  Room Stayed in family room 1326. Thought the room was very good. Everything that was needed. Enough Space for couple and our son. Nice tea/coffee and big TV. Bathroom was a little dated but clean and everything worked. Beds were comfortable and the room we had was very quiet so no problems sleeping.  Leisure facilities These were a nice touch. Given the age of the building and the space restrictions they still managed to have an
Date of Review: Vishal S wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: This hotel is in need of modernisation ,very dark . The restaurant is closed Sunday evening. The breakfast staff not very friendly coffee was un drinkable asked for an espresso but was told it would cost extra, never had that before ,sausages were full of fat , not an enjoyable stay would not use again

A couple of friends and I decided to spend a weekend together to catch up on some gossip after an eventful summer and though a spa day in Bristol would be perfect.  Given the price we paid, all I can say is that is OK.  The reception seemed nice enough but after going downstairs to walk to the pool, you could tell that the place needed a little bit of attention.  The changing facilities are quite limited and the showers didn't feel all that clean (although to be fair, the water pressure was great!).  The pool itself, again, was fine.  The temperature was good too.  There is a jacuzzi there which is actually quite big compared to some of the others I've been to but again, it was nothing special.  If you like using saunas, again, this one was fine, quite big in my opinion and the
Comment Title: Used the spa facilities which need an upgrade, but afternoon tea is superb

Comments: We stay here every time we come to Bristol. Though the hotel may be showing its age a bit, it's a grand old hotel and the excellent staff, fantastic breakfast buffet, and Victorian charm make up for any shortcomings. Originally opened in 1863, it was restored in 1991.  Perfectly located next to Bristol Cathedral, it's an easy walk to restaurants and venues. There's a car park (parking garage) under the hotel.  Highly recommended for those who appreciate charm and quiet.

Really well located hotel. Rooms were fine and breakfast fairly good. Large old hotel though and communal areas all a bit tired and dated. Pool area in particular needed updating and the changing rooms were very old and not very clean.

A well located statement hotel. Rooms more than adequate. But it just seems a little tired. I don’t mean a simple coat of paint but a bit more sharpness crispness factor if that makes sense?  I found the front desk slightly less sharp than expected for such a statement hotel, the service acceptable but not special and the bar area rather bland.   Having said this it is fine and I enjoyed my brief stay.
Date of Review: Jerry A wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: The Royal Marriott is well situated and is architecturally interesting but isn't all it sets out to be. The corridors and rooms have very dull decor and the carpets are long overdue for replacement. The room I had was large butscuffed around the edges and the bathroom had been cheaply kitted out. There was very little drawer or shelf sapce. As I was there for three nights this was a thorough nuisance.The cleaners didn't restock the tea, coffee and water  reliably.  My room had been prepaid but on arrival reception tried to put the whole price on my card again. When I left they tried to charge for car parking even though I'd come by train. At best that's sloppy.  The breakfasts were OK, and the bar was expensive, even for a hotel.  The pool with it's mock Roman decor was very
Comment Title: Doesn't live up to its promise

Comments: I find it very hard to write this review about a hotel we have stayed at 7 or 8 times now but on our last stay I was VERY disappointed to say the least, we have picked this hotel in the past because of the location and very friendly staff and we thought as it was our anniversary we would go back again knowing what to expect.  Unfortunately this wasn’t the case, we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by a foreign lady who didn’t understand English very well, anyway she was very nice and typed in our information and then told us that breakfast isn’t included in our stay, well as above we have stayed 7 times before and because I booked the room on a visa card breakfast was given for free as part of the deal, therefore I explained this to the receptionist who went out the back to

Comments: This hotel may not be the cheapest but I am sure that it is one of the best. The staff were polite, helpful and cheerful. The rooms were clean,tidy and well stocked with all requirements for drinks and bathroom gels etc. The facilities were well maintained and the food was of a very high standard. My only complaint would be that at breakfast the restaurant was under staffed.
Date of Review: malcolm h wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: We stayed here at the weekend and took two family double rooms. One of the rooms we were originally allocated stunk of cigarettes but was quickly changed when we told reception.  The rooms were large and comfortable and our room overlooked the harbourside which was very pleasant. The bar staff were very friendly and we were looked after very well for the evening. Breakfast on Sunday was a bit disappointing due to the usual 10.00 rush. You would have thought that the staff would be prepared for this but unfortunately they ran out of everything and we had to wait 30 minutes for some things to be replenished. By the time we got back in the queue and reached the front everything had gone again. My daughter had to wait over an hour to get scrambled eggs on toast. The hotel itself is
Comment Title: A bit of old world charm

Comments: Situated in the city centre the hotel is an ideal place to stay  The rooms are very spacious and well decorated  Nice size bathroom  Service and staff were very friendly and helpful  The car park is a bit difficult to find when it starts to get dark as it's not well light
Date of Review: Martyn B wrote a review Oct 2017

Comments: Stayed overnight in September with our Daughter en-route to Devon.  Have stayed here previously and had a double double deluxe room which was large and clean.    The only disappointment again was the poor condition of the bathroom.  It is fairly dated with mould and black in the shower areas.  Used the pool which is lovely and large.  Changing rooms again not the cleanest and need a little more attention as fairly busy as people using the gym a lot but did not put me off using.  Stayed on a B and B rate... Breakfast was great and good value if booked as part of deal.  Did not eat in restaurant but did have a couple of drinks which we found to be expensive.  Says a lot when your mixer is more than your vodka!  I would recommend this hotel to people, it does look a little tired in
Comment Title: Lovely central hotel for an overnight break..

Comments: Rooms are excellent, beds are comfortable but....same old problem. You are short, your medium eyesight is gone and there is no way to blow dry your hair or put on make up with the distance between you and the mirror in the bathroom. No problem if you're male and bald with great vision. An easy solution is a magnifying shaving mirror that you can bed right up to your face.   The buffet breakfast was great just use a napkin to handle the ladles (touched by every guest sick or otherwise). I didn't and got the complimentary cold virus. I know better, I blame myself.  Love the biscuits and complimentary water bottles every day.  Biggest complaint which is why I didn't give it 5/5. There is some really obnoxious air freshener in the lobby that blows into the restaurant/breakfast area.
Comment Title: Wow...did I ever make the right choice except for one problem.

Comments: I’ve visited many Marriott hotels and this one lets the chain down, the Hotel public area was very nice with the common air freshness being pumped into the lift area, However the room was a let down especially the bathroom. This bath area had mould growing on the silicon and the grout was dirty, also there was damage to the bath with a very poor attempt to repair.

Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel

Response comment: Dear gavlar007,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apology for the disappointment you faced regarding the condition of your room and bathroom during your stay. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that we have passed all of this feedback on to our Housekeeping team to ensure corrective measures are put in place.  If you would like to discuss any of these issues further then please do not hesitate to contact myself at the hotel on 0117 9255100 and I would be more than happy to speak to you.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: I attended a reunion dinner at the Palm Court at this Bristol hotel recently. The food was preordered and frankly the main course was very disappointing.  It was meant to be "Roast beef and Yorkshire pudding".  Three or four small roast potatoes, 3 or 4 cubes of carrot, a tiny piece of beef 3mm thick and about 3cm by 10cm and runny, watery gravy.  I had terrine as a starter and creme brûlée for pudding - both adequate.  Service was fine. Overall, the only thing that let the event down was the main course.
Date of Review: George C wrote a review Oct 2017
Comment Title: The main course let the event down
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 5 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear George C,  Thank you for your time and for supplying us with detailed feedback. It is unfortunate to learn of your experience with regards to our food and how it did not live up to your expectations.  Your comments have been shared with our kitchen team to follow-up.  Thank you once again for bringing your experiences to our attention and we do hope we get the opportunity to welcome you back to our hotel the Marriott Bristol Royal.  Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: We only stayed one Saturday night and overall enjoyed our stay. As others have said it's an old building that internally could to with some updating but it is still grand in places. We had breakfast in probably the best part of the building. High ceilings,  statues, old paintings, it was off from the main breakfast room. The breakfast was excellent. Our room was on the ground floor, was comfortable and shower was very good. Some have said ground floor rooms are noisy but we did not experience any noise. We experienced the sauna, steam room and jacuzzi early Sunday morning and enjoyed all three.

Late check in was dogged by unacceptably dirty room, coated with dust and numerous hairs in bath, sink etc. Helpful staff rectified this by offering another room which we didn't like therefore upgrading us to a junior suite with free breakfast.  The price of breakfast was expensive however given ours was complimentary it was very impressive, offering a large menu cooked and presented well using fresh quality produce. When we checked out early we were also given a takeaway breakfast.  Offer of 2 nights stay in double room at £170, standard price expensive at over £300.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 3 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear Van A,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apology for the disappointment you faced regarding the check-in issues and the cleanliness issues you encountered. Please be assured that this feedback has been taken on board, and that we are looking in to all these issues separately, as an overall project for the hotel.  I am glad you enjoyed our breakfast.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Serban Voda Night Manager

Comments: All staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful.  The pool/spa area was greatly in need of a revamp.  The changing area was tiny and dirty with clumps of hair in the showers and walk ways.  The interior of the hotel is tired and in need of a revamp.  Also, I found someone else's toe nail on the bedroom floor which was a little disconcerting. There was only a bedside table on the one side of the double bed and no sockets close to the bed.  The room was really quite small and there was a tiny corner bath with over bath shower.  The bar in the evening lacked a little atmosphere but again, the staff were brilliant and the drinks were lovely and at a good price.  The breakfast was disappointing for the money charged; the hash browns were under cooked and there were warnings up
Comment Title: Friendly staff but the interior could do with an update
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 3 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear _mspantry,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apology for the disappointment you faced regarding the condition of your room and the hotel during your stay. Please be assured that this feedback has been taken on board, and that we are looking in to all these issues separately, as an overall project for the hotel.  If you would like to discuss any of these issues further then please do not hesitate to contact myself at the hotel on 0117 9255100 and I would be more than happy to speak to you.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: At £170 for B& B ( and parking) in a basement room( which was of a good size) is, I believe poor value for money. The hotel is showing its age...generally a "dusty" feel to the place, cracked bathroom tiles and very slow lifts. The bed was uncomfortable , with a sagging mattress. Breakfast and the staff were fine. Why oh why no free wifi!!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 2 Oct 2017
Response comment: Dear kattyukres,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apology for the disappointment you faced regarding the condition of your room and the hotel during your stay. Please be assured that this feedback has been taken on board, and that we are looking in to all these issues separately, as an overall project for the hotel.  If you would like to discuss any of these issues further then please do not hesitate to contact myself at the hotel on 0117 9255100 and I would be more than happy to speak to you.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Stayed here for a business conference. Staff were superb, very helpful and polite. Nothing was too much trouble. Hotel is well decorated, perhaps a little dated in places but it was spotless and had a lovely feel to it. The location is great and this meant we could enjoy an evening meal out but the breakfast and lunches we ate at the hotel were of great quality. The snacks we had during coffee breaks at conference were absolutely delicious.  I hope to stay here again soon!

I would like to take this opportunity to acknowledge and appreciate the service that a member of staff by the name of Vikkie gave me and my wife. It is important to state that her character and personality were one of the main reasons we enjoyed our stay.   Her professionalism exceeded the customer satisfaction levels that I’m use to. I would like to personally thank her on behalf of myself and my wife for giving us such delight on our stay.
Comment Title: Fantastic facilities & a amazing member of staff

Comments: Stopped of here when in Bristol in business ,the hotel is located in the centre of Bristol close to all the bars and restaurants,so a great location.The staff are friendly and attentive as you would expect,the conference facilities were very good and the breakfast was ok,but I feed the rooms and bathrooms need a face lift the place is looking a little worn in my view benefit from the bathrooms being modernised and the rooms re decorated,so all in all a nice stay,but for the price the rooms should be better.
Comment Title: Nice hotel but needs a facelift

Comments: Lovely hotel, friendly staff, nice clean room in a great location. I will return as the breakfast was fantastic!! Good location for a walk or run along the waterside in the morning.  We came back late and they re opened the bar for us.

We recently spent two nights here and found it very enjoyable. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. The location is perfect...near the water, pubs, restaurants, etc. We did not eat in the restaurant but the staff in the bar and at the front desk were very courteous and professional. Yes, there is a certain "aging historic" feel to the place but that's part of the charm for us. I understand plans for a renovation are in the works, let's hope it retains most of it's historic charm....

Stayed 2 nights 19 September. Warm welcome,helpful staff. Wonderful bedroom with view of the cathedral, odd couple of times could hear groups of people passing by but didn't last long.(outside on the street.) Good size bedroom and quality linen but poor pillows.  Outside college green well kept. Great breakfast served till 11am, must welcome after a delayed flight.  - points no free wifi. No bar open for night cap you pay for room service with plastic  bottles out of mini bar. Breakfast no hot plates so food soon gets cold.Fridge in bedroom noisy. Don't disturb sign,means just that DON'T DISTURB.  We would stay again at a reasonable price.

The hotel is in a great position close to the waterfront and city centre. It has parking (charged separately)  The gym is very well equipped and the pool is very special.  The room was comfortable and clean.  There are parts of the hotel which are slightly worn but overall it is quite grand and has a nice atmosphere.  For the price it offers good value.
Date of Review: Anne C wrote a review Sept 2017
Comment Title: Enjoyed my stay and will return

Comments: The Marriott Royal is ideally located on the College Green next to the Cathedral, near the Town Hall and close to the university. It is also close to the developed water front with a good range of restaurants. With its statue of Queen Victoria outside it is not difficult to imagine in its heyday.  There is a car park underneath the hotel that costs £16 a night and given the challenges of the traffic and parking in Bristol worth leaving your car there.  We stayed in a suite on the 2nd floor which was spacious with a separate sitting room, a jacuzzi bath with a separate shower and a four-poster bed. While it would have been the height of luxury in its day it all contrasted with what a modern hotel would be offering today.  For instance while there was a Nespresso machine with a
Comment Title: Great location - old style 5* hotel in need of updating
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 23 Sept 2017
Response comment: Dear Mr Sayer,   Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take our guest feedback seriously and appreciate your time in relaying it. As a result, may I kindly ask that you get in touch with myself at a time of your convenience so that we can address your feedback in more detail.  Sincerely

Comments: Nice hotel, no complaints. Room was clean and all usual amenities. Spa are was nice. Breakfast good and staff friendly. Expensive drinks at the bar but nice lounge area and attentive staff. Will return when in  Bristol next.

We, Family of 4 ,stayed 2 nights, 15-17,  Bathrooms are in desperate need of renovation, dingy, no mixer taps, very disappointing as "luxury rooms " we were in lower ground which was very noisy. Restaurant: food was not enjoyable, the decor again in need of renovation, dark and dismal atmosphere.staff was helpful and friendly. We would not consider returning.

Awwww. What a shame. Possible the best location in Bristol, but this place is tired. Have stayed in loads of hotels, this one is distinctly in need of a refit. From the carpets through to the fixtures and fittings it's just out dated and worn. There is paint peeling off the ceiling down by the pool, one of the lifts feels as though it's shaking you to death and the shower curtain was definitely well used. Kettle still full of the previous guests water, no fridge, no view no free wifi?? And to be charged an additional £16 for the car park seems like a con. Don't advertise parking if you then have to pay for it on top of your room rate.  Lovely looking building and I slept very well, but next time I'll go back to the future inns at Cabot.
Comment Title: The Marriott,  not so royal hotel.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 11 Sept 2017
Response comment: Dear BodylikeBaywatch,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel .  I am very sorry to hear about all the issues you experienced during your stay. This includes the condition you found the hotel in, the standard of the Leisure Club and your bedroom as well. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that all of this feedback has been passed on to the relevant departments to ensure corrective actions are put in place and these issues are isolated.   Just for you information we are eagerly awaiting a refurbishment which should hopefully commence later in the year, wand should again improve on several of the issues you experienced during your stay.  Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel once again on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   If there is anything else I can do for you, then please do not hesitate to contact the hotel and ask for myself if you would like to discuss any of these issues further.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: We had a wonderful week and chose the Hotel because Walters restaurant are very helpful with my allergy diet. Please see separate review for Walters where we had dinner and breakfast each day. The breakfasts were also cooked for me bespoke so that I did not have to worry about using the buffet with my allergies. They made special bread for me to take on picnics, making our days much easier. The staff are always so friendly and helpful. The room was clean, air conditioned and was very quiet. The Hotel is very convenient for Bristol harbour or the Hippodrome. Excellent swimming pool and changing rooms.

Nice hotel and clean but have to say I was a little disappointed. Was pretty dated.. I didn't eat there so can't comment on that side of things.. it was comfortable and clean and it is in a fantastic location in bristol..
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 11 Sept 2017
Response comment: Dear Samuel R,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Whilst we are glad to here you enjoyed many aspects of your stay with us, please accept our sincere apology for the disappointment you faced regarding the condition of the hotel. Please be assured that this feedback has been taken on board. Just for your information we will be getting a refurbishment later this year, which should hopefully improve many aspects of your stay with us.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: If you are going to stay in a beutifull hotel in bristol then it has to be 100% the royal marriot the gym is small but the sauna is really elegant and tranquil and the hot tub is not just a poxy little tub but you can get atleast 10+ people in there.
Date of Review: Indy c wrote a review Sept 2017

Comments: Stayed here for one night after visiting Stonehenge. The staff was friendly and the hotel was clean. Also, it is in a perfect location. Tons of stuff within walking distance including some great restaurants and bars.
Comment Title: Clean hotel in a great location.

Comments: We would definitely stay at The Marriott again in Bristol, its location being the key point.  This is situated centrally and everywhere is easy to get to.  The hotel staff being very friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was also really good anything you could ask for.  This was our first visit and we're very impressed our son is living down there but also came to have breakfast at a reduced rate.  The hotel overall was a lovely hotel with everything you need.
Date of Review: Tracey D wrote a review Sept 2017

Comments: This Hotel has great character and has been in the heart of Bristol for many years. The rooms are of good quality with in room WIFI although this is at a charge. Parking is available under the Hotel and is charged for a 24 hour period however the charge is considerably less than if you were not a guest. I have not had breakfast in the Hotel as it is so centrally located you have a choice of many cafes and restaurants. The real appeal of this Hotel is where it is. I am Bristolian however no longer live there so I appreciate how easy it is to walk around the centre of the city including the waterfront with its array of cafes, restaurants, galleries and cinemas and theatres.
Date of Review: Alison W wrote a review Sept 2017

Comments: Stopped here for a night. The rooms were clean and comfy. Breakfast was fresh with plenty of choice. The pool and leisure facilities are a relaxing place to spend time. There was a wedding at the hotel during our stay which played very loud music until about 00:30 - too late in my opinion - and this rendered most of the downstairs areas unusable to anyone other than wedding guests. However, in our rooms on the 2nd floor the sound was well enough insulated that we only heard the faintest bass. Staff were friendly and helpful.
Date of Review: Keith N wrote a review Sept 2017

Comments: Excellent location and staff were marvellous. Andrea on Reception needs special mention for her welcome, care and attention. I would rate Andrea 10 out of 10 for her professionalism. She's a credit to the Marriott.  Beds were very hard whilst pillows were very soft which we didn't like but that's down to personal taste.  Breakfast was brilliant and the fact that you can park at the hotel is fantastic.

We just popped in for a drink before going for a meal out. My daughter was carrying a 21st irthday balloon and after a few minutes of relaxing in the lovely surroundings, the waiter appeared with a happy birthday plate of chocolates and little cakes! Thank you.

My family and I decided to go for a meal in the royal. Birte, the waitress who was with us, was really attentive and friendly despite she was there for onlh 1 month. The fut who was with her, unfortunately I couldn't catch the name, he was really attentive too. Thank you for the nice meal. We defo come back to tey the evenning tea 😉
Date of Review: Bea L wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: Two night stay.  Hotel well situated close to all the places we wanted to visit.  Good breakfast (not able to enjoy fully the first morning unfortunately due to a very badly behaved child running riot next to our table, something the poor staff had to endure as well).  Barmen didn't seem very knowledgable about some classic cocktails but the Ines they were able to provide from their menu were good.  Surprised no mini bar.  Five star ratings to the lovely blonde European lady receptionist (wish I'd noted her name in order to give her credit) who checked us in and checked us out, her customer service skills were excellent she made us feel like the quality of our stay was very important to her
Comment Title: Lovely receptionist made us feel welcome

Comments: We booked a wedding package and stayed for two nights at this beautiful hotel.  We could not have asked for more.  Clean, food great, staff amazing and nothing was too much trouble.  Would highly recommend, we had a wonderful weekend.
Date of Review: Dee P wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: Have just a last minute night stop here and what a lovely hotel, in a great place, lovely bar area with friendly staff. A massive thankyou to blonde  reception lady , think she was called Andrea ( she's getting married soon, that will let them know who she is) she was so friendly and chatted as I had a sore hand , was very sympathetic and kind with it , when I met my husband later in the day she had sent complimentary wine to our room, such a lovely gesture from a large hotel group . Ste is an asset to the team there but having said that all staff were friendly.Used the spa which was nice , can't comment on food as we didn't eat there . Would book again

Very friendly hotel - the nicest and most efficient staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in. That goes from the reception staff all the way through to the chamber maids - even the maintenance man I met in the corridor!  Stayed for 3 nights - a lot of friends, some of who were not staying at the hotel, joined us in a big gathering for a breakfast - over 30 people. We were accommodated in a beautiful room (Ballroom?) adjacent to the breakfast area - everyone enjoyed a delightful breakfast.   Our stay could not have been better.
Date of Review: Rob D wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: Not a bad hotel, classic style in the centre of Bristol, but car park is way too small and tight, arrival is a poor experience.   Well located right in the centre of things. Marriott quality. A bit on the pricey side.
Date of Review: Charlie L wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: This hotel is in a great location. The staff are very friendly and very helpful.  Food is great and the hotel is a beautiful design and is very clean and well maintained.   We really couldn't fault anything. A wonderful stay!

This was the venue for the firm's Xmas dinner/dance and was awful. 60 guests were seated in a small room away from the stage and disco. We were told that if we wanted to go into the ballroom, we would have to stand! There was no menu choice and after an hour,we had only had a bowl of soup! After a mediocre main course, and dessert ( no choice) we were told that coffee  would not be served, we had to collect our own from a machine. I went to the Ladies and found the toilet seat placed against a side wall in the cubicle. While walking back to the table, I tripped over a piece of carpet which had been taped over another piece. Altogether a memorable evening for all the wrong reasons!

I have been staying regularly at the Royal Marriott for over 20 years beginning as the famed Swallow Hotel.    Today the rooms are a bit worn, but the beddings new and the hotel still has the same charm located on the Green and one of the most active spots in Bristol.  Walters, the restaurant in the hotel is good for dinner and great breakfast buffet with admirable table service.   The hotel has an indoor pool and fitness center, massage and beauty salon.  The hotel also serves high tea in the drawing rooms.  One more feature not to be misses is this hotel has great air conditioning, which is not the case at nearby and well rated Hotel Duvan..   In the Summer you do need Air conditioning.  Also note that there is a great deal of restaurants with thing a block or two.  I don't

1st stayed at this hotel about 15 yrs ago.  Our stay this time was for 2 nights. On the 1st night we experienced unpleasant cooking smells coming from the Airconditioning.   We brought this to the attention of the front desk and they offered to move us without further question. We were moved to a much larger room with better views and no cooking smells.  I have to commend the staff for dealing with this issue the way they did. We packed our bags and they moved everything whilst we were out sightseeing.  Will definitely return.

An overnight stay in Bristol, clean room, good leisure facilities superb location for the marina good side of town! Only rating with 3 stars because we didn't drink or eat dinner or breakfast at the hotel.

Loved this hotel!! Loved all the original features it is absolutely beautiful. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a family room for me and my little girl and a friend and her little girl. The room was clean and tidy. We used the pool on both days of our stay it was a lovely addition to the hotel. Breakfast is a help yourself affair with a really good choice on offer. Would definitely go back again
Date of Review: Helen W wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: Stayed here many times. Good hotel with good facilities. Great location on college green. Good parking in attached multi story. Classic Marriott so you know exactly what you are going to get. Rooms comfortable and spacious

This is a pleasant hotel but a Marriott franchise so you know what to expect. However it does retain a classic atmosphere. Reception staff are helpful and knowledgable about the places to eat and visit. Even pre booked restaurants for us. A very comfortable stay.

Enjoyed our stay in this large, comfortable and very central hotel.  It is cheaper to book direct and pay with a Visa Card ( special rates), than an online booking site.  It was built by Swallow Hotels as a 5 star flagship in the early 1990's, now operated by Marriott as a 4 star. The staff were polite, professional and efficient.  Our rooms were large, comfortable, very clean and well appointed.  Huge bed, 3 telephones, complementary water and tea/ coffee, big bathroom, ironing board, trouser press.  The public areas were comfortable, but the very grand central room - which used to be the restaurant- was shut.  Breakfast was a generous buffet, only niggle was rather weak coffee. The many families staying were eating quite prestigious quantities of everything on offer.  The

Staff are very friendly and attentive in bar and lounge. They had endless patience with our kids who loved the mocktails. It was a great place for our family reunion. Breakfast buffet lovely with fresh fruit and smoothies and fresh eggs.

When in Bristol I always return to this hotel if possible - I love the ambience, the spacious rooms and the courteous staff, not to mention the central location. However, the £4.99 charge for one day's wi-fi is becoming rather irksome, particularly as free wi-ifi is practically standard in most hotels and B & B's nowadays. On this issue, the hotel needs to move with the times. Would stay again, nevertheless. .

Our first hotel stay as a family, and we could not of found a better hotel. The staff were so helpful, and smily. On arrival we were given a courtesy glass of wine. We were given all the information about our stay, and use of the gym and pool.  Our carpark was £16 for over 24 hours, and we could check out and keep or car in the carpark.  The room, we had a 2 double beds, the room was huge, lovely tea and coffee facilities with shortbread to. There was free use of a pool and hot tub, though small approx 15m long it was lovely, never over busy, the hot tub was a hit with our kids. I loved the steam room and the sauna.  Breakfast was sublime, buffet and a wide variety of English cooked, cereal, fruit to continental with smoked salmon, cheese and ham wth bread and sweet pastries.
Date of Review: Claire W wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: What a fantastic hotel! I booked the room a few weeks ago for my partner and my 5 year anniversary of being together and as part of a babymoon before our first baby. I informed them of this prior to arriving.  When we arrived we were congratulated on our expectant new arrival and told we were given a free upgrade to executive suite. We were so grateful, on entering our amazing room there were rose petals on the bed the shape of a heart, two pieces of chocolate cake with happy anniversary written in chocolate and a lovely card wishing us a happy anniversary and the best of luck with our pregnancy. These touches really added to our whole weekend, thank you so much!

Just thought we treat ourselves to a night away from home on our return from Paris.This is one of the best hotels Marriott have the standards are very high the rooms of a really good standard and well appointed. In particular the FOH Team are very efficient and helpful during our stay.

The hotel was of a high standard, clean, luxurious, very helpful staff who go above and beyond.  Food lovely.  Fantastic rooms, spacious and great location.  You are central in the city and close by for the Science Museum, Hippodrome, Harbour, Open Top Bus Tours and Ferry.s.  Great bus service to many other places,  Tourist info is close by too,

Situated between the cathedral and the harbour side with plenty to do and see.  Parking was an additional £16 per day for the duration of stay.  We ate dinner in the restaurant which was included in the room rate. The restaurant was very quiet and where we sat was a bit dark but overall the food was very good and the staff were excellent.  Breakfast was busy and seemed a bit chaotic at times mainly due to the number of people selfserving at the same time. BedRoom was a decent size and bed was comfy so no complaints there. Would return when in Bristol again
Date of Review: Rob G wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: The hotel is situated in an excellent position for the first time visitor to Bristol. The service from all the staff was very good especially the reception staff. The breakfast items were plentiful hot and tasty. We stayed in an upgraded room on the third floor, the rooms were spacious clean & tidy, with plenty of storage space, tea & coffee etc:  The indoor swimming pool was a nice bonus plus a large whirlpool, a code number is needed for lockers.  We chose the hotel because of the Marriott name and it was a perfect choice, but it was the staff that helped make our stay even better, well done. We will definitely recommend to others. Our stay was to co-inside with the Bristol Balloon festival in August. The balloons actually flew over the hotel three times during our visit,

We have stayed at this Marriott every year for the past four years. This year we noticed it was not as good on several fronts. When we arrived (even though we had paid for our stay in advance) the lady at the desk seemed not so sure about how many nights we were staying. The bathroom was not as clean as it could have been. There was an old used soap from the last guest sitting in a corner of the bathroom and there were 2 hairgrips behind the Jacuzzi bath from the last guest. When my husband mentioned this at the desk they did not seem overly apologetic. This was not acceptable in this standard of hotel. We had afternoon tea which was a nice tea, however the service was very poor. Our tea pots arrived but the milk didn't show for 15 mins later and that was after having asked for
Date of Review: Ann P wrote a review Aug 2017
Comment Title: Not quite as good as it used to be
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 16 Aug 2017
Response comment: Dear Ann P,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel .  I am very sorry to hear about all the issues you experienced during your stay. This includes the poor arrival experience you had, the cleanliness of your room, and the afternoon tea service that you experienced. I also apologise that none of these issues which you reported were dealt with in an appropriate manner. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that all of this feedback has been passed on to the relevant departments to ensure corrective actions are put in place and these issues are isolated.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel once again on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   If there is anything else I can do for you, then please do not hesitate to contact the hotel and ask for myself if you would like to discuss any of these issues further.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: We stayed here for my daughters birthday and booked via Expedia. As the hotel had capacity we were given an upgrade at check in without asking. The room was really spacious and clean with two comfy king sized beds.  In the morning we had a lovely cooked breakfast, had a swim in the pool and then checked out. On check out the manager noticed my daughter had a birthday balloon and went behind reception to give her a Teddy Bear for her birthday.   Right through our stay the staff were very friendly, efficient and caring. Nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommend.

When I stayed at the Marriott in Bristol, it was the only time on my trip to the UK that I felt like I was in the United States.  If felt just like a hotel room that I would reserve in Kansas City or Baltimore.  The room was clean and comfortable.  It was relatively spacious as well.  So if you are looking for a comfortable taste of home without any of the idiosyncrasies of European lodging, this is a great choice.
Date of Review: David R wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: Perfect location for visiting Bristol City Centre and the harbour side.  Huge range of restaurants nearby of all types.  Room perhaps was a little dated but others have commented that they like this.  Bed was comfortable and once you shut the curtains it was like being entombed with a deceased pharaoh, pitch black and very quiet leading to the opportunity to have a good night's sleep.  Staff are consistently good and have obviously been trained in customer service. They all seemed genuinely pleased to see you.   Breakfast was delicious with particularly good scrambled eggs which are so often horrible in a hotel.  I will definitely stay again.  We didn't eat in the restaurant nor drink in the bar and we didn't use the pool so can't comment on those facilities.  Fantastic parking

We came down and stayed Saturday and Sunday which happened to be the same weekend as the Harbour Festival. Check in was very easy and went smoothly.  I had also used the Marriott App to check in before arrival. We were given a room on the first floor.  The room was tidy and a decent size room.  The view was not great but we did see a little of the water front.   The bathroom was fairly standard with the bath and shower as one.   The beds are very comfortable and we had a king size. We did not get to use the gym or the pool but we did go and check it out.  The gym is very well equipped.  The pool is around 15m - 20m long so not great if you are a swimmer like myself but good for kids etc   The hotel is just a few minutes walk to the water front and all the bars. We would come

The hotel and accommodations were excellent. Great helpful friendly service. Good food...the breakfast buffet was well worth it. Loved the bar for an evening nightcap. Centrally located in the city of Bristol. I had a truly wonderful stay. The hotel must have really thick walls as it was quiet even in the morning.
Date of Review: Elizabeth R wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and it didn't disappoint. The staff are very friendly and efficient and the room was excellent. A nice comfy bed and a good nights sleep in a quiet room. Breakfast was excellent.

We attended a Wedding and stayed at the hotel. We had a very good quality room. The event was run in a very professional manner, The guests were well looked after, the daytime accommodation provided was ideal for how the couple wanted the event and the staff were helpful in supporting their requirements. A good time was had by all.

This grand Victorian building is situated on the Bristol University's College Green where you will be welcomed by fabulous bellboys in red and gold trim uniforms and a luxurious reception, bar and lobby area. A stone's throw away from the hip Park Street independent shopping area, nearby museums and art gallery and Watershed arthouse cinema, there are plenty of bars and restaurants towards the Waterfront.   The elegant interior is fitted with period fixtures and fittings throughout, with sensitive modernisation leaving rooms with a clean yet classic feel and the expected mod-cons. Our spacious twin room was generously sized with two large double beds, ample comfortable bedding. The restaurant looked lovely but that evening we decided to eat in and ordered room service - I had
Comment Title: Beautiful, classic hotel with Bell Boys to boot!

Comments: Very average room, paid for an upgrade and still wasn't brilliant. Had a few issues and was partially refunded and received free drinks. Staff are very helpful and bar area is nice. Good central location is the highlight.
Date of Review: James W wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: I visited with a friend in a wheelchair. I specifically requested an accessible room with a walk in shower. Unfortunately there was a mix up and the shower was over the bath.  They very quickly offered us a suite with a walk in shower at no extra cost.  They even built a small step to make it easier. They arranged all her travel within Bristol with a special disability taxi which was very reliable and reasonably priced.  They were very happy to tighten the connections on her wheelchair when she said it was noisy. The doorman helped to take the wheelchair down the steep ramp and although they don't do lunch, the evening meal was fine.

The room was clean and comfortable, nothing to write home about. Bathroom was spacious in comparison but needed a better fan to clear the moisture and steam.  Housekeeping service was minimal. Useful free safe.  The hotel itself is very well located and grand, with large pleasant communal areas - bar, sitting area, reception, restaurant and leisure facilities. I chose the hotel specifically for the pool, sauna and steam room and it was really nice we enjoyed using it, warm and clean.  Could maybe do with a few more loungers if they can be fitted in.  Beware the parking garage - the spaces and lanes are very very tight!  Breakfast was ok, there was a fair amount of choice of hot and cold foods, the buffet area is very small so on the Sunday morning it was cramped.   Food was

When travelling with my husband and 2 children, we all found that the room was comfortable and clean, but not overly luxurious. However, when we visited the pool and changing rooms we felt that they were quite disgusting, and not what I had come to expect from a Marriott Hotel. There was very little space to change for such a big hotel, and the lockers were grubby. The sight of the overflowing bin as we entered was ghastly, and did not install confidence in us for the swim. In contrast, the pool was relaxing for everyone, all be it a little cold. The dread refilled us when we got out of the pool and returned to the horrific changing rooms. My daughter wanted to go back to our room to shower, and I could not fault her, I can never fault her. The shower was covered in multiple
Date of Review: Catherine W wrote a review Aug 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 8 Aug 2017
Response comment: Dear Catherine W,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us.   As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your experience in our Leisure Club fell short of expectations. Please accept our sincerest apologise regarding this, and be assured that this is not our usual Marriott standard. Your comments have been shared with our Leisure Club Manager to be investigated, and corrective actions will be put in place to ensure that these issues do not occur again.  As a valued customer we hope you will consider to stay with us again whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: I visited with my wife and daughter on a short city break. The hotel is located near the Cathedral and SS Great Britain and is a short taxi ride from the Temple Mead railway station. Our room was spacious and clean. The hotel has a swimming pool and serves a good breakfast. We will certainly book again next time we are in the area.

3 night stay in July 2017. Large comfy room, nice corner bath. Clean but noticed under bed was a tad dusty! Very comfy bed - air con was good. Good location. Some areasin hotel  looking a bit a tired but overall look smart and classy. Visiting family members in area so I didn't eat in the hotel. Reception staff very helpful.

Me and my partner stayed here for a night and couldn't have been happier with where we chose! It was for a treat as this is quite a luxury hotel and we stayed in one of the suites. The rooms were very generous in size, the bed was as comfortable as you can get and the bathroom was beautiful! We didn't use the gym, spa or pool but were told it was there and that on the day we checked out we were still able to use them after we'd cleared our room which is always good to know! There is parking available under the hotel, the spaces are quite small and the hotel will need your car registration. Room service was very good and staff were happy to help. Breakfast was really nice in the morning with a big variety of things to chose from including your usual cereals to cooked meals and
Comment Title: Stunning suite and a hallway that looks like its from The Shining!

Comments: My partner and I stayed on a Saturday night whilst visiting the city. We had a really nice stay. The beds are very comfy and the rooms are very nice. Loved chilling out in the spa.  Only bad points are that the water in the bathroom was too hot, and the hash browns at breakfast were a bit cold... nothing major though. 😀
Date of Review: Dan P wrote a review Aug 2017

Comments: We recently stayed here on a hen do. Not one of those awful rowdy ones but we did do fancy dress and go out in the evenings. The staff were so lovely all the time and accommodating. We went out on one night and got soaked through and they gave us extra hairdryers at gone 11pm to help dry our fancy dress so we could go back out. The spa was perfect for relaxing after busy days. The bed was super comfy. Breakfast was a lovely range of foods. The location was super was well, very central.

From the moment you enter through the grand entrance you get the flavour of this Royal hotel from bygone years. There are columns and marble throughout the public areas and the corridors and rooms could be classed as dated. But we had a lovely stay with a huge room, very comfy bed. The pool area is adorned with Greek statues and the decor that of Roman baths! I am sure it will only be a matter of time before this is all changed to a modern slick hotel like most other Marriots. The breakfast was fabulous, especially the freshly made omelettes and the staff cannot do enough to help. Will definitely return.
Comment Title: Great stay in this Royal hotel

Comments: Booked through Hotels.com and stayed in room 711. Greeting - the reception area is nice and grand and the staff are reasonably pleasant, they claimed they did not have any of my details and so I had to complete the registration in full by hand.  Room - this is a basement room with an awful view of the courtyard (not nice at all!!), the bathroom is nicely laid out but the shower is above the bath which feels like a cheap hotel to me, the cold water tap in the sink did not work correctly either, which made the task of cleaning teeth very difficult. The bed was comfortable and I had a decent nights sleep.  Breakfast- the breakfast was standard hotel style, definitely nothing special but I have had a lot worse at other 5 star hotels.  Bar & Restaurant - this has just been refurbed
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Desk Supervisor at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 29 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear johnyboy1807,   Thank you for taking the time to submit a review in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the condition of the hotel, I would like to inform you that we will be getting a refurbishment later this year where upon we can improve on the issues with the sinks and tap. I am delighted to hear that you had a good nights sleep and found the bed comfortable. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.    Sincerely,  JESSICA OAKLEY  Front Desk Supervisor   jess.oakley@marriotthotels.com

Comments: From the moment we got there the staff treated us so well, going to every last effort. The car park was great under the hotel, very convenient and subsidised for hotel users. The pool, steam room and sauna was a big plus, clean and all in working order. The room likewise was clean and had everything we wanted so that was great too. Would happily return here again and again.

We had a wonderful stay.  Before our stay, Jess (from the from guest team) answered my queries regarding my stay and organised for a card and chocolates to be placed in the room as a birthday surprise for my wife. Lovely touch!Jess was prompt in her replies and very courteous and understanding.  The room (1323) was good overall and had everything we required. I feel the bathroom needs updating as the hot water tap wasn't working well and the bathtub needs replacing with perhaps a walk in shower. However, it did the job.  The front desk team were great and we were kindly afforded complimentary parking as our stay was for a special occasion. There were smiles from all staff throughout the day and we were given a complimentary late checkout due to a need that presented itself.
Date of Review: Farhaan Abdulla wrote a review Jul 2017
Comment Title: A great hotel with excellent staff

Comments: We stayed here on our wedding night and it was an excellent stay. We had a suite which was massive in size. There was noise from the centre and it sounded like a window was open but if you're staying the centre you have to expect noise particularly on a Friday night. The staff knew it was our wedding night and left a card and chocolate which was a nice touch. the bath was amazing with spa function. The room was clean and had 2 tvs. Breakfast was very good quality and we both opted for cooked breakfast.  The staff were very attentive and we couldn;t have asked for a better stay.
Date of Review: Natalie H wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: The hotel is very well situated near the harbour. Although the hotel seemed a little tired looking (esp toilets downstairs) the food and service was excellent. Staff were very helpful and friendly and made my stay a pleasure. I will definitely return
Date of Review: Hilary G wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: I had stayed at this hotel probably 20 years previously & seemed to recall it being ok. On my recent visit what is immediately apparent is the difference between the front of house facilities and the bedrooms / accommodation areas. The former areas, reception, bar, restaurant etc are all in good order whilst the bedrooms & hallways are very tired to say the least. Sadly this is one Marriott I will not return to which is a shame as it is in a great location
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 26 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear DSDurham,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel .  Please be assured that your feedback has been noted and taken on board. I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. Whilst we strive to maintain the highest standards, especially in regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel, unfortunately this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  We are currently eagerly awaiting a renovation which should hopefully commence towards the end of this year, and be sure to provide a highly functional space that meets the needs of our valued guests, like yourself.
