Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Short stay on a business trip but loved my stay here. Very clean hotel and staff very pleasant and helpful. Looking forward to coming back here on my next visit. My first time staying at this hotel so def won't be my last.

Lovely, clean, friendly,hotel nothing to much trouble. Checked in nice and easy asked us if we had been before we said no first time we are celebrating our 45 wedding  he congratulated us on our anniversary. Went up to our room which was lovely then a couple of minutes later a knock at the door and we were handed a card and a box of truffles from the gentleman who had checked us in. How thoughtful of him to go to the trouble of making our stay that bit more special.
Date of Review: Marion B wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: Stayed here for the harbour festival and it cost 184 plus 16 for car park. Chose it because of great location and have stayed twice previously. Think the check in time of 4pm is too late. Our room had a few flaws (cracked bath, stained bathroom flooring, stained carpet on window side of bed, stained upholstery on chair) so I did not feel the price was justified. Breakfast was lovely with a broad fresh fruit choice and the spa was also good for an early morning swim. Location is a huge asset within easy walk of harbour and city centre.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 24 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear TIJTBristol,  Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us.   I would like to take this opportunity to sincerely apologise for the issues you experienced in your bedroom, and that this was not up to your expected standard. I am however glad to hear you enjoyed your Breakfast and the use of our Leisure facilities.   Please be assured that all of your feedback will be passed on to the relevant departments to be corrected and investigated.  We are also eagerly awaiting a refurbishment which should hopefully commence later in the year, and should resolve some of the issues you have experienced in your bedroom.  We hope to have a chance to better your experience with us if your travels ever bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Stayed here for a few nights, great location and overall ambience of a traditional hotel. The room was adequate but not cheap for the price, the hotel is however in dire need of refurbishment and this is planned. Where however are the much lauded comfort marriott mattresses and feather pillows?

It's a very grand hotel with a spectacular dining/event hall, lovely pool and jacuzzi, right in the heart of the city well situated in the lovely College Green. Ideally located next to the Cathedral for anyone visiting a Graduation in the Cathedral next door.

It is a pity when a grand old building is a facade for a facility that is well past its use-by date. Staff were friendly and breakfast was good, but the room and the corridor to it made me feel I was in a Victorian asylum. Everything 'worked' and the bed was fine, although the water pressure gave me a few cold shocks, but the lighting, decor and the use of 60's furnishings was somewhat depressing. The parking garage and labyrinth to reach the hotel definitely need attention. It is typical of many British hotels but nothing that a thoughtful refurb couldn't turn into a gem. . .
Date of Review: Anthony B wrote a review Jul 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 23 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear Anthony B,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We do strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, as you have mentioned, this sometimes requires essential renovations.  We are currently eagerly awaiting a refurbishment of our hotel, which should hopefully commence towards the end of the year, and be sure to provide a highly functional space that meets the needs of valued guests, like yourself.    Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during this stay, I hope you will consider the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel on your next visit to Bristol so that we can improve on your experience with us.  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: As a disabled customer I do not attend ANY venue without both telephonic & actual physical confirmation that they have the stated provisions in place, sadly the marriot royal bristol failed miserably. I had book a table, after aforementioned enquiries for a family celebration. All the staff we encountered were pleasant & polite but this goes little to ameliorate the problems we encountered. The restaurant had barely 6 tables seated for evening service & this may be 1 reason to explain the lack of staff on the floor but definitely doesn't excuse the very slow service. These are all reasons to post a poor review but it is their alleged disabled facilities that are the real problem. Its bad enough that the loo is quite a considerable distance away but after initial inspection had
Date of Review: Hellen D wrote a review Jul 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 22 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear Hellen D,  Thank you for taking the time share your comments regarding your recent visit to the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apologies for the issues you experienced during your stay regarding our disabled facilities and your dinner service. Please be assured that we have shared your feedback with our Hotel Manager to ensure these issues are investigated and looked in to. We apologise for any stress or inconvenience we may have caused.  As always we welcome any and all feedback, as we are constantly looking to improve our service and product.  We are also eagerly awaiting a refurbishment which should hopefully commence later this year, and these issues you have highlighted with disabled facilities will most definitely be looked in to.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us if your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: The hotel were very helpful And attentive on the day reserving a table in a very comfortable lounge setting We were given free prosecco and the food was nicely presented The only negative was they did not offer extra sandwiches and they did need to be asked to top up the tea with hot water but still very happy with the hotel overall

Positives: Location, next to docks, bars, walking distance to shops (15/20 minutes) Comfy beds, excellent black out curtains  Efficient reception Friendly helpful staff   Unfortunately the good points end there. At nearly £180 for a room (no breakfast included) my expectations were high sadly there were problems from the start.  When we arrived in the room desperate for a cup of tea we discovered the cups and spoons still dirty from previous guest. The chair was covered with make up and suspicious stains.  Reception 'upgraded' us to an executive room, much cleaner but the difference in rooms ? Nothing except 2 chocolates on the bed, robes, slippers and a few extra toiletries oh and of course a coffee maker so old I remember my parents having a similar model in the late 80s.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 21 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear Ineedaholiday2012,  Thank you for taking the time share your comments regarding your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   Please accept our sincere apologies for all the issues you experienced during your stay. This includes the issues with your room cleanliness, and the general standard of our public areas and Leisure Club. Please be assured that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure that these are isolated issues that are corrected moving forward.   As you mentioned we are also awaiting a refurbishment which should hopefully commence in the last few months of this year, and should avoid similar issues like the one's you experienced as well  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Stayed here with my wife overnight to see the Illegal Eagles in the Hippodrome at Bristol. Having thoroughly enjoyed the concert, we enjoyed a drink at the bar before retiring. The room was beautifully air conditioned, comfortable and well presented with an excellent bathroom and a nicely stocked coffee area. The staff were friendly and efficient, breakfast outstanding.

Stayed for two nights , we arrived a little early but managed to get us settled in , we were o n the top floor   nice view ,  bedroom was clean and comfortable , would have liked a few more pillows or larger ones  while propped  up watching tv  , ( as we were leaving  they were changing all the tv's to bigger ones) . Lovely swim after wandering around bristol all day in the Leisure centre ,with nice steam room and sauna. Staff are really nice , took our luggage into  storage allowing to wander around town untill it was time to catch our train home   thanks
Date of Review: Ken R wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: Very friendly staff.  Comfortable and well equipped rooms. We were fortunate to overlook the harbour. Ideal location for exploring the Harbourside, Park Street, SS Great Britain and walking or public transport to the Zoo, Clifton and the Clifton Suspension Bridge. As it is popular check-in/registration can take a while. Sham wi-fi is only free in the rooms if you book direct.
Comment Title: Super location in heart of Bristol next to Harbourside

Comments: Excellent reception greeted by very friendly staff went out the way for me to check me in 4 hours early we booked a basic room very clean spacious and a great view of Bristol cathedral can't go wrong with the price either seeming as it's the marriot felt like royalty there   Also the leisure centre is great gym a bit small but do able   Will see you again thank you
Date of Review: David Lewis wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: Beautiful hotel, from the dinning room inside a courtyard to the fabulous leisure centre with hand painted murals . The staff always make this a welcoming hotel, they work hard and always try to assist in every way they can, from the concierge to the bar staff and all. Great friendly bar service and waitresses. A very big thank you to Victoria Rogan who is amazing, always friendly, helpful and very polite. The breakfasts are always a treat, cooked to a high standard and plenty of choices, I think even Queen Victoria would be amused and delighted.
Date of Review: Andrea H wrote a review Jul 2017
Comment Title: Is Queen Victoria amused or bemused

Comments: Holiday Profile – Dates October 2016, family of four, 2 adults, two children 6 years and 3 years. We are experienced travellers.  Booking – Tip : Book on Booking.com for good rates, or as we did direct with Hotel for Marriot Gold privileges and points.  Reservations process – Tip : Book using on Marriot App on mobile, Marriot App is very simple and easy to use, provides good location, site, city and attraction info and all you need on Hotel details are on the App, this simplified our booking and allowed us to manage and control our booking very easily.    Journey – Tip : travelled from Birmingham to London, a nice drive in daytime, but routes in and around Bristol are major traffic corridors and can get busy nad roads can be congested in and out of Bristol, plan ahead on route
Comment Title: Excellent Hotel in the heart of the city close to all attractions

Comments: Very convenient for the harbour side rooms where lovely breakfast had a good choice but was very annoyed when thwaitress came around for tea and coffee when I asked for a latte I was told it was £1.50 extra this is terrible in a hotel of this class that you can only get a basic coffee with your breakfast pool and spa were okay but in general this hotel needs updating the carpets in the public area are rather faded

Spent a night here - all good but check your room as there are some in the basement, some with inward looking rooms facing a small courtyard and fiurth floor rooms appear smaller. (We know as we rejected some before being satisfied)
Comment Title: Good hotel - just check your room allocation

Comments: Great hotel location and a beautiful looking building. The inside of the hotel is a little dated now and could probably do with a facelift, but the rooms are comfortable and spacious. Breakfast was excellent with a wide selection of produce. Very busy though so I would get down early at the weekend.
Comment Title: Grand hotel but a little tired

Comments: A convenient and centrally located hotel with a good breakfast. Expected a bit better in terms of cleanliness but baby wipes and a rinse here and there helped. Hotel needs some refurbishment as rooms looking somewhat tired but I would still recommend it.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 13 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear AnnaMariaCardona,  Thank you for taking the time share your comments in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   I do apologise for the issues with cleanliness that you experienced during your stay. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   I would also like to inform you that we are eagerly awaiting a refurbishment, which should hopefully commence later in the year.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: We cheekily popped in to use the loo in this hotel when last in this side of town and liked the place straight away so we decided to give it a try for our next trip. We stay in Bristol at least 2 times a year and historically go with the Mercure as this is also to a similar standard but more modern in style and certainly not as grandiose. Our assessment having never stayed but looking at the website was that this place seemed nice but that it gave little extra to justify the high room rate. For a change and as outlined above we decided to use 3 months’ worth of BA frequent flyer points (plus a small surcharge) and try 2 nights here. After a shaky check in, everything was great and all that you would expect from a hotel pitching at this level. The room was a good size with 2
Date of Review: Jon Richards wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: This 'traditional' styled hotel with solid furniture and fittings looks and feels quite regal, so the 'Royal' in its title is well justified.   We were very glad to be able to access the ample car parking available in the hotel's underground car park, which made life easier for us, as we were not familiar with the area.  Our room was clean, spacious and very comfortable.  The breakfast was also very good.  The staff are well trained and they were keen to ensure that we received good customer service, which we did.

I stayed here one night in July when it was almost 30 degrees in Bristol. I was pleasantly surprised that the airco worked so efficiently.   In general, this was a good hotel. Next door to the cathedral and a very short walk away from the harbor with all of its restaurants.   The staff was very friendly if moderately disorganized. Which was charming.   A couple of quirks: the wifi would to be reconnected every twenty minutes or so. And the hot water tap was beyond scalding.   But I will certainly stay here again the next time life brings me to Bristol.
Date of Review: Eric H wrote a review Jul 2017

Comments: Hotel is clean but truly needs a bit of a uplift.  Very nice spa/pool gym.  staff SUPERB!!  Every single person encountered was delightful and pleasant and helpful.  That includes front desk, bar staff, bell staff, wait staff in the dining room...everyone.

Situated in a charming part of the regenerated Bristol adjacent to the river area full of life and handy for small supermarkets to buy bits and pieces. Busy large hotel rather disjointed in its layout with lifts in odd places. Lovely room and bathroom overlooking the river.  Some problems with room cleanliness but this was remedied.  Breakfast was buffet style ,good and plentiful. Staff all courteous.

Great 3 night stay, upgraded to Junior suite and was rewarded with massive room with comfy king size bed, large jacuzzi bath, all the things you'd expect from such a hotel. Didn't disappoint and is an easy walk into the city centre. Had a great time.

Loved absolutely everything about this hotel & really cannot understand some of the comments written by other guests. Our room was lovely & clean, the bed was one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in & the pillows were perfect. Big bathroom with a bath & really good shower. Breakfast was excellent with a wide range of hot & cold dishes, fresh fruits, pastries, etc. I didn't use the pool or sauna myself but my husband did & he couldn't fault them. All the hotel staff, without exception, were smiley, friendly & professional. It was an absolute pleasure to stay in this hotel & we would love to return one day.

The hotel itself is nice, classic, very old but with the romantic and historical feel which I liked. The bar area and the restaurant are lovely. Breakfast was really good and fresh, the chef cooking in front of the guests was great! The service of waiters and waitresses was not very good. Not very attentive and not professional at all. Our room was absolutely horrible. It was dusty and the shower was ancient! I was actually worried it all would have fallen apart! I will definitely NOT stay again! Not much value for your money at all. It is in a good location, just few steps from the cathedral and city centre but the hotel itself is not worthy. I would come back for the afternoon tea or lunch, but that 's about it. I used to work for the Marriott hotels before and to be honest
Date of Review: Ludmila K wrote a review Jun 2017
Comment Title: You would expect more from Marriott Group!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 1 Jul 2017
Response comment: Dear Ludmila K,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel with us.   As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your room fell short of your expectations. Please be assured that, as you say, this is not our usual standard, and that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team in an effort to improve our service. We will also aim to make sure these issues do not happen again.  I would also like to apologise for the service you experienced at Breakfast, again please be assured this is also being investigated, and will be corrected as soon as possible.  As a valued guest, we hope you still choose to stay with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Assistant Front Office Manager

Comments: Very good hotel. Recommend for overnight stay - better than Marriot by Cribbs although this was good too. Bristol Royal was more individual and had heritage. Would visit again if exploring harbour area of city.

Old hotel which might be lovely, but this was a bit tattered and had seen better days.  the statue of Queen Victoria outside covered in bird droppings should have been a warning!  Dirty, very dirty rooms.  In need of a complete overhaul.  Terrible beds.  Mine didn't have a mattress, just a pillow top on top of the box springs so the sleeping area was lower then the side, wooden railings.  It might have been a lovely 4 poster bed otherwise.  The carpeting was very dirty, as were the drapes.  Don't believe the brochure as there were no such rooms, as those shown.  It's only saving grace were the staff.  Very warm and hospitable.
Comment Title: I'm surprised there were no ghosts!

Comments: We always stay at the Royal when visiting Bristol and we have never been disappointed. The staff are always very helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean and air. It's ideal for the centre and the theatre. Food and drink is good.   It has a car park. An excellent place to stay.

Very decently located in the Town. The staff are all friendly and helpfull. Bed is nice as always in marriott hotels. Great breakfast. one thing was thought that the hotel had been booked fro a party downstairs where there was a lot of noise. other then that happy with the stay

Attended a conference here, and stayed at the hotel. Reception staff friendly and helpful thank you. Woman on the hot breakfast counter most unhelpful and put out by any requests, insincere really put out by request  for an omelette! Didn't tell me it was cooked let it stand there. Generally shabby. Some ares quite grubby. Ran out of hand towels, toilets a mess. Coffee tepid. The a significant number of ground food poisoning after lunch. A real let down

I have stayed here before and booked again a couple of nights before my planned stay on 11th June. Turned up and reception could not find booking. They checked and it appeared booking was for 9th July instead. Now whether the Marriott website which I booked on had an error or whether it was my error I cannot be certain but they would not allow me to switch the date and I ended up booking another room for the night and not being able to cancel the 9th July. I think thats pretty mean and unprofessional.  I decided to write or call in as I had an urgent meeting that night so couldn't be bothered to get all annoyed at reception. Today I called and asked that I change the date to 6th of July because I could make another business trip. Receptionist went away and asked management.
Date of Review: Richard P wrote a review Jun 2017
Comment Title: Nice hotel but massive let down in customer relations

Comments: We visited this hotel for drinks and a formal dinner.  It was a lovely place to be with great decor, character and service.  Built from lovely stone by a Bristol merchant, the architecture is beautiful and Marriott have fitted it with great style.  You get waiter service in the comfy bar.  In the Palm Court restaurant we had an excellent dinner in a spacious room.
Date of Review: Steve M wrote a review Jun 2017

Comments: I stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights, room was very good, staff are friendly and professional, location is great, and i had 3 good sleeps. Thanks Marriott. Its good too that the car park is integral, down the lift. My only concern is the car park charges - extortionate.

I would like to highlight Franklin's soft skills and very professional understanding about Marriott brand image. He acts always very professionally and treats customer with a smile. I am surprised how he manages to remember every customers lastname and name. This obviously makes your visit at this hotel more welcome and nicer and not just because you are gold or platinum member. Yet, it's worth highlighting that every customer is met with in a very professional manner. You can say that He will go far! I have a very great respect for this hotel and its management to select the right people and maintain high level of quality of service and excellence standards.

I stayed here on business as it came recommended by other work colleagues. I was not disappointed at all. A grand hotel that has retained much of its historic character. The staff are so polite and friendly, especially in the dining rooms and bar. They make you feel as though nothing is too much. The rooms are very well appointed and comfortable. Above all they are quiet, just what you need after a long business day.  The room service menu is great should you not wish to go to the main restaurant for dinner. Fast, fresh and very tasty.  The only 2 downsides are the car park, it's in the bowls of the hotel. Tight parking bays and the walk to reception is epic and through some grime grey concrete jungle type pillars. But you forget all that once you have checked in and in your

Centrally located in Bristol for almost anything.  Accross from the harbourside with alll the great restaurants, cafes and bars, plus nightlife galore!  Also very close to the Aquarium and Science Museum, and Hippodrome Theatre.  Staff excellent.  As Gold members we were upgraded to 1 bedroom suite with views of the city.  Comfortable bed.  Great buffet breakfrast.  Will be back.

You pay for the nice location, and friendly staff as you would expect from any Marriott.  Car park ceiling is LOW, very low, and the spaces are very narrow. Not recommended for anyone with MPV or bigger.
Date of Review: Charley F wrote a review Jun 2017
Comment Title: Central location, nice staffs, awful car park
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Piotr T, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 21 Jun 2017
Response comment: Dear Guest   Thank you for taking the time share your comments in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.    We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.

Comments: Stayed one night during a business conference event. Lovely old building, very well maintained with original character retained. From check in to check out great stay, helpful friendly staff. Rooms were large and airy with very comfortable bed. Well worth a visit.

Upgraded to a suit for wedding night.   Our son and future daughter in law made reservations without informing hotel it was for their wedding night. Daniel in reservation upgraded them to a suite when he heard.  Beautiful hotel. Thank you Daniel.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Piotr T, Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Jun 2017
Response comment: Dear Elken   Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay. I am glad to hear that you liked your suite.   We would like to congratulate on your wedding and wish you all the best.   Regards   Peter

Comments: We were greeted by excellent and very professional staff on our arrival and throughout our stay service was prompt and staff very friendly. We requested an ice bucket for our room and additional towels which arrived swiftly.  The breakfast buffet was excellent with plenty of choice. Decor of the hotel is lovely, a couple of areas would benefit from updating but in the main very nice. We did question the charge for our car parking which is £16 for 24 hours and we had been overcharged which was very quickly rectified. Great experience, I would definitely stay here again.
Date of Review: Debbie W wrote a review Jun 2017

Comments: Family of 4 visiting Grease the musical thought we would stay here as it looked like a hotel with character and a two minute walk to the hippodrome.  We had 2 suites very big with separate bathroom and living room.  I must agree with other reviewers it could be an amazing place but rather shabby in decor and tired looking.  Saying that bed was comfortable and had what we needed for a one night stay.  Air conditioning was very efficient.  Breakfast was good plenty of choice and hot, staff friendly and helpful.  Car parking included with room.  My biggest grumble would be the wifi or lack of it, as business people we still need to be able to check our email and messages which we found very difficult.  Would I visit again, maybe

My opinion hasn't changed - this hotel needs renovation and a fresh approach to service.  I've read other reviews many of which are positive, which I find quite surprising. I suspect some people may have lower expectations than me. Some may possibly breathe through the mouth so they aren't able to detect the smells I notice ;-) The air freshener sprayed throughout the hotel corridors and bedrooms via the ventilation system (presumably to mask the smell of ancient carpets) is dreadful.  The carpets are worn and the bathrooms generally look as if they were designed for a look of opulence in the 1990s.  The bed we had was comfortable and provided a good night's sleep. The duvet felt a little cheap, as did the pillows, which smell of other people's hair.  The telephone pricing
Date of Review: Iain W wrote a review Jun 2017
Comment Title: Asked by trip advisor to review again

Comments: I visited with friends to attend a music gig and for a night out. We had a very warm and personal welcome from Ettienne (apologies if misspelt) at the reception. Thank you very much:) The stay was very comfortable, we also managed to use a swimming pool and sauna, which was nice. It's located very conveniently in the city centre close to transport links. I cannot comment much on food, however we had lunch on the day of departure which was very nice. The only negative thing was a service charge added by a bartender to the price of meals ordered and paid for at the bar. The staff were very nice, when we challenged the charge, it was removed, but if it's the hotel's policy, I believe they need to seriously rethink it.

I stayed at the Bristol Marriott when I took my kids shopping for school (we live in Icelland). It's quite well located and the best thing was that the hotel has a pool.  Nice option, great price and servise.
Date of Review: Eva Sigurgeirsdottir wrote a review May 2017
Comment Title: Perfect hotel when travelling with kids

Comments: Absolutely loved this hotel, loved the facilities including the pool, jacuzzi and sauna! The staff were amazing and so friendly, room was immaculate! 5 minute walk from the Bristol O2 Arena and also lots of bars and restaurants just behind it. Close to shops, about 20 minute walk from town centre. Beautiful building inside and out!

We booked just for one night with breakfast.  Wonderful breakfast and the room was clean and tidy. The restaurant was quiet that evening just a shame there was a family dining who did not know how to behave, they belonged at a Premier Inn, children unable to sit at the table, parents who did not care. Not the hotels fault. Could not fault the hotel, shame they let in people who have no thought for others.

Check in was like a scene out of heathrow airport. I checked in on-line but it made no difference to the slowness of the whole check in process. I was asked for ID - I am English and a Marriott Rewards customer and a marriott vacation club timeshare owner - why ? The breakfast is over priced, the service is shocking, no friendliness, greetings or smiles. Food was cold on arrival and had to complain. I asked for Pepper and it just didnt appear. I dont see why I should pay £16 to park my car given the amount of money I spent for the 2 night stay with two rooms. It just feels that the staff dont care and the place is soul less. Check out was painful - both the bills were wrong and I am not paying an automatic service charge for such poor service. Too much complacency for me.
Date of Review: Steve M wrote a review May 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 31 May 2017
Response comment: Dear stevegmorris1,  Thank you for your recent feedback in regards to your recent stay with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for the many issues you faced, including the slow check-in, the service you received at Breakfast and the issues with your invoices upon departure. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that we have shared all of this feedback with the appropriate managers, to ensure these issues will be investigated.  I would also like to apologise for the confusion caused by asking for ID upon check-in. Although we recognize you are a valued Rewards member with us, I would like to highlight that this is a new procedure we have recently implemented, due to heightened security measures following recent events in the country. As always the safety of our guests is our main priority, however we apologise if it impacted the service you received and if this was not explained clearly on your arrival.  Following on from this and upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: Found whats seemed like a great deal with my partner on Booking.com we decide to book this renowned hotel, however unfortunately it has not been the experiences we were expecting. First of all, the parking which is listed as complimentary in the website is not, therefore expect a £16 daily fare if you travel by car, I have tried to discuss it with the Concierge staff with no luck but no biggie. The hotel is itself a marvellous listed building but in desperate needs of an update as the rooms have a old feeling rather than classic.. No mini fridge with only two mini bottles of still water for the guests in the room, a old TV ( most of the programs / movies requires and extra payment..) no USB plugs and a ridiculous extra fare of £4.99 for daily Wi-fi ? Really ?!   Swimming pool
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 31 May 2017
Response comment: Dear Elena7484,  Thank you for your recent feedback in regards to your recent stay with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for the many issues you faced with us during your stay. This includes the issue you faced with car parking charges, the standard of your bedroom, and the general issues you faced with service during your stay. Please be assured that this is not our usual standard, and that we have shared all of this feedback with the appropriate managers, and these issues will be investigated.  I would also like to apologise at the annoyance caused by placing your invoice under your door. Please be aware that this was not our intention and was simply meant to make your check-out experience easier, so you can review you bill before hand and use the express check-out option should you wish to.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: I took my parents here in before Christmas, only just reviewing now but I recently recommended to a client visiting Bristol mainly for the hotels great Leisure facilities.   Much larger and more comprehensive than most hotel fitness facilities they really are superb, and enabled me to do some great training sessions and relaxation whilst exploring Bristol and Bath.  A large pool with steam and the fitness suite is very well equipped with plenty of cardio kit, free weights and fixed resistance brilliant for the fitness enthusiasts or somebody looking to relax after exploring Bristol or Bath.  We visited the the 22nd/23rd Dec and the staff were super friendly, the breakfast was great and the hot chocolate in the front lounge was very relaxing. We didn't dine here in the evening

Well located near the harbour and other attractions. Standard of the hotel was excellent and the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful.  Full range of services and function areas and on-site parking.  Highly recommended for business or private events.
Date of Review: Adrian M wrote a review May 2017

Comments: We stayed at BMR for a theatre trip to the Hippodrome and chose it for its proximity to the theatre and also to the waterside.  We treated ourselves to a larger suite and this was on a corner location with a large bedroom and separate lounge and bathroom.  The criticisms we would have of the room were an empty minibar (Is this the norm for a one night stay?) and a wonky shower door.    Otherwise the room was very nice.  We had a post-theatre snack and drinks in the bar and the food was good and reasonably priced for a city centre hotel.  We made an early morning trip to the Leisure centre and this was quite quiet around 8 in the morning with a reasonable sized pool, Jacuzzi and a very steamy steam room.  Breakfast was the usual self service layout and there was sufficient choice

Very busy at the reception desk to book in but there was 4 receptionists so it actually was quick.  The bedroom was of good standard, although we found an orange & empty bottle of wine under the bed!  The room was quiet at night time which was good as the hotel is in the heart of the watershed area.

This hotel makes you feel like you're somewhere special.  Very well positioned for central Bristol and Clifton.  Great breakfast options. Friendly staff. Expensive but you get what you pay for.. .......

For most people nowadays Internet is a utility that hotels should not charge for.  Any hotel wishing to prosper needs to understand this simple premise. Might as well try to charge for a TV in your room.  Room was pretty nice though. Breakfast what you would expect when not charged too much for an overnight stay.  On a point of principle will not go back to a UK hotel that seeks to charge for WiFi.
Date of Review: David D wrote a review May 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 30 May 2017
Response comment: Dear David D,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel with us.  In today’s modern world, we certainly understand how important Internet accessibility is. I truly apologize that you were disappointed by the charge for this service during your stay. We are passionate about offering the best possible experience to all of our guests and are subsequently looking into ways to improve our service.   We do offer a complimentary internet service to those who are part of our Marriott Rewards Loyalty programme. Should you ever be interested in joining, it is simple and free to do so during your reservation process.  Thank you again for taking the time to share your feedback with us, and we hope to welcome you back to our hotel if your travels ever bring you back to Bristol  Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: The hotel is in a great location - the lovely College Green and canal-walkways with restaurants, if you wanted a short stroll, and not too far from the city centre shops, either. The building could do with a bit of renovation (especially, the bathrooms) and I would have liked a small refrigerator in my room (minibar, but not necessarily with any drinks to be purchased, just to cool some water).  Also, the wi-fi was extremely slow. But the stay was enjoyable and the kitchen gets top marks - both for the small snacks in the bar (flatbread with spinach and feta) and the vegetarian food I was served at a large gala-dinner. Excellent.
Date of Review: Jonina L wrote a review May 2017

Comments: This hotel looks like it used to be awesome. It is in a great spot and the staff are attentive. However, the whole thing feels a bit like a museum piece. The communal areas reminded me of Chatham. Once Royal, shiny, up market and extravagantly top of the range. Now worn out and worn down but still buffing itself up and doing it's best. Ok, could be worse, but could be better with a massive modernization.
Comment Title: Ok, but faded, tired, worn, well used...
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 27 May 2017
Response comment: Dear nemisisofpop,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel with us.   I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  We are currently eagerly awaiting a major renovation which should be sure to provide a functional space that meets the modern needs of our valued guests, like yourself.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: I stayed in this hotel on business. We got off to a bad start after it took me over 30 mins to check in. The system didn't have my booking and the hotel was full. I was tired after a long day and didn't appreciate the offer of a free drink in the bar. I saw the manager who was extremely helpful and could not have done more for me to make recompense. The room was nice with a large somewhat outdated bathroom and I slept well. The food is expensive for what it is but I enjoyed both breakfast and room service. The hotel is well located for all Bristol attractions being located in College Green. It is close to the waterfront.
Comment Title: A disappointing start to a pleasant stay

Comments: Booked in for a one night stay, hopefull it would be a great experience however.....   Paid for deluxe King size room or a queen size ended up with a family room with two double beds, . Good if we had an arguement I guess,  Bathroom   was dirty and still had hairs from the previous guest in it,  Offered a replacement queen room only to be told it was lower ground floor and not as nice as where we were,  My experience of the staff was a good one yet seemingly dissapointing as had been told there was no other rooms available as they were full....  It's a pity. I was so looking forward too my first experience here.. I don't think I will be returning
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 22 May 2017
Response comment: Dear jasegee,  Thank you for your recent feedback in regards to your recent stay with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for all of the issues you faced with your room during your stay. This includes the cleanliness of your room, as well as the inconvenience of having to move rooms. Please be assured that this is not our usual standards, and that we have shared this feedback with the appropriate hotel managers, to ensure that these are isolated issues that are corrected moving forward.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.    Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: Well located hotel, great car parking for city centre, some faded but attractive public areas, good liesure facilities, better than average bedroom,, nice and clean all round. One drawback, scalding hot water unable to control which made use difficult.6  Main complaint is that we were basically as tourists, but reception staff were not geared up for it.The general standard of English among the desk staff was inadequate. More to the point they knew hardly anything about the city, its attractions or its transport systems.Impossible to obtain accurate directions to anywhere. Reception staff were so impersonal that one approached them with trepidation, and we hover around the desk until the one who spoke the best English was free! Worst however where the draconian payment rules!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 16 May 2017
Response comment: Dear tonydorfmann,  Thank you for your recent feedback in regards to your recent stay with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for the issues you faced with us during your stay, mainly with the service provided in reception. Please be assured that we have shared this feedback with the appropriate managers, and this issue will be looked in to.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.    Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: The hotel is typical of a chain 4 star. Some interesting features but somewhat lacking in charm.  On the plus side, the location is central, the parking convenient (for a price) and the rooms, or at least my room, spacious. The staff are professional.  On the down side the hotel is a bit faded, the rooms clean but a bit dusty and little things, no tissues and no one answering the phone, an irritation.   The main issue is price. For £122 I would expect breakfast included, not presented as an expensive extra (a slightly less expensive extra if you guess your hunger levels in advance). The parking, though convenient is not cheap. Penalising those booking through booking.com (other websites are available) by withholding the free wifi offered to direct bookings comes across as
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Ashley C, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 14 May 2017
Response comment: Dear YorkRaven,    Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.    As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issues you occurred during your stay. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.    Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.

Comments: This hotel, even from the outside, look very a la mode. In the inside it's pure class...staff are very attentive and nothing is too much for them. The room and en suite was wonderful. The bath took only minitues to fill with hot water (as compared to cheaper places with slow flow and luke warm water). Breakfast was worth the sit down of a morning and their coffee is real coffee...nit the usual wisjy washy stuff I have been sereved for breakfast elsewhere.

Arrived early Evening greeted with a drink at reception. The hotel is clean and the room was lovely with a comfy bed and great bathroom.  Breakfast was plentiful and hot the location is perfect with it being right on the docks close to the bars . We loved our visit alround

Gorgeous decor and hotel.... great location brilliant service ... recommend the suite with jacuzzi bath was brill with glass of wine 👌 security was very helpful and pleasant  Breakfast is good all options available in the buffet
Date of Review: Kayleigh W wrote a review May 2017

Comments: I agree with most of past comments.  This is a very busy City Centre hotel and I did not expect it to be decked out lavishly with expensive carpets, flowers etc.  We also can carry our cases and did not expect someone to do that for us.  Our room was very large and well fitted, bed comfortable and clean, good bath and efficient heating, TV OK but to pay for WiFi is ridiculous and they deserve a black mark.  Parking underneath hotel good and safe.   The breakfast were excellent, better than many Dubai hotels, seating comfortable and well spaced.  All the staff were pleasant and competent. Reception fast and courteous.  We dined as a group to an excellent pre ordered menu, well served in beautiful large event room.  The bars were OK and I was told the swimming pool and gym

I was pretty disappointed with the shabbiness of this hotel.  Woodwork needs paint, carpets need to be replaced, and in general the floors looked dirty. No one helps you with your bags....but does offer a glass of wine as you struggle with them???  Really unappealing entry when you drive in as well.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 9 May 2017
Response comment: Dear kathbon36,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel with us.   I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  We are currently eagerly awaiting a refurbishment of our hotel. This should hopefully provide a functional space that meets the needs of our valued guests, like yourself.   I also apologise that no one offered you any assistance with your bags. Please be assured this is not our usual standard of service and is something we will look in to, to make sure it was an isolated incident.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel on your next visit to Bristol so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.   Sincerely, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: We stayed for two nights in May. I was in Bristol at a conference and brought my husband and toddler along. The staff went over and above to accommodate us and make us feel welcome. All the staff were friendly and polite.  We were able to check in at 9am on the first day, which we really appreciated given my husband and toddler wouldn't have had a 'base' otherwise. The staff put a travel cot, nappy bin and baby toiletries in our room for us. One of the waitresses said we could take a few extra pastries/muffins away from breakfast for the toddler to snack on later that day, which was much appreciated!   The hotel itself is beautiful and well located. It's just around the corner from Bristol aquarium, and @Bristol (science museum). It has a good size swimming pool and large

Stayed at the Btistol Marriot Royal hotel for several nights whilst attending a conference. Great city centre location in a historic and scenic part of Bristol next to Bristol cathedral. The location of the hotel is great for accessing city centre and surrounding attractions.The hotel certainly has character and I was impressed with many of the features of the hotel, I'll leave these for you to discover!!  My room was of a high standard, large room, spacious and comfy bed. The food served during the conference was excellent with a good choice and breakfast was also very good, again a good choice and range from hot and cold buffet, fresh fruit, cereal etc.  The staff were all very friendly and attentive to needs of both myself and conference delegates.  I would definitely stay
Date of Review: Russell B wrote a review May 2017
Comment Title: Historic hotel and easy accessible for city attractions.

Comments: The hotel was a little frayed around the edges but safe, in a really good location and the staff were wonderful.  Car parking: You don't have to pay beforehand (the sign is somewhat confusing)make sure you go to the reception to pay (not the machine) its only £16 for 24hrs as apposed to 8hrs as advertised.   Veggie/intolerance: It's not advertised but the staff were able to supply soya milk etc. at breakfast. The restaurant staff were very sweet.Or the bar on the ground floor serves Starbucks. Always good to know!  Housekeeping:I got a knock at 8am with someone wanting to clear the room assuming that all those staying for the conference would be up and out. I think this time is unacceptable for a hotel but only my opinion. Put your 'do not disturb' on the door. Particularly if
Comment Title: Solo female travelling for business- tips!

Comments: This hotel was very central to be based in.  Very relaxing surroundings and they serve a great breakfast.  Rooms very spacious with a comfortable bed. Down side is they charge for Wifi in the bedrooms, a sneaky way to charge you more money !   Bristol as a city I would recommend.  Worth taking the Open top bus to work out what is where.  The city centre is very compact to walk round if you are fit and enjoy walking.   All in all a great weekend.
Date of Review: Colindalana D wrote a review May 2017

Comments: This is a ranty review- there are reasons for this.  Please read it as it's not all bad news... the hotel made up for the problem very well....   BUT YOU NEVER CALL A FAMILY OF FOUR (ON THE WAY FROM LONDON BY CAR) AT 540PM ON DAY OF ARRIVAL (CHECK IN STARTS FROM 4PM) AND ADVISE YOU HAVEN'T GOT A ROOM.  ITS  TOO LATE - GIVE YOUR GUESTS SOME RESPECT!  We all know hotels and airlines overbook places from time to time- they try and maximise their occupancy revenue by doing so and hope that some people will always cancel on the day etc....it's all statistics and risk management for them - so it could happen to anyone...  (Besides the fact that this was the first time ever my in-laws had ever visited bristol from Buckinghamshire and were 30mins from the hotel  for a 1 night stay after
Comment Title: Shocking primary service- Hotel seemingly overbooked family and only told us just before 6pm on day of arrival.....
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 4 May 2017
Response comment: Dear JVonGrover,  Thank you very much for providing this feedback in regards to your recent reservation at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal for this particular reservation. Please accept our sincere apologies for the issue your family faced with this reservation. It is never our intention to purposefully put our guests in these types of situations, however occasionally unforeseen circumstances do lead to out booking situations as a last resort. Having looked in to this reservation I can confirm that we did have a last minute maintenance issue within the room they had booked, and unfortunately this leak could not be fixed in enough time to accommodate your guests, which is what led us to contacting yourself and out booking this family.  We do sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused, however I am glad to see you feel we compensated and resolved for this issue satisfactorily. When these unfortunate events do occur we do always try to resolve the situation as best as possible. I also hope your parents enjoyed their later stay with us as well.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us if ever you or your family may travel back to Bristol.  Regards, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: A grand hotel, slightly faded at the edges. The room was nice, a decent size with a comfy bed. The bathroom was ok albeit a little worn. The breakfast is standard buffet style but the fried and poached eggs are made fresh for you.  Overall, the service was very good.

Over priced and old...  - Hotel was dated with many signs of wear & tear. - No bathrobes in room - TV didnt work properly - Beds were not made ! - Old and in need of refurbishment  The staff at checkout were nice, but thats about it!
Date of Review: Richard S wrote a review May 2017

Comments: We have just visited this fab hotel,  this hotel is located in the best spot in Bristol for us, lots of restaurants bars and things to see all in a 10 minute walk,  the hotel is clean and tidy with very helpful staff, we got there a bit early and they didn't mind finding a room for us, nice room the only thing is that it could do with a paint, the breakfast was lovely and well organised ( no black pudding)  shame!.  Will we stay again! Hell yea
Date of Review: Richard W wrote a review May 2017

Comments: We stayed at this Bristol Marriott for a one night stopover and do NOT recommend it for the price - we paid £200 per room.  A lot of reviewers use the phrase "faded glory" and this is certainly an accurate description. The communal areas off the lobby are architecturally impressive. But the bedrooms lack 21st century modernisation, especially in the bathrooms which appear to have last been renovated in the 1980s. (See photo.)   We are in two lower ground rooms and both are dim and average. The first room I was given had a leaking air conditioning unit (see photos) - significant water dripping down from the ceiling onto the desk! Not a safe room. It took considerable time, convincing and frustration - late in the evening - to be changed to a safer, cleaner room.   I would ask for
Date of Review: Kate H wrote a review Apr 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 1 May 2017
Response comment: Dear MacaronTraveller,  Thank you for your recent feedback in regards to your recent stay with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for all of the many issues you faced with us during your stay in your bedroom and with our staff. Please be assured that this is not up to our usual standards, and that these matters will be investigated further.  We have also shared all of this feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure that these were isolated issues which are corrected moving forward.   We are also eagerly awaiting a refurbishment which should hopefully commence towards the end of this year.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.    Sincerely,  Heidi Mobbs  Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: I visited with recently with two friends.  The underground car park is very convenient and not overly expensive for city centre. I felt confident leaving my car there.  It's really well located, very short walk to the docks, shops and restaurants,    The reception staff were really welcoming, knowledgable and pleasant. We were made to feel welcome from the off.  The public rooms are very grand and well kept.  The pool is small and in a basement, but very nicely presented. Biggest jacuzzi I have ever seen.  I feel the rooms and bathrooms are a little tired but they are clean and super large and quiet. The biscuits were the best I've ever had in a hotel. The beds were really comfortable and it was really dark, so we got a brilliant nights sleep.    I would definitely stay again

﻿"I have heard lots about the Marriott Spa in Central Bristol . I decided to see what all the raving was about seeing as my local gym have closed our pool ( crying ) .  £15  entrance fee with no time limit gets a thumbs up   Staff on reception : very helpful  Changing Rooms : Too small not very clean and needs updating not impressed   Pool : On first view its got that ""Roman Spa "" look but its pretty shabby in a lot of areas
Image: hardly better than a public pool with familes and young children splashing around and sharing the poorly buiilt Jacuzzi  Sauna's : About standard as Sauna's go nothing to be awe inspired by .   Public seating areas around the pool : Dirty unkept   Parking : Free if using the Hotel  Ease of parking : Very good   Location of Hotel : Pretty much perfect bang"
Response from hotel staff: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Comments: Olde world charm in this historic hotel. Comfortable and spacious room and good facilities. Travelling on business so my needs were few but this did fit the bill and, located next to Bristol Cathedral, gave plenty of opportunity for walking to see the sights.

AMAZING STAFF, so welcoming, helpful and polite. we also loved the food, the best steaks we've had in a long time, fabulous breakfast too. our room was clean and functional. we had a weekend of shopping, so the location was perfect. the only thing we found was the room got incredibly hot during the night, we had the air con on but it is quite noisy. certainly did not ruin our stay, next time we will stay longer so we can enjoy the leisure facilities too.

The hotel is very nice and the staff are extremely welcoming and polite.  There is a great Tea & Coffee room here which is very relaxing. They also have a restaurant and a bar I isn't go to either of them but they did look pleasant enough.  My room was ready as soon as I arrived which was about 4 hours early so I was massively impressed with this, the room it's self was clean and had everything you could need.  My only negative was that on departing I had to pay a £16 pound (daily) charge for using the hotel carpark.

Opulent olden times hotel which retains many original features.  I loved the furnishings, decor and space. However, my  original room a "deluxe double" had nothing deluxe about it!  Correction it did have a beautifully comfortable Hypnos bed but carpets and furnishings were worn and stained.  Housekeeping standards are well below standard - dust everywhere etc,etc. Problems with a noisy room over Easter weekend and complete lack of wifi connectivity spoiled my weekend. Staff on the other hand were 5* who tried to resolve my problems. In particular Andréa, front of house and Seban Voda, night manager who afforded me a complementary suite for my final day, with a late checkout.  That was lovely! Breakfast was amazing - lots of quality choice and service; equally the light bites
Date of Review: Ann F wrote a review Apr 2017
Comment Title: Wonderful staff, good location, beautiful old-time hotel which is a bit ragged around the edges

Comments: I have stayed here quite a lot over the past few years and I stayed June 2016 and then early April 2017. My June stay was problematic despite many prior calls and emails and arrangements being made on the type of room (as we were staying for 10 days+ with 2 infants) but they did help us fix things eventually...after 4 room changes! April 2017 - just here for 2-3 nights for business and it was fine. The room was clean and decent size for one person. The room was not feather free - this is on my Platinum account and I had called the week prior and the day prior but it still had not been taken care of. I had to wait for housekeeping to come and completely re-do the room.  There is no excuse good enough for this not being prepared - I had booked through my account, my preferences
Date of Review: Abbie T wrote a review Apr 2017
Comment Title: A decent stay but needs a little TLC
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 21 Apr 2017
Response comment: Dear Abbie T  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We strive to provide an exceptional service for our guests and it saddens me to hear that we have fallen short of our goal on this occasion. Please accept my sincere apologies that your preference for a feather free room was overlooked. I have passed on your feedback to the relevant department to ensure this was an isolated issue.   Thank you also for your feedback on the Hotel, all feedback is greatly appreciated so we are able to make the necessary changes to improve our guests experience. We are currently busy planning a refurbishment for the Hotel which we are looking forward to beginning hopefully later this year.   When you return to Bristol we would love the opportunity to improve your experience with us.  Kind Regard  Felicity Walters

Comments: Poor coffee and fruit juice at breakfast and a bid of a crush for the food spoiled my experience. Could have done much better at Cafe Nero for half the price.  We were given a room at 1400 but our friends who arrived at 1600 had to wait. Nive room
Date of Review: John P wrote a review Apr 2017
Comment Title: Nice room and helpful staff - forget the brekfast

Comments: You sense the former grandeur of rich Victorian mercantile Bristol wealth as soon as you see the statue of Queen Victoria immediately outside the hotel. Perhaps not the best 'fit' for the Marriott brand. Nevertheless they have kept some of the original fittings in public areas and in the bedrooms: old style victorian taps and mirrored wardrobes for instance. The room and bathroom were spacious and the bed comfortable. In room facilities were at a 4 star standard. Breakfast was very good with lots of service staff at what was a very busy Easter weekend. Checking in and out was problem free with a reception that was also very well staffed. The location on College Green next to the cathedral was very convenient for exploring central Bristol on foot. We enjoyed our 3 night Easter
Date of Review: Mike E wrote a review Apr 2017
Comment Title: A former Victorian hotel in the heart of Bristol

Comments: This has been a disappointing visit for a night away with my spouse.  I am a regular Marriott user and have come to expect a decent standard when it comes to rooms, facilities and service.  The staff at the hotel is pleasant and helpful, but the hotel is in desperate need of investment and upgrade.  Carpets are worn, furniture is stained and bathrooms are very dated (e.g., sinks do not have mixer taps).  Upon complaining, we were upgraded (a kind gesture by the hotel), but if you come expecting a hotel with modern rooms that are comfortable and nicely decorated, then do not stay here.  I have also written to Marriott Rewards about this, especially for the price of the room.
Comment Title: Very tired property not up to Marriott standards
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 18 Apr 2017
Response comment: Dear LotsOfTravelLondo,   Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with an exceptional experience and I am glad to hear our staff service did met your expectations during this stay. Please accept my sincere apologies however for the décor of the Hotel letting your experience down.  As you may know we are busy planning a refurbishment for the Hotel and we are looking forward to work beginning on this hopefully in the next year. This should hopefully provide a space which is up to our usual high standards that meets the needs of valued guests, like yourself.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during this recent stay, I hope you will consider the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel should your travels ever bring you back to Bristol.  Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor Heidi.mobbs@marriotthotels.com

Comments: Reception staff were very welcoming and efficient. The room on the floor (with a very efficient lift) was quiet with an interesting view over the Floating Harbour and beyond. There was only one easy chair although there was plenty of room for another - that seemed a bit mean in a room billed as 'luxury'.  The bathroom was disappointing. Not only was the sink set into the top which made it difficult to use (a not uncommon fault) but someone thought it a bright idea to mount the towel rail in front of it, making it even more awkward to lean over to reach the sink. This is just bad design.  The Royal is very convenient for the city centre, especially as we were eating at Casamia, just a pleasant walk away, and going to a lunchtime concert at the Colston Hall, equally close. It's

We stayed here as part of a hen party booking. The hotel was clean, tidy & staff were helpful. The location is great for a night out, would definitely stay here again, but as a couple rather than 4 people sharing a room with 2 double beds, rather cosy if you don't know everyone in your group!

Firstly I would like to say as soon as we arrived we were met by pleasant staff in reception, informed of all on offer and directed to our room just passed the lifts on ground level. Room was nice nice bathroom and the bed seemed nice and comfortable. We went for a walk around in the afternoon and returned to make use of the leisure facilities. The changing room for males looked very tired and a lot of the lockers did not look as thou they were working. Pool is nice as is the sauna and steam room. I did not use the bar so can't comment. The breakfast was ok nice and pleasant staff again here. Does get very busy but that's ok. My only complaint would be the interior of the hotel I.e carpets and paint all looks very tired and in need of updating the pattern in the middle of the

Nice hotel, maybe a little old fashioned for some. Staff helpful and friendly. Car park was full when we arrived so parked at Millennium Car Park about 400m away at a cost of £16 for 24hours less than half the price advertised for using the hotel car park. Delays checking in, only 2 staff at check in desk at 6pm on a Friday. Rooms large and comfortable with free wifi. Hotel is in a good location although road noise through the night can be heard but not unusual for town centre location. Would stay here again.

Having grown up in Bristol, I always wanted to stay at the Royal hotel which always seemed the epitome of a 'posh' hotel to me. I finally got round to staying for a night at age 60, and actually I wasn’t disappointed. The hotel is well appointed, with good facilities and spacious well -equipped rooms with comfy beds. I certainly enjoyed a very good night’s sleep. Yes, it’s a chain hotel, but the staff were friendly and helpful and our stay was most enjoyable. I would certainly stay there again.
Comment Title: A good night's sleep in the heart of Bristol

Comments: We had a lovely weekend at this hotel.  The room overlooked a courtyard and was very quiet.  The bed was super comfortable.  The room wasn't huge but big enough.  The bathroom was a bit tired but everything worked.  We had the room service breakfast which was great quality.  We had a nightcap in the bar on one evening, very disappointed with their selection of port, just one!  Come on Marriott!

We have  stayed several times in this hotel as it is beautifully sited close to both the Cathedral and the harbour, which makes it easy to walk to several places of interest.  There is parking on site, which costs £16 per day for residents and is well worth it.   The staff are well trained, helpful and friendly, and give the impression that nothing is too much trouble.
Date of Review: Julie A wrote a review Apr 2017

Comments: This hotel must have one of the best locations in Bristol for tourists.  Right by the harbour.  Next to the Cathederal.  Close to plenty of restaurants and quirky independent shops. It's walking distance to all the sights and minutes from the tourist open top bus stop and the airport bus stop.  My two friends and I loved everything about it, from the impressive public areas, to the comfortable rooms, the lovely pool and spa and the delicious breakfasts.  The staff were charming and helpful. We left feeling very pampered after our weekend at the Marriott and all plan to return.
Date of Review: Susan R wrote a review Apr 2017

Comments: Parking very easy and secure (I think £16 per night although we only paid £8??). Hotel staff all very friendly and polite. Rooms very well appointed and clean. Pool is a reasonable size with a pleasant jacuzzi. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are plenty of good places to eat nearby (e.g. Sergio...very well recommended), for both evening and breakfast eats. Bar prices very reasonable given the good standard of hotel although if pushed for cash, a Tesco express is over the road.  The hotel is smack-bang in the middle of the City, so everything is accessible and convenient....might provide a problem if on the front of the hotel given a busy City centre is outside the window however, from my internal-facing room I slept well (but always do).  Overall, great hotel with brilliant
Date of Review: Rob W wrote a review Apr 2017
Comment Title: Great location, impressive building; clean with friendly staff and good facilities.

Comments: This is my 7th stay in this Hotel ...we always stay here when we see a show or watch a band . Close to all amenities and always the same , lovely staff . Clean comfortable rooms .lovely breakfast. Would recommend  to anyone . Five stars 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Date of Review: Caroline K wrote a review Apr 2017

Comments: Held a formal dinner in palm court. Excellent venue with character. Food was delicious and the evening flowed without a hitch. All staff were professional and friendly. In the planning process the communication was excellent
Comment Title: Organised a formal dinner for 60 people

Comments: We stayed at the Marriott on Saturday 8th. The room was fine, but the bathroom looked "tired". We paid for breakfast which was not cheap. When my wife asked for a cappuccino coffee at breakfast we were told it would be an additional £1.50. Taking the mickey I feel! I expect I had missed it, but though parking was included in room price. No, it was an extra £16.00 for the night. Keep this in mind when booking. Very good location for the attractions.
Date of Review: STEVE D wrote a review Apr 2017
Response from hotel staff:

Responded 13 Apr 2017

Please accept our sincere apology for the issues you occurred during your stay. We have shared your feedback with the Engineering, restaurant and bar teams to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.
