Sincerely, Ashley Cruickshank Front Office Manager Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel Ashley.cruickshank@marriotthotels.com 01179255100

Comments: We booked one of the superior suites and wasn't disappointed. The top floor suites are magnificent. Originally we were booked at road level, but found despite sound proofing it was still too noisy.  We have stayed here 5 times now, every time we visit Bristol and never feel the need to look for accommodation anywhere else.
Date of Review: Helen S wrote a review Apr 2017

Comments: Lovely hotel! Gorgeous inside. Bed very comfortable though wanted another blanket and wasn't one in the room. Breakfast was first class - just wish I could have eaten more! Location is wonderful if you are wanting to experience some bristol nightlife. Would happily return.  Only negative the parking was a nightmare. Had to drive round the one way system - out the exit and back again at least half a dozen times! Couldn't find a space and building works / scaffolding etc taking up lots of spaces. Someone has actually parked in front of a fire escape - Not ideal.

Fabulous hotel great food and staff Well kept and maintained for an old hotel great location, breakfast was really good and the breakfast staff were so helpful  I must compliment Silvia on reception was was extremely helpful with a lost item, I will definitely be coming back excellent hotel
Date of Review: Travel for events wrote a review Apr 2017

Comments: A nice-ish hotel, but our room was fairly cramped (it was listed as a deluxe room) and for the price we paid, absolutely not value for money. We paid just under £400 for three nights, and had booked well in advance, so because of this we were a little disappointed. The decor is nice, but a bit "tired" looking. On arrival we were informed that on top of the c.£400 room fee and the £48 to park for three nights, we would also be changed a £150 fee for "extras", such as room service or the mini-bar, meaning our three night getaway was quickly turning into near £1000 blowout. We were a little taken aback, and insisted that the fee be removed as we knew we wouldn't be ordering from room service or using the mini-bar. A poor show, really.
Date of Review: Rory E wrote a review Apr 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 11 Apr 2017
Response comment: Good Morning Rory E,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay with the us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with an exceptional service and I am disappointed to hear that were did not meet our goal on this occasion.   Please accept my sincere apologies that the standard of the Hotel did not meet your expectations. We are busy planning a refurbishment for the Hotel which we are looking forward to beginning hopefully later this year. Thank you also for the feedback regarding the payment for extras. This is optional unless you are paying with cash and is offered for your convenience so you are able to charge things back to the room. I am very sorry if this was not explained to you properly during check in.   All feedback is highly appreciated so we are able to provide our guests with the best experience moving forward. Should your travels bring you back to Bristol we would like the opportunity to improve you experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters

Comments: It's a nice hotel, never we were disrupted several times through the night with 20-somethings partying or being QUITE LOUD. If you're looking for a quiet stay, request it at check-in. I will say that the management was very apologetic and comp'd our breakfast which we had prepaid. They brought juice, lattes and pastries to our room and did all they could do to make up for our sleepless night. For that reason I'm giving this hotel 4-stars. Great customer service goes a long ways to make up for unsatisfactory conditions.

We stayed here ready for the new year celebrations. Perfect position for Bristol, comfortable rooms, fantastic breakfast, would Definatley stay here again. The hotel is situated right near the watershed where all the bars and restaurants are on hand visit Zara bazar for an eat all you like buffet, brilliant!

This is a beautiful hotel and does appear very grand. Sadly if you look beneath the surface it is a little faded. The staff are great the food is good but the interior could do with a little upgrading. Was a regular visitor to this hotel when working in Bristol and the hotel was very shiny and new, I do think it is time it had some new fittings. Breakfast was a great, with plenty of choice. The other down side is there was no fridge in  the room. We were given a picnic fridge it made noise all night and was so small we would not get our bottled water inside.
Comment Title: Beautiful Hotel, very central but a little faded.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 5 Apr 2017
Response comment: Dear Templarhouse  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We pride ourselves on providing our guests with an exceptional experience and I am glad to hear that on most areas you enjoyed your stay. Please accept my sincere apologies however for the décor of the Hotel letting your experience down.  We are busy planning a refurbishment for the Hotel and we are looking forward to work beginning on this hopefully in the next year.   Should your travels bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity to better your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters

Comments: Hotel itself was in a beautiful building, the interior was complimentary for the architecture.  The staff were incredible polite and helpful, and the room itself was very well presented, comfortable and quiet.  I would highly recommend for a visit to the city as it is easily accessible to the centre, including bars and restaurants.
Comment Title: Ideal location, beautiful hotel with excellent staff & facilities

Comments: Attended on a Saturday afternoon with 17 females as part of a Hen Party. Staff were very attentive and polite. The setting of the room was fabulous. Gorgeous lighting and carved statues, made you feel you were somewhere quite special. Nothing negative to say. Generally everything was ..... fine. However, I felt what we got was overpriced. Small glass of fizzy, one coffee, 3 finger sandwiches, 2 scones and 3 bite size cakes. This cost £27 each including a service charge that was automatically included. All I'm saying is, there are other large outlets and hotels that offer a better selection for less money. In my opinion the ladies would have preferred more savoury items and less cakes.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Assistant Restaurant & Bars Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 7 Apr 2017
Response comment: Dear Fliptop2009     Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent afternoon tea experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. As we strive to provide our guests with the best experience possible it saddens me to hear that we fell short of our goal on this occasion.      We appreciate the detail of your feedback and will share it with the rest of our team.   Should your travels ever bring you back to the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel we would love the opportunity to better your experience with us.   Kind Regards  Sophie Boyd

Comments: Bristol has two Marriott hotels, and although the Marriott Bristol Royal doesn't have a lounge, it is a very nice hotel just off the city centre and close to both shopping and restaurants. Located at College Green, it is a good location to explore the old parts of the city. Whilst the property is a little old the rooms are nice and big and sometimes a little quirky in a good way. They have a decent gym with a good selection of equipment and machines although it cramped in a small place. The leisure club also has a pool and a jacuzzi and a set of beach chairs around the pool area.  The bars and the drawing rooms are nice and has plenty of space. The restaurant is spacious with a good variety of dishes and the breakfast is extensive. The staff and the service is great and as a
Comment Title: A good hotel for exploring the old town

Comments: We enjoyed this hotel for its character and charm. Some of the soft furnishing and decoration needs updating and a fresh coat of paint. But we enjoyed our stay in a large family room with two double beds and a nice sized bathroom. Great central location with an underground car park but at an extra £16 per night. Ouch !
Date of Review: David A wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: The building is simply lovely.  It's Old but beautifully preserved and perfectly situated near to the centre of town.   The rooms are large and well appointed (although plugs near the bed would be good for laptops!) The pool and gym facilities are great, and sadly underused. By FAR the best point was the staff. From reception to the bars and restaurant and the guys in smart red coats waiting to help in reception: all were professional and helpful.  It felt like being in a hotel from the 19th century, being treated like someone 'special' when you walk in the door.  I loved it!

As pretty much all Marriotts the building can easily impress you. Lots of character and many places to explore.   The room we've stayed was quite big (you could fit 3 double beds in it... Not much furniture tho! Also a little dated... but nothing that bad. If you're looking for a room to make you speechless that's not the hotel for you.   It's in a good location and prices are ok also.   Recommend for a short stay.
Date of Review: To N wrote a review Mar 2017
Comment Title: Big room but a bit dated
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Ashley C, Front Office Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 29 Mar 2017
Response comment: Dear To N  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We are currently planning a refurbishment for the hotel which we are looking forward to starting hopefully later this year.   Should your travels ever bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity to better your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Ashley Cruickshank

Comments: My first experience of the hotel was the booking process. I booked with a 'pre-paid' rate...stupidly thinking that's that. Just check in online and toddle up to room..NO. Apparently not. I had to pay on the day. This was unexpected and ruined the start of my stay.  The room itself was large but dated. There wasn't a fridge or decent pillows. Two flat pieces of material! For a 4 star hotel it was disappointing..for the money I've had much better.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 25 Mar 2017
Response comment: Dear Lisa2108  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. As we strive to provide our guests with the best experience possible it saddens me to hear that we fell short of our goal on this occasion.   I believe you have already been in contact with the hotel regarding the payment for your reservation, however I would once again like to express my most sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused.   We are currently planning a refurbishment for the hotel which we are looking forward to starting hopefully later this year.   Should your travels ever bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity to better your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters

Comments: We have stayed here a few times now and always enjoy it. We upgraded our room this time to a junior suite which was beautifully light and airy with 5 arched windows and plenty of space. I will definitely request this room again. We were greeted by Andrea on reception (who I had previously spoken to on the phone). She was very pleasant, welcoming and helpful. I wish all reception staff were like her then we wouldn't have any misunderstandings or problems. This hotel is in a good position for walking by the river, to Clifton (if you are fit) or back into town for shopping. We look forward to returning soon.
Date of Review: Tracey B wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: Beautiful hotel, loved our stay here. The facilities were great, as was the food. Some of the staff let it down, service wasn't always great but would return for the great location and the other positives.

We have just spent two nights at this large hotel , convenient for Bristol's many attractions. There is a large underground car park, quite expensive at £17 per night, but at least you know your car is safely parked. I previously stayed here twenty years ago for a professional conference, and the hotel seemed very familiar, with spacious public areas. Unfortunately, in the bar and reception area there is non descript but rather unpleasant music playing. Lighting in the bar was too dim to read by, in the evening, which combined with the unpleasant music, drove me back to my room, which was quite comfortable. The room had a footstool you could position by one of the chairs, a restful facility. However, the mattress was very hard, and before the second night we went to reception,

I stayed one night in March 2017 when visiting a friend. The hotel is a 15 min walk from the station and easy to find. It's in a great location for shops and restaurants and even the water and the Acquarium, and it's next to the Cathedral and, of course, College Green grassy area. Lovely... The welcome was warm, the room was large and clean and had everything one could want. I went to the spa and it was a little more dingy than I expected, but pretty enough with its Victorian feel. The ladies showers in the changing room were a bit mouldy and need a really good power clean and bleach all over. I enjoyed the pool and steam room and sauna very much. Bed superbly comfy, room quiet, great night's sleep. Down to brekki at 9am and I felt the food wasn't very well laid out. I couldn't
Comment Title: Great place to stay in Bristol - lovely staff, perfect location

Comments: I had high expectations of my stay at the marriot royal which sadly weren't quite met. I'll start with the good though.       Breakfast is excellent, truly the best I've ever had in a hotel . The choice available is incredible and there's plenty of staff on hand.    The location is perfect , right in the heart of the city and in easy walking distance to most attractions and shops.   The hotel is clean and professional.    But...  On arrival we were offered a choice of rooms on many floors and asked to make a choice but the chap on reception couldn't give me any reason to choose any particular one so I asked him to give us the best room available with a view if possible.  He said no problem sir  and put us in a room that was noisy all through the night with a view of.....a wall!!

Had such a lovely stay at the Marriot Royal. I booked several rooms for myself and friends for a hen party in Bristol. The staff were brilliant and friendly!  They even left a complimentary bottle of prosecco on ice. The finishes touches were thoughtful and really impressed the bride.  We would definitly recommend this hotel and would stay again next time I'm in Bristol.

Lovely room and bath - plenty of room and had everything including bottled water and iron and ironing board so very comfortable.  Was a bit cold in the night.  Hotel difficulty to get to as roadworks nearby and in town and underground car park was claustrophobic and difficult to work out exit - I had to be rescued from tunnel when trying to leave!
Date of Review: Vicki H wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: As a frequent traveller and staying in many Marriott hotels I amassed enough points for a subsidised stay. However when staying at this particular hotel for pleasure I was greeted with a room which needed a good clean and dust and in check out staff who just didn't care! I was advised on checking in that the room I was planned to have would be noisy so they moved me to a smaller room without any additional perks in the hope I would sleep better. When entering the room it was dusty and then when going to sleep in the evening it was so noisy it was ridiculous. Explaining this to the concierge team in the morning the complaint wasn't acknowledged!!! Due to not wanting to make a scene I left and now find myself posting this review I rarely do As I don't feel this should go
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Mar 2017
Response comment: Hello Mr Cornish,  Thank you for your feedback, we have responded to you accordingly through the customer care channel you used earlier this week.

Comments: Excellent location right in the heart of the city. Car park attached ( fee £12 for stay). Staff very friendly and professional. Sat in the bar and enjoyed lunch - all freshly made  (recommend the club sandwich and nachos). The room was spacious and the bathroom luxurious. More freshly cooked food at breakfast. Looking forward to revisiting soon!

I visited this hotel on 11/03/2017 with my two daughters.  We had treatments in the Spa which were lovely then had afternoon tea in the drawing room of the hotel.  My daughters are both pregnant and therefore needed to request alternative fillings for the sandwiches, are request was met positively and nothing was too much trouble.  The member of staff who took our order also agreed to take a photograph of us. We were well looked after and as we had booked the latest slot for the afternoon tea were able to relax and stay at our table for as long as we wanted. Thank you to all the staff who dealt with us on Saturday, everyone did a great job, very friendly, helpful and professional.

Hotel generally ok. Upgraded to premium room. Nice view of city. Beds amazing but room slightly old fashioned and bathroom poor in every way. Would not return because of this. Expensive compared to many other better hotels I have previously stayed in Bristol.
Date of Review: Martin C wrote a review Mar 2017
Comment Title: Good hotel but not as good as expected
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 14 Mar 2017
Response comment: Hello Martin,  Thank you for taking the time to provide your valuable feedback, we were very sorry to learn that the hotel had not met your expectations in particular with the bathroom, we do hope this is not deter you from continuing to use the Marriott group.

Comments: We stayed for one night. The room was clean, and a good size. The hotel is in an excellent location, and staff were pleasant. Did not have breakfast, as there are many cheaper and delicious offerings in Bristol center.

Building looks great, the whole of the inside decor and room decor is dated. Looks a bit like a 90's hotel. I had a junior suite and there was lots of yellow/beige colours, old TV's (but they did work and had sky sports which is nice) but bed was very comfy. The air con worked very well. I quite liked the bathroom - a bit dated again but lots of marble. Shower was powerful and hot. In room breakfast was mediocre, hot but not very tasty.   I was there on a Saturday night, on the third floor. Saturday night + Bristol city centre = noise. Lots of it.. until about 2am. Luckily I'm a heavy sleeper and was fine. But location is perfectly central, near lots of restaurants and bars. Internet was very fast too. The view outside my room was scaffolding - but I'm sure for others it was
Date of Review: Matthew P wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: Great hotel, really made my birthday special, from the upgraded room, then complimentary drinks in the bar and a bottle of Merlot brought to the room. 😊All the staff were really helpfull, especially Front Office & dining room staff. Would love to stay there again.
Date of Review: Jenny T wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: We stayed here for a charity ball event where we met up with friends. The hotel has a really friendly atmosphere and is generally very good, but the rooms, particularly the bathrooms are looking a bit tired.  I feel guilty saying that, but i spend a lot of time in Marriott hotels, and am used to better standards.  They have a great bar and breakfast is fantastic.  The food they prepared for our ball was also really good.  We will stay here again.
Date of Review: M C wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: We have stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times, although the last time was probably at least 3 years ago. There have been some changes. The old restaurant has gone and replaced with a larger, but tastefully decorated restaurant. Also used for breakfast. It's a shame about the old restaurant, because the food was amazing, the new menu looks like quite ordinary food. We didn't eat a meal there. The old bar area has also gone, the space not being used for anything which seems strange. The new bar is too small for the size of the hotel and the amount of people staying. We had to literally fight our way to the bar, because rather ridiculously, a private function was being hosted in the hotel, and instead of directing guests to a function room with private facilities, they were
Date of Review: Karen C wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: Beautiful building, quite tardis-like, with a grand stone entrance slightly marred by smokers.  Very impressed with the staff, they were all very friendly and helpful.  Our basement bedroom was large enough, a little tired but the bed was comfortable and no sounds from other rooms.   Breakfast was a buffet with an extensive range of different hot and cold food. We were shown to a table in the breakfast-room extension in the most beautiful 'ballroom' which is apparently the oldest part of the hotel.   A lovely hotel with old fashioned charm.
Comment Title: Lovely old building, friendly staff, room tired

Comments: We stayed for one night on Sat 4th March and are both incredibly happy with the experience. We expected it to be good but were especially impressed with the level of friendliness of the staff who were attentive and welcoming throughout our visit. The room was very large and exceptionally clean. The decor was tasteful and had nice features which added to it. We did both admit that the carpets in the landings could maybe do with updating and a couple of areas might need touching up. We also wondered by you are not given free parking as guests - seems a bit mean to us. Other than that, a brilliant place to stay. The highlight was the breakfast. We have stayed in many four star hotels and expected a good continental breakfast. Good it was not - outstanding it was. The food was of

Had a lovely weekend away to see Chiity Chitty Bang Bang at the Bristol Hippodrome, amazing show, stayed at the Royal Marriott Hotel, amazing place full of character, enjoyed it so much stayed another night, breakfast was huge and so was the room, pool looked lovely and the staff were all pleasant and helpful, on site parking which was a bonus and loads to do down by the water, casino, restaurants plenty, all in all a wonderful weekend away
Date of Review: Tracy E wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: We stayed overnight after a theatre visit. Before the theatre it was difficult to get drinks as the bar was so busy. After the theatre the same applied. A poor menu and indifferent food. Lack of adequate staff appeared to be one of the reasons for the very slow service. If you are disabled and arrive by car there appears to be only 2 disabled bays near the hotel entrance and you have to pay for the the privilege. On checking out £4.99 had been added to our bill with no explanation from the hotel to whom we complained. Never again!

booked hotel after booking a show at the hippodrome due to location,5 mins walk to hippodrome and waterfront/ss great Britain and aquarium-so seemed perfect.booked in a rush so didn't really look at reviews.wife noted a few days later that hotel did have a few bad ones so we were a little worried.weekend away was last weekend of feb-everything was really good. clean/tidy room in good state of repair,staff very attentive polite and helpful.food and drinks of good standard/variety.everything you could want/need at breakfast. all good-nothing to worry about.enjoyed our stay immensely-would definitely stay again and recommend.
Date of Review: antony r wrote a review Mar 2017

Comments: This hotel has a lot of good things going for it.  The location is great, it has lots of facilities and the staff are lovely.  I received a warm welcome and great service throughout my 2-night stay.  Every part of the hotel I visited was spotlessly clean and well-maintained.  The only down-side is that, like so many hotels, the property is in need of major refurbishment.  Everything looks a bit faded and dated, but thanks to the staff it still has charm, and it delivers great value for money.
Date of Review: Kate H wrote a review Mar 2017
Comment Title: Fantastic service and a great location - just a bit faded

Comments: My wife and I stayed at the "Marriott Royal" back in October as a getaway from everything and a treat night away. The Hotel is in a great location (as are so many hotels in Bristol). The cleanliness of the room was dreadful. Pubic hairs in the bed and bath, also what appeared to be hair dye on the clean towels.The all inclusive buffet breakfast was great but we would never stay at this hotel again, because of its poor hygiene and lack of customer service, when the subject was broached with the complaints department after my visit.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 1 Mar 2017
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel with us.   As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your guestroom fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team in an effort to improve our service.

Comments: We had booked for a party of seven to attend afternoon tea at The Marriott. We've been before and as it was two party members birthday, we thought we'd book again!   We arrived at 1:15 for a 1:30 booking so we had plenty of time to get a drink and sort ourselves out before being called to our table.   We were waiting in the bar area for approximately 25-30 minutes and we were still sat there at ten two. We enquired twice during this time but both times were advised we would be taken to the table shortly.   The table was reserved and had already been made up in the other room but we were not sent through until much later.   Once we were sat at our table, we were not asked for our tea orders and it took 40 minutes before one of the bar staff came over to take our tea orders, but
Date of Review: Lucy H wrote a review Feb 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 24 Feb 2017
Response comment: Good Afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent Afternoon Tea at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We highly appreciate all feedback as it will help us to improve our service moving forwards. Your friend Rebecca is already in contact with the General Managers PA about your experience but I would also like to extend my sincere apologies for the experience you had as this is not the usual standard we like to provide.   I hope you will be open to allowing us to improve your experience with us in the future.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters

Comments: I booked the Royal Suite in this hotel as a very special occasion for myself and my girlfriend which was supposed to end with me proposing to her after spending a romantic night together, unfortunately what we experience rather killed the mood.  Upon arriving to the room, I was first greeted with a beautiful, spacious suite with fantastic views, however, on closer inspection we found that the cleaners must have been on strike in between the previous occupants and ourselves.  Dust on the surfaces, an old champagne cork in the middle of the room and a tv remote control that had been repaired with a sticking plaster didn't immediately convey the luxury advertised on the website.   To be honest, I could live with that, but when we went into the bathroom we were greeted with a level

I love this hotel the 2nd time here now,  they cannot do enough for you..stunning hotel.. spa Jacuzzi swimming pool.. amazing rooms are so clean an tidy.. beds are so comfy,can't wait to come back again, it's an amazing location also
Date of Review: helen d wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: The hotel is perfectly situated on college green along side the cathedral and the harbour side are a 2 minute walk away.  The public areas and lounges are luxurious, warm and welcoming.  We didn't have a view from our room but the room itself was really spacious and well equipped. The highlight for me was the lovely Grecian style pool area and the fantastic gym. Great range of equipment, friendly helpful staff. It was a real treat.  The Buffet breakfast was excellent. Huge selection of food which was all delicious and even though it was busy the staff were friendly and efficient.  We will definitely be returning, can't wait!!

We cannot speak highly enough of the staff at the Royal Marriot. Every re3quest we made was considered; Early check in, high floor, room away form the lifts, the storage of bags following check out to enable us to enjoy our day shopping, we had no complaint and enjoyed our one night stay immensely.  The rooms were clean, well presented and modern (the shower was warm and welcoming - a must in any hotel!) and although the Wi-FI was pretty pedestrian, we didn't book into the Hotel to surf the 'net so have no complaint there!  Breakfast was plentiful and there was a huge choice from continental to full English although I do enjoy a piping hot English breakfast and am still searching for that elusive wonder.  All in all it was a an enjoyable stay and we'd definitely consider a

I chose this hotel because it looked like it was good, in reality it was very tired. The furniture was undersized for the rooms and it was all very unimpressive. How it warrants 4 stars is beyond comprehension!
Date of Review: Matt Bird wrote a review Feb 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 19 Feb 2017
Response comment: Hello Matt,  We were very sorry to learn that the hotel did not meet your expectations, however, thankful for your valuable feedback, which will be shared.

Comments: The Marriott Royal si the perfect hotel for business or leisure travel. It is ideally located in Bristol, close to all of the restaurants, nightlife and attractions. The hotel is superbly maintained and has lots of rich history.

Beautiful property centrally located within walking distance of everything we needed in Bristol. Rooms were spacious and staff were very helpful.  Lobby and drawing room were particularly lovely with a tea and cocktail menu. Would happily visit again.
Date of Review: Sinead F wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: I felt well looked after at this hotel, from the moment my partner and I arrived for his Birthday weekend the reception staff made us welcome and checked us in although we were very early.  Throughout our 2 night stay I could not fault any of the staff.  The room we had on the top floor had a great view of the river, it didn't bother me but was probably a little small for this price range.  It had everything necessary, good toiletries, in a well laid out bathroom, the bed was very comfortable.  The leisure suite was good we used the pool, a little cold for my other half but OK for swimming and we both enjoyed the jacuzzi which was a good size and warm.  We didn't use the parking at £16 a night it was around the same price as us going to Bristol by train.  The location is perfect
Comment Title: Good location and excellent friendly staff.

Comments: Just back from a night at this hotel. Lovely large quiet room on the ground floor. Comfortable bed and well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was ok but a buffet as is usual ; I really don't like buffets! Car parking in site which is a bonus in Bristol though you are charged £16 per 24 hours. I would stay here again when visiting the city

A nice old hotel which is exactly what it is a bit old if you look beneath the surface.  Had difficulty in the room trying to find a socket that would reach a mirror ! Woman's issue and if you sat at the table to do your makeup then your out of luck unless your 10 foot tall.  Don't get me wrong the hotel is fine but fine isn't what I want.  It is massive and we had the furthest away room imaginable but it was very very quiet until the pubs roll out then your in for a treat not that it bothers me but girls singing outside the bedroom window at 4.30 taking selfies and we were on the ground floor is not what I had in mind but they were harmless and having fun.  The hotel could not be situated better for town you are literally out the door and in town which was great for us.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Feb 2017
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback, we were pleased that you enjoyed the majority of your stay with us, even when challenged with outside noise and bedroom facilities.  We will pass on your breakfast comments onto Chef.

Comments: So refreshing to get a genuine helpful rather than plastic welcome at reception. Have now stayed twice at this hotel in the last 6 months and both times got a spacious room at a decent rate for Bristol. Attentive staff made the stay pleasant and gym was not very busy in the morning so again an enjoyable experience. Will definitely return next time I need to stay in Bristol.
Date of Review: Alan O wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: My wife and i had a one night stay at the Marriott Bristol last week for my wifes birthday. The room was very nice, the bed comfortable and received a very welcoming glass of wine while checking in. The staff are excellent and very friendly and the breakfast was very good. I made use of the pool and the sauna and hot tub, and was delighted that these were not in great demand, so plenty of space to spend a nice hour or so to myself. All in all, a very nice stay.
Date of Review: Gary L wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: Attending (and working at)  a 3 conference held at the Marriot.  Did not stay in a room there but the staff were very professional and helpful.   We used the whole conference suite, had buffet food (3 days) and  a formal dinner 1 night.  The buffets and snacks were first rate (always lots of fruit and healthy options)  and the several restaurant meals I have had there were also good.   Whilst the décor is classic "grand hotel" rather than modern it is well kept and clean.  The staff are efficient, helpful and cheerful. none of our "emergencies" phased them at all.      The only downside is the underground car park is small, difficult to park in due to concrete pillars and it is expensive.

Booked to stay here due to great location just off park street with great bars and pubs around . Hotel was a you expect excellent . Free complimentary wine on arrival and nice staff and good service . Food was good in the hotel as well and rooms were great . Definitely first choice when next in Bristol
Date of Review: Matt H wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: Disappointing.  Numerous issues with room-woken by noise from adjacent room, broken lamp, insufficient supplies in the room for the number of people.  When housekeeping were rung it took ages and several calls until issues were rectified.  Room was cold and no blankets available or pillows in the whole hotel. Leisure facilities were good but only 2 female showers available for this large hotel so queues at times. Also dated couches instead of heated granite ones. A partial reimbursement was offered but fell quite short in compensatory terms. Staff are kind and helpful and the food excellent.
Date of Review: Maxine M wrote a review Feb 2017
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 7 Feb 2017
Response comment: Good afternoon,  Thank you for providing us with your valuable feedback, we were very sorry to learn of the guest challenges you experienced during your recent stay, for which we apologise.  Be assured that your comments have been shared amongst the appropriate teams for their review and action.

Comments: Lovely old building warm welcome on arrival from reception staff. Room on second floor fairly large room kingsize bed very comfy good nites sleep. Again bathroom  was nice bath / shower which took a while to set water temperature. Fairly quite overnite all in most pleasant stay,

My family visited me in Bristol for one night and stayed in the Marriott (mainly for the spa). It is very fancy - in fact, I felt slightly underdressed just walking through the lobby. The room was average size and the beds were soooo comfy and a gorgeous bath room.. The spa was clean, tidy and again very fancy.  The breakfast was amazing- english / continental / fruit / pastries / smoothies / cereal etc. Although the stay was only for one night, I definitely enjoyed it and would like to stay again- it was gorgeous and is a great location (5/10 minute walk to cabot) however the fact it is at the bottom of Park Street (a road with a lot of restaurants/bars), you can hear the sirens going past every 10 minutes, which is a bit of a shame because you are spending a lot of money to
Date of Review: Hannah A wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: I feel compelled to write after an extremely disappointing visit yesterday afternoon/early evening.  We were a group of 8 ladies meeting up for a once yearly event catching up as old school friends.   We had toyed with our usual spa but this time fancied going for a champagne cream tea. There are several places to chose from in Bristol, but knowing the Marriott to be a so called decent 4 star hotel we chose to take our business there. We booked months in advance and as we were all coming from different areas of the UK arranged taxis, trains coaches etc to meet at the hotel.  To cut a very long (just under 4 hours to be precise) story short we could not have been more disappointed !  We were not greated, spoken to, acknowledged for half an hour. Then out our champagne was
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 7 Feb 2017
Response comment: Good afternoon,    Thank you for providing such detailed constructive feedback, we were truly sorry to learn of the catalogue of shortfalls you and your friend were challenged with during your recent visit to us, having planned a special afternoon tea celebration.  Be assured that your comments have been passed on to our Chef and Food/Beverage managed, they will of course be re evaluating some obvious training issues which you have identified.

Comments: Very good deal, very good room, very helpful staff and good breakfast. One night stay very helpful and considerate staff. Breakfast very early and swim before hand was really good to start along day. Lovely to swim early in the morning
Date of Review: Tim B wrote a review Feb 2017

Comments: Great hotel in a great location.   Room was very comfortable, clean and easily accommodated 2 adults and 2 children under 4. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming.   The pool (opening at 6am) was a goodsend when the children woke up early.  Breakfast was excellent and offered a huge variety to cater for all tastes.  We'll definitely be back

The exterior of the hotel is stunning and were already impressed upon the arrival. Front Desk staff was super friendly and warm, check in process was no pain and the lady provided all the information we need even without asking.   The hotel itself is perfectly located in the city centre and is definitely good value!
Comment Title: Attentive staff and such a good location

Comments: Great hotel located in central Bristol. A lot nicer than the usual Marriotts I have stayed in, this has a more upmarket feel to it. Check in was quick and easy and the staff were extremely friendly, professional and efficient. My room was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a little dated but spacious. The bath was a nice size so I could stretch out and relax after a long day! The in room service was very efficient and quick and the staff extremely friendly and can't do enough for you. I will definitely be back!

We stayed here for 1 night (a Saturday) whilst visiting Bristol.  There were plenty of staff manning reception when we arrived at 2:30 and they were friendly and efficient.  We had a family room (1109) and a double (1106).  Both were very comfortable, stylish, spacious and had clean bathrooms.  There was no noise worth talking about and so we slept well.  The full English breakfast was very good too with plenty of choice and, again, friendly staff.  We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Comment Title: Comfortable stay at a good hotel

Comments: We stayed here for 3 nights and each night at a different room. The rooms at this hotel are really "hit or miss".  1. Amazingly beautiful suit: round room, top floor, nice bathroom with a tub and shower, separate seating and dressing areas - but the room is facing a very popular night club with loud music and drunken patrons going through the night. One of the gorgeous windows could not be completely closed making room quite cold. The heater did not work. This room was the biggest disaster with no rest.  2. Another two rooms were very similar and looked like a typical American hotel rooms. They were very clean and amenities in the bathrooms were of quite good quality. The only difference was in stocking the rooms. Our first room had very nice selection of biscuits and teas while

Just got back from a nights stay for my mums birthday (28 th Jan) booked doing the free breakfast if you pay on your visa offer, which we had no problems with. Checked in with a wonderful girl called Andrea, she is a credit to the hotel, she had wine and a birthday card sent to our room for my mum which was so kind, everytime we came to reception she couldn't do enough to help. Sadly my mum lost her husband ( my stepdad) last year, so this was her first birthday without him, we wanted to make it special, and Andrea and the hotel really helped with that, so thank you, it's a really great hotel, it smelt lovely and had a great breakfast too!

Stayed 1 night , beautiful hotel , great room , stunning swimming pool , breakfast first class , good value for money and finally all the staff where excellent . Book now you won't be disappointed , well done Marriott

No instructions on website for finding underground carpark. Good instructions in the room though. Not sure who that helps. Anyway I don't usually stay at this sort of place - usually go for something more contemporary so not going to judge it on the marble, columns, busts of classical figures in the swimming pool (wtf) and oil paintings. If that's your thing enjoy. Anyway we try to check in but told someone else has already checked in under our name and then after much consulting of supervisor they hadn't and then the details on the check in form have someone else's address so by now getting a bit worried about who's bill we will get when we check out and what has been done with my data. Finally get to the room  - corridor carpets quite worn /decor a bit tired.  Room again a bit
Date of Review: Tim G wrote a review Jan 2017
Comment Title: Decent breakfast makes it three stars
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 25 Jan 2017
Response comment: Hello Tim, Thank you for taking the time to offer such valuable, detailed feedback.  We were sorry to learn of the challenges you experienced during your stay from point of check in and apologise for not meeting with your expectations.  Thank you for your kind comments regarding our breakfast offering.

Comments: We only live about 6miles away from this hotel but decided to stay the night after a visit to the ballet at the Bristol Hippodrome.    The reception staff are so efficient and pleasant which is such a good start to a hotel stay.  We were allocated a room on a high floor which faced Park Street as requested.  We were able to enjoy a swim in the pleasant indoor pool before a good buffet breakfast and agin the staff were excellent.  Check out was also efficient so we highly recommend this hotel for a stay in central Bristol.
Date of Review: Hazel p wrote a review Jan 2017

Comments: Great hotel.  Fantastic location , nice rooms and friendly reception staff.  However we ate as a group of 6 in the evening and the food was uninspired.  Whilst the menu read well the kitchen just didn't deliver.  Pretty tasteless, and after feedback to the waiting staff nothing was done.  When I mentioned I didn't eat the soup because it was bland and Luke warm the waiter just shrugged and said ' oh dear'.  I would have expected a visit from the maitre de at least to apologise and ensure our other food was satisfactory.  Shame that the hotel was let down.  Great breakfast !!
Date of Review: neal h wrote a review Jan 2017

Comments: 7 of us went for Christmas Day lunch, hotel lovely with beautiful surroundings, food was fabulous very tasteful lots of choice and good size portions and very good service from staff, parking free in the day. Would definitely go again next Christmas
Date of Review: Sarah W wrote a review Jan 2017

Comments: I had a special deal for 3 nights but couldn't alter the booking in any way, which was annoying.  The room was spacious with 2 Queen sized beds and well equipped with hairdryer, ironing board, kettle and toiletries. There is no fridge, which I expected at the prices, but apparently you can request one. In the bathroom, the sink doesn't have a mixer tap. Everything is decorated in a country house style - semi luxurious but unimaginative. The beds are moderately comfortable.   The breakfast in-room menu is a little confusing to fill out resulting in missing items - they rectified this immediately. Service is efficient and good.   The in room wifi (if you want anything decent) has an expensive daily charge. There are no plug outlets by the bed.   The leisure club has a beautiful

Visited here as my friend and I were visting the Bath Christmas markets but could not afford to stay in Bath.  This was about a 30 minute drive from Bath and was very lively for good dinner and drinks.   The hotel is in a great location for bars and restaurants and near to the bus stop should you need to take a bus to Bath if not driving.   The spa in the hotel was lovely however you have to pay for parking in the underground car park.  The room was nice and clean. The bath was very large but shower was awkwardly positioned so we avoided this to save not flooding the floor despite there being a shower curtain available. Bed was spacious and I had a good nights sleep  The hotel did have a function going on which was very loud however we were advised this would happen but didnt

We were  bought a over night stay at this wonderful hotel as a present. We were going to a show at the Hippodrome so this hotel being a two minute walk away was great. From the minute you walk through the door you were made to feel special. Our room was on the second floor and it had everything, from various teas and coffee to luxury towels and bedding. The bed was enormous and so soft! The room was very clean and had a iron, ironing board and hairdryer. You felt that nothing was too much trouble and the staff were happy to help. Breakfast was a buffet and the selection was vast. Sweet pastries, cereals, toast , and everything hot you could want, mushrooms, baked beans, tomatoes, hash brownies etc. We would highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to visit it again.

I was booked into this hotel and my bill is usually sent back to the company. The duty manager that night would not accept an email from my company email address authorising the bill back, even though i have stayed in this and their sister hotel, the City Centre Hotel over 400 times in the past 3 years. What's worse, she wouldn't even call the other hotel where I normally stay. I ended up calling myself and booked a room there for the night, with no problems at all.  To add insult to injury, the duty manager concerned told me I would be billed as a 'no show' for that night.  To cut a long story short, later that night one of the directors of the City centre hotel (who was informed by their reception) contacted a director at the Royal hotel and got the billing quashed.  Moral of
Comment Title: Rude manager, didn't bother to check-in
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 16 Jan 2017
Response comment: Dear RScott1960,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent experience with the Bristol Marriot Royal Hotel. We strive to provide our guests with a memorable experience, but unfortunately on this occasion we have fallen short of our goal. Our General Manager is hoping to make contact with you to discuss this issue further.   All feedback is highly appreciated so we may provide our guests with the best service possible moving forwards.   Kind Regards  Felicity Walters Guest Relations Manager

Comments: I stayed at this hotel for one night as I was going to the pantomime.  The staff were so polite and helpful on arrival, told me everything I needed to know and took an interest in my plans during my short stay.  Room was clean, large bath and comfy bed!

Been a while since I've used the Royal. Appears to have retained many of its qualities, with the rooms in particular a strength - clean, comfortable, roomy. Nice to see SKY available in the rooms, but spectacular own-goal of not providing free wifi for staying guests. Quite unusual these days, particularly at these prices, and a major downside for business users. Enough to make me reconsider and think about the Mercures in the city instead - which have free, excellent, wifi. Come on Marriott - this is poor. Breakfast only OK too - a good range, but coffee is like tar coloured treacle, and the 'hot' food is often in name only.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 10 Jan 2017
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to provider your valuable feedback following your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal hotel.  We were sorry to learn of your particular disappointment around wifi, and have passed on your comments with regard to the breakfast offering to our executive chef.  We appreciate your positive notes regarding the bedroom and Sky availability.  We do hope you will continue to return to the Royal.

Comments: I treated my 21 year old daughter and her boyfriend to a night at the hotel as a Christmas present. Along with a massage in the residential spa salon. She said the hotel and spa staff were very friendly and helpful.  The facilities of pool sauna and spa were lovely. The room was spacious and comfortable and spotlessly clean . It was not noisy despite being just a short walk to bars and restaurants. 20min walk to the shops was do-able. A perfect weekend trip .would definitely recommend.
Date of Review: Thea M wrote a review Jan 2017

Comments: Stayed in the Bristol Marriott Royal hotel with some friends for one night, quick efficient check in, lovely room with interconnecting door to friends in next room. Rooms were clean and spacious with tea/coffee facilities. Bathroom was also clean and roomy. Breakfast was buffet service with tea/ coffee being served to you. Plenty of breakfast choice. Central location to the harbour side and pubs and restaurants, lovely open park opposite hotel to sit and relax with a large cathedral next door to hotel wich looked pretty impressive. Would recommend and stay here again.
Date of Review: Carrie j wrote a review Jan 2017
Comment Title: Nice hotel central to harbour side.

Comments: Stayed recently and the stay overall was ok, room & hotel good, location good and food good. Real shame about hotel wifi. Issues with the guest wifi being temperamental sometimes worked sometimes didn't. Had to send some important documents so in the end went to the  lounge area to use the public one and still had issues. Finally got reception to agree to give me a business log in and this worked for a bit then that stopped working! Frustrating!
Comment Title: Ok overall but really poor wifi
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 7 Jan 2017
Response comment: Dear DJRDevon  Thank you for taking the time to complete a review regarding your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   I am very sorry to hear that you had such problems with our WiFi. We are looking into buying more routers to strengthen the internet around the hotel. Please accept my apologies that we were unable to find a suitable solution during your stay.  Should your travels bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity to improve your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters Guest Relations Manager

Comments: After a few days in this lovely hotel....super beds, lovely pillow selection and nice sheets. I love the old charm re done to feel the same as the old.  Staff is a bit of an issue here. Front desk seem a bit too busy to help you, a tad disorganized and not so savvy in english. Breakfast is a pricey affair, therefore should be top notch.  Nice buffet, but when i asked for an omelette, had to send it back, overcooked. First year student?  The cleaning staff for the rooms are amazing. Beautifully turned down beds with a chocolate every night is delightful. Its the small things that count! Also lots of extra toiletries!
Comment Title: A few days with my partner

Comments: Stayed for two nights , the late checkin staff was cooperative , room didn't have any water bottle and as it was late no could get for me , had to get some water for me & that was the only down part. Rest all fine , it's a classic hotel , rooms are classic too. Would like to stay again if at Bristol

We stayed here for one night. Although we didn't eat in the facilities looked great. I ordered champagne to be delivered to the room before we got back from dinner. This was all done in a timely manner. Staff are very friendly

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as we were watching a rugby match in Cardiff and it was a fairly easy commute into Cardiff on the train.  Room - the room was a decent size, nice comfy bed, a bottle of wine and chocs were left for us as well as it was a special anniversary trip - very nice touch! Could hear quite a lot of sirens during the night but should have expected that with it being a city and a weekend.  Food - breakfast was amazing, so much to choose from! There was an omelette bar to have them cooked to order.   Drinks - we didn't fancy any of the cocktails on the menu but they made us one at request in the bar :)  Pool & gym - loved the pool area, great for a swim with a massive hot tub. Gym was better than expected too as I hadn't seen any photos of it beforehand,
Comment Title: Lovely hotel and leisure club - will be back

Comments: We upgraded on check-in to a suite at a special rate and it was definitely worth it for the space (especially as the weather meant we spent more time in the room than planned!).   The room was, however, very cold, so much so that they actually provide two oil heaters in the wardrobe! You would think that they would've sorted the proper heating by now.   Breakfast in Walter's was lovely, typical full spread expected at a Marriott (although minus hash browns for some reason!).   We used the gym/pool/sauna/steam room on both days we stayed. The gym is an 'OK' size providing there aren't too many people there. The big downside is the changing room which has enough lockers but only one bench for changing, gets a little too cosy when there is more than one person trying to get
Comment Title: Great room and bar area, nice breakfast but cold room!

Comments: We stayed in a family room with two king sized beds, very comfortable and clean. The staff at this hotel really are exceptional and nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast was very good, all quality fresh ingredients. Location is very central. I really would recommend this hotel.

Stayed here over Christmas for three nights and overall a fine time was had by all. Christmas Day  lunch was a jolly affair replete with an ad-lib champagne reception and pianist – nice touches. Service in the restaurant was excellent given how busy it was – Maria our waitress deserves a special mention. The bedroom was well appointed. Yes, very 80s but none the worse for this and plenty of space. A little bit of fine tuning is needed however. After lunch coffee was served in Starbucks pint mugs – not really in keeping with refined festive dining! The Palm Court bar needs some thought. It used to be very vibrant and stylish  with lovely settees and arm chairs. Nowadays its closed and the handful of chairs provide a melancholy, forlorn feeling harking back to better days. Cary
Comment Title: Still a pleasant base but some shortcomings

Comments: Two nights in a superior rooms on 3rd floor for 30th and 31st Dec. Stayed here previously a couple of summers ago. Good hotel and location not so sure it's 4 star though. Looking tired in places. Comfy bed clean room and public areas. We had a problem with the hot tap in the bathroom and the TV not working properly but these were soon fixed after we reported the problems to reception. Breakfast the normal buffet style. We were at a function in the King's Suite on new years eve. Wasn't impressed with the set menu/food. Soup was OK, main -braised shoulder of beef with mash, was like a school dinner.. I didnt like the beef at all. Can't say what dinner would be like in the main restaurant as no time to try but it didn't look very busy either evening
Date of Review: Sue G wrote a review Jan 2017

Comments: Myself, my daughter and grandson all stayed here for one night after going to see Torville and Deane in Cinderella at the Bristol Hippodrome. We were very pleased with the service especially the room service team who cooked pasta especially for my grandson. We were also given a bag to put some food in for during the day for my grandson at breakfast which we thought was a very nice touch.
Date of Review: Susan F wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the years. Parking is good, as it has its own underground carpark. To enter the car park it's necessary to cross a cycle lane and a footpath so beware. Even when you're in the entry tunnel of the car park there is a surprise pedestrian crossing.  It is a grand old Victorian hotel with some beautiful public rooms. However as is common with Victorian hotels the rooms are very variable, there are also later additions to the building.  On this occasion we had a very good room that looked out over the cathedral. Some building work is currently taking place to the adjacent building.  Lots of new mattresses were being delivered to the hotel during the three days we were there.  The staff are all very professional and pleasant. We are looking

The pool is opening at 8am, 2 hours later than it should and the complementary drinks vouchers afford small house wine that is like vinegar or draft pints - and this purports to be a good hotel. Please bring back Swallow, Marriott are destroying the goodwill
Date of Review: Jeremy J wrote a review Dec 2016
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 31 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Toqiz  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay here with us at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable experience for our guests it saddens me that we were unable to achieve our goal on this occasion.   Our leisure facilities are open between 8am and 9pm over the festive period to allow our staff the opportunity to enjoy the holidays, please accept my sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused. Your feedback regarding the drinks vouchers has been taken on board and relayed to the appropriate hotel teams. We thank you for your comments as all feedback is highly appreciated to help us provide a better service moving forwards.   Should your travels bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity to improve your experience with us.  Many Thanks  Felicity Walters

Comments: We stayed 2 nights in mid-December and decided to give ourselves a treat and booked a Royal Suite. On checking-in we cited that the website had stated that there was free parking for suite reservations, which the receptionist said was not correct. Later we confirmed with the duty manager that there were no parking charge. The royal suite had a wide entrance hall, large octagonal shaped sitting room with windows on 5 sides, a good sized bathroom and nice bedroom. We noticed the small portable oil-filled radiator in the sitting room and subsequently found out that you do need this to get the room temperature up to a reasonable level. (I wouldn't like to stay in this room if the weather is really cold). The living room carpet and sofas were stained. We tried to get the television
Date of Review: Peter B wrote a review Dec 2016
Comment Title: Lots of small issues, not a 4 Star hotel at the moment
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 30 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Peter B  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. We pride ourselves on delivering a memorable experience for our guests but unfortunately we have fallen short on this occasion.   Your comments regarding your various issues have been taken on board and shared with the appropriate hotel teams so that we may improve our standards moving forward. We are currently busy planning a refurbishment to the hotel and we look forward to work beginning on this is the near future.   Should your travels ever bring you back to Bristol we would love the opportunity of improving your experience.  Many Thanks  Felicity Walters

Comments: What a fantastic place if you like a nice healthy meals then you will feel at home in the Marriott. It has some wonderful rooms staff make you feel at home as a result you just relax and let your hair down if you have any.

Have stayed in this hotel many times, it is very convenient for Bristol City centre attractions and right next to the waterfront area bars and restaurants. The hotel does look a little tired but surely this is part of the attraction for a grand hotel in a busy city centre. The restaurant has just been refurbished and looks modern in comparison to the majority of the hotel. I think the car park charges are fair considering how much it costs to park elsewhere but I agree the spaces are a bit small and when I visited ther were several taken up with scaffolding. My one gripe was that the night I stayed it was very noisy from a Christmas party. I was on the 3rd floor and the noise certainly carried to my room. There was a lot of noise from College Green way into the night as well

We arranged to meet some friends for a pre-Christmas get together at The Marriott. Unfortunately it was the Friday before Christmas so the hotel was heaving with scantily clad party goers who all seemed to want to smoke outside the front door; as the bar is by the front door, you end up freezing to death every time the door is opened!   The bedroom is nothing to write home about...its a standard room, but a bit run down.   My husband left his iPad in the room, and we didn't realise until late on the evening after we departed by which time we were miles away. I really would have thought that someone from the hotel might have telephoned us to let us know that they had it as it would have saved us a lot of time and effort getting it returned if we'd had known before we left Bristol!
Comment Title: Rather tired and in need of some TLC
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 26 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Jane_eyles  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. Creating the best experience possible for our guests, especially around the festive period, is of the greatest importance to us. We have sadly fallen short on this occasion. I would like to express our most sincere apologies for the guest challenges you experienced.  In regards to the Ipad I have passed your feedback on to the appropriate team to ensure this was an isolated issue which is corrected moving forward. I am hoping we have since been in contact regarding your Ipad, however if this is not the case please could you provide me with the details of your reservation and I will be able to look into this for you.   If you should ever find yourself in Bristol again we would love the opportunity of improving your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters Guest Relations Manager felicity.walters@marriotthotels.com

Comments: We've stayed in Bristol several times in various hotels but The Royal Marriott is the by far the best if you like Hotels as they should be, BIG reception, wide staircases, marble everywhere... I loved it you can just imagine Al Capone and his henchmen walking in (you'll see what I mean if you go there) friendly staff, parking, nice comfortable rooms, cocktail bar & perfect for shopping in Bristol, 5 mins from Cabot Circus, the waterside is even closer with bars, shops, restaurants, if you like hotels as they should be then give it a try, we will definitely be staying there again. We did not eat there as we ate with family outside so 4/5 as I cannot comment on the dinning. 😊😊
Date of Review: Simon B. wrote a review Dec 2016
Comment Title: If you stay in Bristol stay here.

Comments: Often I stay clear of Marriot as in the US they can be so variable in standards. But glad I stayed superb room, staff couldn't be more helpful just a perfect de-stressor after a really hard day. My first stay in Bristol so can't compare like for like but would stay at this hotel again without pause. Not that expensive either!
Date of Review: Gregg H wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: Upon arrival the car park was full, which was a bit of a pain. It meant we had to park some distance away, which was okay for checking in as we were able to drop our bags at the hotel but difficult for checking out as we had to lug everything with us for the walk back to the car.  At check-in, we found out that our room was a Queen superior and not a King superior. I was disappointed about this, as whilst I know a choice of bed can't be guaranteed, I do feel that because we checked in later in the evening, we didn't get our choice. I also requested particular pillows at the time of booking that we didn't get either. Small touches that would have made our stay more enjoyable - but that the hotel didn't deliver on. I questioned this with the staff but they just said the hotel was
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 20 Dec 2016
Response comment: Thank you Emma for taking the time to provide us with such valuable feedback, we were very sorry to hear of the catalogue of shortfalls you had experienced from you recent stay with us.  Please rest assured your comments will be discussed at length amongst our operational team for future learning's, particularly the impact our customer service has on the whole hotel stay.

Comments: The rooms are a comfortable size and have a view of the harbour. The service is quick and pleasant and very helpful. Its located in a great part of Bristol within walking distance to many bars, art galleries and shopping. Great spot to stay in to explore Bristol.
Comment Title: Great comfortable stay by the harbour

Comments: Have just returned from a one night stay at the Marriott Royal, having taken my mum away for her birthday. It made for a perfect base, with both the city centre / cabbot circus and Clifton within walking distance. Rooms were lovely and spacious. We booked a family room with two double beds which were super comfy. Staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to make our stay, allowing us to check in early and even delivering a mini fridge to our room (they don't have mini bars) as we'd bought cheese at the Christmas markets. Breakfast was an additional £10 per person and consisted of a good buffet so definitely worth the money. Only downside was that wifi, though free in the public areas of the hotel, wasn't free in the rooms. Parking was also pretty costly at £16.
Comment Title: Perfect hotel for a mother, daughter visit

Comments: When we arrived you are treated to a wonderful hotel that looks to have been renovated but kept the grand hotel feel about it. We were abit worried as there was Christmas parties & a football team staying that it would be noisy but we didn't hear a peep despite being on the first floor, great location for walking to the city centre literally a few steps away. Breakfast was amazing so many options. The whole place oozes class and quality finishes make the difference.
Date of Review: Daniel G wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: Hotel was lovely, staff were friendly and polite, bed was beautifully comfortable and the room was in a good state of repair and very clean. The additional costs of parking (£16), breakfast (£17) wifi (£5) were a bit sharp. Also, I drive a tiny car, which was still a squeeze to park in the on site car park! Very tightly packed in spaces.  I would be happy to stay again, but wouldn't make a bee line to the Royal for another overnighter in Bristol.

This is a great hotel but needs a bit of modernisation.  Great staff, good service.  The car park is a bit pricey @£16 but the breakfast is great.  A little way out of the city centre but in a great location for the non- shopping attractions Bristol offers in abundance.

We had four nights in lovely comfort. The bedroom was spacious  dark when the lights were out and very quiet. The breakfast bar was satisfying to everyone's tastes. We also had an excellent afternoon tea.

Amazing building from the outside and looks welcoming BUT inside could do with sharpening up.  The car park is designed for small cars and building works meant negotiating the ramps and the floors were a bit hairy.  The entrance from the car park was less than inviting. However the staff were good and welcoming and helpful.  Christmas dinner in a private room was pretty good and a good atmosphere.  Breakfast is decent and standard fare.  Check out took a while because there was only 2 staff on the front desk at 9am.  WiFi didn't work in my room and the hotel put me in touch with the provider but it could not be fixed.  Wifi worked outside of the room perfectly ok
Date of Review: Bob B wrote a review Dec 2016
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 18 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Bob B  Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. All feedback is highly appreciated and we have taken on board your comments.   I am pleased to let you know that a refurbishment of the hotel is being planned for the near future and we look forward to seeing the results. We are currently under going some necessary construction work in the car park which is unfortunately out of our control. This does make it slightly more difficult to navigate, however we appreciate your patience and understanding.   As we pride ourselves on providing a memorable experience for our guests we hope to see you again soon so we may improve your experience.   Kind Regards  Felicity Walters

Comments: We arrived at the Bristol Marriot with high hopes. The first signs that perhaps it wasn't going to be the trip we expected was when the satnav from booking.com took us onto a cobbled street with no hotel in sight.  After a quick call to the hotel and a new postcode, we arrived at the hotel and were met by very friendly reception staff which was lovely.  Our expectations however were let down by the room. I had booked a suite and was expecting a 4 star experience.  The minibar (which was no longer a minibar), was also not a fridge - however there was no notice to that effect and so I put some drinks in to chill, only to find them at room temperature after we got back from dinner. This was disappointing - however that was just the start.  Being that we'd booked a suite, I
Date of Review: Daniel J wrote a review Dec 2016
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 19 Dec 2016
Response comment: Thank you for your detailed and valuable feedback, we were very sorry to learn of the challenges you experienced during your recent stay and will be sharing your comments amongst our team, however, it was good to know your issues were resolved.

Comments: My partner and I visit Bristol often. We decided to book a suite at this hotel for a night and if I'm completely honest, my expectations were a little higher.   For several £££ for one night the suite was very average. The size of the suite was great - however the place looked as if it had been robbed; very bare. Perhaps would have been worth the money if a little effort went into decorating the room with more accessories etc. The bed was also rock hard unfortunately, and we did not manage to get an ounce of sleep - when mentioning this the second morning we were given 20% off the room rate which was a good enough gesture I suppose.   The hotel itself is a gorgeous building and decorated very nicely inside - A shame about the restaurant. Although the restaurant continues the
Comment Title: Gorgeous building BUT so much room for improvements
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Heidi M, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 16 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Kirsty,  Thank you for taking the time to offer your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we apologise that we have unfortunately fallen short of your expectations during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apologies for the disappointment you experienced with us not only in our restaurant and bars but in your bedroom too. Please be assured that we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Bristol.   Kind Regards, Heidi Mobbs Front Office Senior Supervisor

Comments: Very very poor experience at your Christmas event on Sat 10th Dec, how you can say it was a "Christmas Party" is beyond me, felt more like a funeral. Moved from the Kings room (where we were last year) across to the smaller room. Not one Christmas decoration, no host, no music. I mean really... A Christmas "Party"   Upon asking where the music was I was told "Our Director thought it was better without music" ...There were just 5 tables in that secondary room, if music wasn't going to save your event what was? A shocking decision by your "Director"   Anyway your team then tried adding music in the room via two PC speakers (possible 5 inches high each)... again terrible. You werent caring to a 13 year old listening to youtube in his parents bedroom you had people who had paid to
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Director Of Events at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 15 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Amish,    Thank you for taking the time to comment on our Trip Advisor page as well as our other social media forums in regards to your attendance and experience at one of our Black and White Masquerade Balls at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.    As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable event experience to all our guests, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal for you during this event. Again please accept our sincere apology that the theming, atmosphere and room lay outs did not meet your expectations. We notice from your feedback that there were several missed opportunities for us to take into consideration, we have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel teams to ensure your feedback is taken on board moving forward.   Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service for all our party guests. We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us should you return to one of our parties next year   Sincerely,  Holly Angelinetta  Director of Events  Bristol Marriott Royal holly.angelinetta@marriotthotels.com  01179255100

Comments: Stopped here one night as attending a Christmas party nearby. The hotel is architecturally impressive, a grand entrance and sumptuous decor. We parked in the underground car park (£16 for the stay) which was very convenient. Our check in was quick and friendly, and we were impressed with the size of our King room (especially the enormous bed!).  We went for a dip in the pool, it was again very beautiful to look at and had all facilities working - spa, sauna, steam room.   Upon returning from our party at around midnight  we had to use our room key to get in the front entrance, no problem. I was thirsty so we went to the hotel bar and asked for a soda water. The barman asked if we had swiped our credit card on check in which we hadn't as we do not like to leave these details and
Comment Title: Very nice, but could be better

Comments: This is a stunning hotel that is extremely well maintained and presented. Throughly enjoyed our stay in a fantastic room overlooking the courtyard. Breakfast was delicious and the staff were both polite and helpful. I will definitely stay here again!
Date of Review: Conor B wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: We chose to have our works Christmas party at this wonderful hotel for the 2nd year running and were not disappointed . The hotel is so beautiful and especially at Christmas, open fires, warm welcomes and lovely atmosphere.  My husband and I chose to stay over again as to enjoy the whole weekend in such a vibrant city,the location is excellent for this and we were surrounded by lots of entertainment from the harbour side to the city. Our welcome to the hotel was lovely as we were checking in a waiter served us complementary hot mulled wine and warm mince pies.  I was able to book a last minute hair appointment within their leisure suite too. Our room was stunning and in keeping with the style of the hotel.
