The party was great fun and our colleagues from InHealth had a fantastic
Date of Review: Lois P wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: I normally stay at the Royal Marriott when I visit Bristol but if I am honest I have been slightly irritated by the gradual decline I have witnessed over the past 25 years. Indeed that is probably the reason I have never reviewed it before. But I always return and this is why.  The Royal is superbly located between the fabulous shopping centre of Cabot Circus and the more independent and beautiful Clifton, and right on Park Street.  There are loads of bars and restaurants within walking distance so you're not trapped in the hotel.  It is a magnificent Victorian building that is interesting in itself. It serves a good breakfast from early to late morning. It has nice leisure facilities with pool, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi.  The staff are helpful and will give you a quiet room if
Comment Title: Still my favourite place to stay in Bristol

Comments: We stayed here recently for one night and thought our experience was splendid.  The hotel has apparently been in existence since the 1860s, though thankfully it's been updated since then.  It is well-located next to the Bristol Cathedral and the river, and just a short drive from the Bristol Temple Meads train station (about 20 min, 8 GBP cab ride).  The bed is comfortable and the room was quiet.  The view of the river was great (ask for a river view if you can).  The bathroom has a shower in a full-size tub.  The breakfast was excellent.  Service was excellent.  We would stay here again and we were glad that we chose this Marriott over the other one in town.
Date of Review: Anna P wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: Having stayed here a few months ago I thought this would be a great place for my family to stay whilst visiting me from Spain. They were happy with the rooms and spa facilities but the restaurant service and food was dire. We waited for over an hour for our starters to arrive and the same for the main. A 2 hour wait for measly portions was not worth the wait! When we complained we were told that they were very busy that night but the restaurant was about 10% full so I can't see why! One of the meals was so bad we had a refund for it. I would maybe stay at the hotel again but definitely skip the food!
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 11 Dec 2016
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to offer us your valuable feedback, please accept our sincere apologies for the poor service and food quality you experienced whilst using our restaurant, please be assured that your comments have been shared with our executive chef and F&B manager, who join me with their apologies.

Comments: Stayed here for one night on business.  The building is beautiful and historical, and is in the middle of Bristol. My room was very large, and I was spoilt for choice with two double beds in the room to choose from.  The room was very clean, and although not very modern, it suited the building it was in.  I ordered room service and although I enjoyed the soup, the "Greek salad" was not very enjoyable and I didn't finish it. A weird honey type dressing isn't necessary- some good quality olive oil would have sufficed.  Breakfast was a standard buffet which is good for getting ready for a long train ride home, and they even offer to put your coffee in a take away cup.
Date of Review: Doug B wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: We stayed here on a three night weekend break from the Marriott website which included breakfast and evening meal on first night.  The restaurant and bar food were excellent, we were quite prepared to eat out, and there's plenty of choice nearby but chose to eat in as it was so good.  Rooms are in a separate block, so even though there were pre-christmas functions and a wedding in the main hotel, they did not disturb residents.  Underground car park is secure but spaces are tight.
Date of Review: Paul S wrote a review Dec 2016

Comments: What a lovely hotel, well maintained with excellent service. Large rooms with all amenities, delicious breakfast, and a pool worth a visit. Central location along the water with plenty of nice restaurants in the vicinity.
Comment Title: Nice historical property and excellent service

Comments: I've just checked in, only to be told that because I paid by MasterCard I was not entitled to the breakfast I just paid for, included in the room rate. Apparently if I'd paid by Visa my breakfast would still have been included as I was promised. Totally unapologetic front of house staff. So angry that I am shaking with rage. Possibly the last time I stay in the Marriot. As far as my morals are concerned, such behaviour falls within the category of dishonesty.
Date of Review: Iain W wrote a review Dec 2016
Comment Title: Extraordinary behaviour by this hotel chain
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 5 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear Williamiain  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel.   I am very sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with your experience with us. For your stay you had booked on a special promotional rate where you would receive complimentary breakfast if you paid using a Visa card. Here is a link showing you the rate rules which you would have had available to you before making your reservation. http://promotions.marriott.co.uk/tcvisa. I would like to apologize if these rules were not made clear enough upon making your reservation.  We value all feedback so we are able to create a better experience for our guests in the future.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters Guest Relations Manager

Comments: I thought my stay at the hotel was very nice although I would not eat there again the food was nice but I was waiting there for about an hour for my food. i never even got the drink i ordered. The rest of the hotel was good the beds were very comfy and the staff were very kind and a good swimming pool. The hotel was quite pricey but the rooms made up for it. I would stay there again but i would eat out.

I booked the one night break leisure package in a king sized room and was looking forward to using the leisure facilities.  I was surprised therefore to be told the reason there were no dressing gown and slippers in the room was because these were for suite guests only - surely anyone on a leisure break should be given these?  But in fact we barely used the leisure area as it was so dirty. When I told the girl on the spa desk she just said it was because they were busy!  I was really disappointed by this, having booked this hotel especially because of its facilities.  The hotel staff though were great, (especially on reception) as was the bedroom.
Comment Title: Good service but leisure package not as expected and a dirty leisure centre
Response from hotel staff:
Response from Felicity W, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 2 Dec 2016
Response comment: Dear LondonThelma  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent stay with us here at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. I am very sorry to hear that the experience you receieved was not up to standard.   It is true that bath robes and slippers are only provided in our executive rooms and above, but i understand your comment on guests staying on a leisure package would also benefit from having them as well. I will pass on your feedback and see if we may change this moving forward. I have also passed on your feedback to the leisure team regarding the cleanliness of the facilities. This is not the usual standard we like to provide and we hope to make sure this is an isolated incident.   I hope that in the future you will choose to stay with us again as i would love the opportunity to improve your experience with us.  Kind Regards  Felicity Walters Guest Relations Manager

Comments: A lovely, professionally run hotel.  We had a family room - 2 king size beds with views across College Green with ensuite with bath.  Very impressed when we arrived.  We were given the option to book breakfast for the next morning - £10 per adult, under 12 year olds free, so we booked this.  The pool and spa was free to use, and was open from 6 am to 11 pm, closing at 8pm for children.  A lovely pool with large Jacuzzi, a sauna and steam room with showers and water fountain - this was one of the main reasons for choosing this hotel.  The changing rooms are a little tired and old looking, but on the whole, we were very impressed.  During the night we experienced the downside to a view over College Green - Saturday night is quite busy in this area, it seems.  Did not get such a
Date of Review: j w wrote a review Nov 2016

Comments: Yes a bit pricey but got a good deal and the room I got was excellent. Clean, very spacious and generally a calm and classy atmosphere. The staff smiled whenever i walked past them and were incredibly friendly generally.   I'm not sure what more you would want for a room. For the same price on that night I could have got a budget room in a budget hotel but instead I got a great room in a great hotel.

well located..old structure..good check in.lines at breakfast..passing through a noisy bar to get to the lifts is a pain..comfortable unremarkable room..poor food quality in room service..noisy hotel..shower with a weak and intermittent flow...
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 30 Nov 2016
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your valuable feedback Sumeet.  Your comments will be shared amongst our operational team for future learnings.

Comments: We usually go for Premier Inns or similar but the Marriott was available for almost the same price so we treated ourselves and really enjoyed it. Big room, proper nice bathroom with shampoo etc, pool and spa, an air of comfort. We went to the late night bar after our concert and enjoyed the ambience. Would stay there again; also very central location.
Comment Title: A lovely stay in a grand hotel with old fashioned style

Comments: As a surprise, I booked a long weekend at this Hotel for my wife's birthday. We were booked to see Billy Elliott on the Saturday evening & I wanted something a little upmarket to make the weekend special! How disappointing it turned out to be. I could write pages but to summarise is probably more appropriate: - Room Service Used the 24 hour menu on the first night - the food was uncooked & reheated. Used Room Service at 5.00pm on second day & it took 4 attempts to get through - quality of food much better but really expensive - beware! Afternoon Tea Although both Lounges were fairly busy, the service was appalling, with many customers complaining! It took 25 minutes to order a drink, the staff were delivering the wrong orders to the wrong tables & we didn't receive a bill. I

Response comment: Dear Russell,   Thank you for taking the time to offer your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel. Comments: Central location with parking Good views Cosy rooms with old fashioned decor but in a luxury style Comfortable beds Lovely bathroom Old fashioned but in a nice way Good afternoon tea Amazing breakfasts Friendly staff

Beautiful building in the heart of Bristol ,Great service, friendly helpful staff, excellent location to explore Bristol, great restaurant with great food and service. excellent base to explore Bristol
Comment Title: Excellent location to explore the city

Comments: Stayed here mid week was lovely overall but have stayed in much much better hotels for the price.  Felt like you were paying for the brand not an experience.   Rooms were nice & comfy but missing something you know a bit of zing.  Could of been in any hotel anywhere didn't feel special for the cost of the room.   Rooms were specious and clean. Good facilities, hair dryer, nice to, iron, tea & coffee etc all the things you'd expect from this category hotel.   We had afternoon tea to celebrate a special occasion it was nice again nothing special the drawing room felt very dated and it felt like the staff from the coffee shop area couldn't be bothered to come over. Again for the category of hotel we expected a lot more.  We wouldn't come here for afternoon tea again.   Location of
Comment Title: Paying for brand not value for money
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 28 Nov 2016
Response comment: Dear Lotty,  thank you for taking the time to provide us with your valuable feedback, we were sorry to learn of the challenges you experienced during your stay and the shortfalls you were met with, it was not our intention to mar your stay.  Your comments will be shared with our team.

Comments: The Marriott and SPG clubs have just merged and I organised my link after I had checked in but reception were great and organised everything as though I was a platinum member with Marriott - which I am now!  Free drink at the bar, free wifi etc. The only disappointing part was the reception supervisor refused to waive my £16 parking despite being asked by her junior colleague. It was a disabled car with a blue badge and left a slightly sour taste as we all checked out of our three rooms.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 28 Nov 2016
Response comment: Thank you for your kind and positive feedback, this will be shared amongst our team.  We are sorry we were unable to make any adjustment to the car parking fee.

Comments: We stayed here in 2 rooms as a family for two nights. Staff were helpful and friendly, rooms well appointed though a bit tired. Location was perfect for a short stay in Bristol- plenty to see and do. Plenty of choice for breakfast. Would recommend staying here.

Didn't get the rooms that we had requested when making the reservation. On booking I asked for adjoining rooms and rang at least four times to get it confirmed between booking and date of reservation. Each time it was confirmed we had the interconnecting rooms. We arrived in two groups. First group were told we had interconnecting rooms. Second group were told we had interconnecting rooms but we had to wait until the clean was finished which was fair enough. However when we got our rooms they were not interconnecting. We were not happy.
Date of Review: Mandy S wrote a review Nov 2016

Comments: We booked the Marriott in Bristol as it was the nearest hotel to our concert venue. The room looked clean and tidy but the waste bin hadn't been emptied and contained the rubbish from the previous guest. Not the end of the world but it doesn't give you much confidence in the standard of Marriott's house keeping. The biggest problem was we were woken early the next morning by builders filling a skip. When we looked out of the bedroom window all we could see was scaffolding where builders were renovating the adjacent building. At the very least we should have been made aware of the problem when we booked in. Please see photos.
Response from hotel staff:
Response from BRSRY, Guest Relations Manager at Bristol Marriott Royal Hotel
Responded 28 Nov 2016
Response comment: Thank you for taking the time to offer your valuable feedback.  We apologise for the guest challenges you experienced during your stay and will pass on your comments.  We agree, and have instructed our teams to inform guests of the works being undertaken on the adjoining building during the check in process.
